title: Stylistic Gun-Fu Creates Legendary Character
text: Introducing the biggest on screen BAMF of the last decade, Mr. Wick AKA Baba Yaga. And a huge comeback for the apparently never aging Keanu Reeves.John Wick screams cool, except he is actually a man of few words, and the coolest characters usually are. He has one of the coolest cars ever made, has great style, but most importantly he's second to none when it comes to dealing out death. The gun fighting these movies have become known for is incredible. I really enjoyed seeing the different martial art styles, especially judo.As the viewer we are introduced to this classy underworld of assassins that live by a code. This is of course delved into more during the sequels. The colour theme is mostly dark throughout it's entirety, other than flashes of neon as seen in the club scene. This is consistent with the sequels, and I love it.The first entry is superior to it's sequels. Sometimes less is more. This is easily in my list of top movies, and one of which I do not get tired of. Also comes complete with a fantastic cover.

title: Non-stop action!
text: I can honestly say that I love this movie so much, it's one of my favourite film series to date. John Wick is a character that demands respect whenever he enters a room, people know not to mess with him, or his stuff should they face consequences. This movie is non-stop action scenes and it's very engaging (now I'm not a professional MA) and it looks realistic too and well thought out. Also, the music is very powerful and adds so much more tension to the scenes, it grabs the audience's attention and ensures that they stay focused. Even after years of release, I can't find a fault in this film, every detail is thought out and the storyline is interesting and allows for more progression as the movie series expand.

title: Great Action, Lacking Premise
text: Going into this film I had high hopes regarding reviews all around. Is Keanu Reeves back? No. Does Keanu Reeves excel in the role of John Wick? Yes, but not many people couldn't. This film lacked in every way possible regarding substance. When I say substance I am referring to the plot, acting, and overall feel.Yes Keanu Reeves acting was on point, yet everyone else in the movie seemed like straight to DVD actors (trash). Especially the villain Michael Nyqvist. Such a corny performance. If by my taste I was reviewing this movie I would rate it at a 4. Thats a weak 4. But I am going to put myself in a neutral position since action movies aren't my forte. To conclude, if you are in love with action films please see this movie! You will love it. But if you're more of a Bourne Trilogy kind of action film fan then don't. Story could have been understood by a toddler. Yet this is rated R? What kind of adults just watch movies for explosions and gunfire. Let us relate to a character.

title: John Wick
text: John Wick, directed by Chad Stahelski & David Leitch, who are former stuntmen; was a substantial amount of fun, with a lot of heart and thrills. Stahelski, Leitch & Kolstad not only made a very appealing action flick, but a great emotional story, that packs a big punch, that makes you truly care for Keanu Reeves' character.Keanu Reeves shines bright in this film, not only because he is the lead, or because of his stellar acting, but the fact he takes part in almost all of his action scenes! He steals every single scene he's in, and you can tell he had a blast doing it. As for the rest of the main supportive cast in Michael Nyqvist, Willem Dafoe & Alfie Allen go, there prodigious acting went a long way, considering there come abouts was pretty random, and out of the wood works. I did appreciate the new story they bring along to flesh out everyone's character.The screenplay by Derek Kolstad was deep and intriguing, and essentially the leading hand behind everything. The dialogue he brings to the table is profoundly enjoyable.The action was shot, and executed super well! The hand to hand combat was unique and flowy, while the gun fights were so precise and energetic. The only real issue I had with the action, it seemed to be just a touch over done with plot armor, so it took away from the dramatic effect a little bit. Stahelski & Leitch did a good job of showing vulnerabilities throughout the action, to show that Reeves is just a man like everyone else, so it definitely helps the plot armor.The cinematography by Johnathan Sela is dull and quiet for the most part, but it works so well with the tone and mood. I wish the effects were done a little better, but that is just a little nitpick because it was tolerable nonetheless.Overall, this film is a ton of fun, backed up with some great action, and solid acting all around.

title: The expectations must fit the purpose of each genre. And here they do it, fully.
text: Nine years after its release, I've seen the first film in the John Wick saga for the second time. It's necessary to contextualize this review by saying that my first viewing was marked by a feeling of alienation from the film. I didn't enter into the proposed dynamic, because I saw it from the wrong prism. John Wick should be seen as an action movie, which seeks to entertain with spectacular sequences and not looking for complex or even realistic plots, within a real world to the extent possible within the action genre.Well, now that I understand its mission, I think it's a very entertaining and fun film, with its own marked style that clearly differentiates it from other films within the same genre. A storyline that finds its foundation in something sentimental strong enough to wake a sleeping animal is what sets off an unprecedented massacre, courtesy of a relentless and unstoppable killer. There's a good dose of humor, always derived from the action itself, which is greatly appreciated to balance out the carnage a bit. Lastly, the overall performance of the cast falls with catlike cushioning within a simple, yet very dynamic script.I still think it's not a masterpiece or anything like that, but at least my opinion has changed, supported by a more open disposition to the cascade of bullets and blood that John Wick provides.

title: A breath of fresh air for the action movie genre!
text: What a movie! A definitely didn't have any expectations for this going into it back in 2014. And it completely blew me away. Extremely well choreographed and believable action, reloading is actually a thing, the gun fu is soo entertaining and i like the story. It's very simple and to the point, and that's ok. Performances are also great from everyone involved. I also adore the subtle lore of the underground assassin community. It's not in your face and half of the film isn't just exposition. The lore is presented in an organic way and it has some mystique to it, which is hard to find. The only reason i'm giving this a 9 is because i wasn't a fan of the final battle, which was, truth be told, very anticlimactic. Otherwise, incredible film!

title: English please
text: Former Hitman John Wick after losing wife falls into a state a depression, until he's delivered a dog as a parting gift from his wife. Finds some ounce of hope when all of sudden the son of Russian crime boss takes all that away from him and now he's seeks revenge. In many ways John Wick returns to that old formula of the 80s that made action film so popular. You have an absolute badass protagonist nicely choreographed fight, the sequences and intense high level action sequences. Everything from the music to the casting like Ian McShane and Willem Dafoe are all great decisions. Keanu's always been man of such charisma and personality as a whole. Him as John captures that Stoic killer. The build up around John doesn't come off as simple fluff. Who he even while your never really given much on that outside the villain monologues. The way he presents himself with such seriousness from that he walks to the moment he does start killing it lives to the hype. The facts that everyone in that line of work seem to know him. The crime boss himself knows who John is in Mango's fears, and respect him regardless of his position The shootouts are amazing swift precision and foot movements mixed with the hand to hand combat leading to some brutal blows. It's not all played in a matter of being so of over the top that it takes you out of it. It captured that belief of a trained killer without having to going to far. It's not like he's invulnerable he gets cut and stabbed and tossed around. It makes the film more investing when you have that uncertainty that the lead might not make it out situation.

title: This movie will blow you away!
text: I came upon this from who knows where, and my jaw dropped when I was watching it! A new breed of American action movie conceived by stunt coordinators and executed by a dedicated actor that does his own stunts/fighting. Kinda how Hong Kong movies have been made, but this action tops most of those too!

title: You have to crawl before you can run, or so IÂ´ve heard
text: You have to crawl before you can walk, or so IÂ´ve heard of the franchise. I have only seen the first John Wick movie and IÂ´ve heard it only gets better from here or so you would hope so. I think John Wick is an influential action movie in the modern era. It started to challenge the terrible action in the 00Â´s and demanded more from what we expected a good action flick to do. It dared to stay in the action, dared to not cut all the time, dared to actually have a choreography and for that you have to be grateful of this movie. Is it perfect? Not at all, itÂ´s a pretty cookie cutter movie, but what it set in the sea for the future of action is great and overall, you have a fun concept movie that no doubt will entertain you.After being attacked in his own home and having his life taken from him the hitman John Wick comes out of retirement to seek revenge.What this movie does best is itÂ´s action. The different set pieces and execution is so thrilling and brutal. It reminds me of the old Hong Kong cinema with guns now. The idea of "gun-fu" comes to mind here. The primarily way of killing is these one-shot, one kill mentality that is so satisfying to see. Top that with an incredible choreography and you have a just stunning action movie. This movie doesn't cut all the time or has a lot of shaking camera, to hide the troubles' of shooting action, but dares to stay with the characters and not move. I think you can cut in an action scene; I think you can use a less stable camera to have effective action sequences, but this movie showed us in a modern setting the satisfaction of having these still cameras and long takes to have the most satisfying action sequences. Having a movie challenge a new norm is always incredible. Coming of just watching Kick-Ass (2010) that did not have the greatest action but from a director that also is going to produce incredible action later in his carrier, really makes you appreciate a just good action sequence.I have heard some critique about John Wick in terms of the movie going on longer than it needed to. Not really the runtime, but that John Wick the character is hyped so much up to be this unstoppable killing machine that itÂ´s insane he gets' some stormtrooper aim and getÂ´s overpowered a lot. The movie explains it away with him being rusty, but I also like the explanation that not all hitmen are specialized in everything. I see Wick as a close combat fighter and whenever he misses his target in the middle of the movie, they are always moving and further away, we see his more up close and personal with knifes and guns and having a character showing a different skill, Marcus, makes me think there is some merit to it, this theory is a bit botched later in the movie though but I still like to think there is some truth to it, maybe later movies are going to prove me wrong.The other aspect this movie does great is establishing lore without over explaining it. The continental and the hitman order is not overexplained and have a million lines dedicated to it, you just have to pick up context clues and build the rest of the world up yourself. The relationships and characters are all so well written because they have so much story to them without actually showing any, you can easily imagen how these people see John Wick, the hitman order, how the villain is, what happened in the past. ItÂ´s all greatly set up subtext that isnÂ´t affecting the story in the best way possible, not wasting your time with too much chit chat and just going for a pure action experience.Sadly, the acting isnÂ´t the best here, it can sometimes feel like too much of a clichÃ© action movie in the best and worst way possible. The dialogue is cringe at times and there is not really any actor pulling off their characters a 100% This really hurts the overall experience in my opinion. Top that with some really over the top scenes and effects and you have a movie trying too hard at times. Keep it low key and you got it, trying to overdramatize and you have a bit of a weaker movie.I actually liked the score and soundtrack, even though it could be a bit on the nose and clichÃ© at times. Overall, it works for the movie but just fades into some background noise and generic action flick music.This story is very cookie cutter and that helps it and hurts it. The movie can feel like itÂ´s a bit too many empty calories since itÂ´s nothing more than a simple revenge plot, a few fun interactions in between the next action set piece. The story and characters arenÂ´t really that important, same with the overall relationships and characteristics of the characters, which weakens the impact of the movie to me. I just needed a bit more to really make it hit home.But overall, the impact this movie had on the action genre is great since it challenged the generic weak action slock that was dominating the 00Â´s. An era where you didn't have to try in terms of action, since no one really seemed to care too much. Now people expected a bit more from their action movies, they expected to go back to an era of stunts and practical care, where some sense of reality is actually a part of the movie. Sets have to be built, choreographies have to be learned and cameras have to be stable and dare to stay with the action. This is only a great thing this movie did!John Wick is a movie I really like but will never find amazing. I think itÂ´s impact, action and overall concept is phenomenal, but everything else lessens the impact and make the movie a bit too generic. While itÂ´s special in so many other ways, it falls into some classic action movie traps, that lessens the impact it was supposed to have.

title: What is the world coming to
text: The film is so contrived. You know what's going to happen from the off. Character development and everything is so basic it's laughable. You could have got a film student to write and direct the entire thing. I'm flabbergasted that people actually think this is a great film. What's so unique about it that no other film has got. The acting is wooden, the scenes unbelievable and this just a payday for those involved. Trust me, you've seen it all before. If you're willing to put all common sense behind you and take everything at face value then perhaps this film is for you. Oh my god, it's just finishing as I write, and I can't believe the final scene! Now I know this film was rated by kids for kids.

title: 50 words or less
text:
Pure action and bloodfest. Ex-Hitman takes revenge. 
Wick's motive can only be a joke. Instead of a violent death of his wife, his motive is a dead dog. Probably a statement: "Never mind the reason, we wanted pure action."
Stoic characters. Little substance, but plenty of style, blood and action.

title: A movie that has grown on me overtime
text: Plot: An ex-hit-man comes out of retirement to track down the gangsters that took everything from him.This film has grown on me overtime, I at first didn't like it but I realized that it was because when I went to see it at a free screening, I was seated up close to the screen not letting me enjoy the experience throughout. Since then in order to get ready for the sequel, I re watched this and was generally surprised. This film has a feel of an old school 80-90's action flick using wide shots instead of shaky cam for the action and I love it, every action scene works to its advantage and showed how capable these directors are. Keanu Reeves is in my opinion an underrated actor that should get more respect, and I'm glad that he got a lot of praise for this film cause he deserves it. I don't want to shortchange the rest of the cast because they are also really good including Ian McShane, John Leguizamo, Alfie Allen, Michael Nyquist, Adrianne Palicki, Willem Dafoe and etc. Palicki and Nyquist are the biggest surprises to me especially since I wasn't a big fan of either of them, but they both surprised me in the end.In Conclusion, John Wick is of the best revenge films that I've seen in a while, this film and its sequel should be lessons to producers of Hollywood in how to make an action film and how they should make them from now on.

title: An underrated action movie
text: A friend of mine had see this movie and told me to go and watch it. I asked him what it's all about. He simply said that it's about a ex-bad ass coming out of his retirement to kill other bad asses. Of course I wasn't that interested because this kind of plot has been done to death. Over the time I heard a lot about this movie and decided to watch it, and boy, this is truly one of the best action movies of the year.Keanu Reaves has done most of the stunts himself which has given the movie its realism. No action scene in the movie looks artificial, even the gun shooting scenes had a certain realism to it as you can see them reloading their guns at proper intervals.All in all this is an entertaining movie and specially a treat for the lovers of this genre and fans of Keanu Reeves. Don't expect many twists or shocking moments from the story as it is quite simple, but it doesn't matter because even if they have kept the plot simple, they have executed it to perfection.In the movie, there is scene where a character says, "John Wick is man of focus, commitment and sheer will." After watching the movie, I couldn't agree more. Enjoy :)

title: A strong action series debut.
text: John Wick (1) is a good debut for a fantastic series. While certainly lacking in the panache of its two successors, John Wick does what it needs to (mindless gun toting madness) to be enjoyable, if a little routine.

title: straight forward or poor
text: I haven't seen no preview to it and went to see the movie based on the good reviews here on IMDb. - After I saw it last night, I've got to say that they weren't describing the movie at all honest. - That's why I decided to put out my view of the movie on here.It all starts and already falls with the poor script: some described it as a straight forward story. I just remained asking "where is the d**n story?"What you get presented with in this movie is a - up until the end still - flat character, who is taking revenge for the loss of his dog shortly after the death of his wife, who also gifted him the dog. So this John is described as a professional with amazing focus and at the same time with great inner rage, why he ends up going for his revenge no matter the consequences. But the movie doesn't succeed in delivering this believable character combining both these extremes. He sometimes is forgiving and other times scrupulous. It doesn't add up... It rather gave me the impression, that he is "nice" to people, so they can come again later and make the movie longer. But so is it on the other side with the "bad" guys, too. Why are they sometimes "nice"? I couldn't understand.If you though look from the prospective of the storytelling, it makes sense. It delivers more movie-time! There are a couple of scenes, where it became very obvious, that whatever was going on was for the single reason of prolonging the (rather non-existent) story.What remains most prominent of all this watching time is seeing many head-shots of faces, you can't really make out enough to have some kind of emotional response, other than the excitement of the fighting itself.I liked the music though. It's fitting to the excitement of this one man offense.I hope with this you can better decide for yourself, if it's worth your time and money.

title: Keanu Reeves is back in style
text: John Wick is one of the best action movies to come out this year, and possibly one of the best of this entire decade. Now don't go into it expecting a Best Picture nominee, but go into it expecting Keanu Reeves to kick some serious ass and you won't be disappointed. Is it predictable in parts? Yes. Is there some cheesy dialogue? Yes. Does that hurt the movie? Not at all. It's exciting, exhilarating, stylish, incredibly violent, and deserves to be seen multiple times in the theater. I cannot recommend this movie enough. Also, if you don't have a dog, that might change quickly after seeing this movie.

title: It was aight. Keanu Reeves did his job with stunts as always.
text: While the fight choreography and action sequences were done very well and certain cast members were good to see in the movie, it's definitely not THAT amazing of an action film and not my favorite. Maybe I'll like the second one better and I want to give it a chance, but one disturbing scene in particular toward the beginning that drove the main character's motivation and arch prevents me from really liking this movie, along with the general tone and vibe that it had, sorry! (Shrugs shoulders)

title: Nothing but entertainment,a silly good movie.
text: This movie screams Kill Bill + Sin city. Don't expect anything but fun , violently fight , shooting , killing scenes. The movie is full of dream cars, dark humor ,handsome man who can kill 300 people over 2 hours. Perfect movie for people who enjoy the action scenes.The script and lines are fantastic ,none of it bases on the reality ,almost like the comic. It's very enjoyable and very entertaining.I love how they mix imagination of the Russian mafia and the assassins world together. A lot of details like gold coins transactions are interesting and give the movie more novelty.I don't think it's a good movie for kids though.

title: great action scenes not a good story line and plot
text: If you like this type of actions when every second is action after another and you enjoy realistic one by one fight scenes this is your movie but if you like to see a nice story line , a good plot , great characterization and a good twist and anything meaningful you should ignore it .it was full of cliches and a 10 year old could write this plot . just a mediocre film like most of the action films they make these days. if you want to see a great action movie see oldboy (2003) for example great character building great story line , great acting , suspenseful and realistic fight scenes.or one of the most underrated action films "in-time" that is meaningful has an interesting story line and has a message despite being in action genre . i don't know why people who make action movies think action movie genre is an excuse for putting a lot of action scenes together without attention to plot and characterization

title: Best action movie in long time
text: Since i was born because of the influence of my father and grandfather, action movies have always played an important role in my knowledge for films. As many reviewers have said before at first glance the title John Wick for a film seemed ridiculous, therefore whenever the movie trailer came out as an advertisement on youtube i would straight away skip it. I did watch the trailer once and thought it was terrible, to me it made no sense at all. However one day i decided to watch it clearly because i had nothing else to watch or do at that time, and so my review begins. The last good and by good i mean really good action film i saw was Lone survivor but for me that a different category not really action. John Wick on the other hand is pure 100% action, no Expendables type of action no Fast and Furious type of action not even James Bond type of action, THIS is something else. First of all it clearly shows how well Keanu Reeves trained for this film i don't know if it was Kravmaga or something else but it was incredible well done and looked very realistic. Second of all the story is just very cool, i like the fact of how the hotel runs with important rules etc.. and Russian mafia i mean that makes it cool too. And just to finish the thriller part plays well in the story and how the actors act. Great movie for anyone who loves and knows how to appreciate a good action films.

title: Very Good
text: A very good idea. It is one of the best action movies of recent times. They've done a very good job. Think about it, when I watched this movie for the first time, I didn't like it. Now I think it's a very good movie. Now everybody loves John Wick. Good movie.

title: Better than average action movie
text: Keanu Reeves is a very under rated action star as this movie clearly shows. OK he isn't the bet actor in the world and has a very limited range of emotion but for this movie he was perfect.The story is a good one and yes it has holes in the plot but you don't watch this kind of movie as if it is a work of art.Keanu sure can carry off the action and is very convincing. There are inconsistencies in his ability and it does stretch credibility that he can take severe beatings that then have no affect or even markings on him, but this is more of a cartoonish action movie than one you watch for realism. I did think it was overly violent in places and don't watch this is bad language offends you because there are places where it gets over used.Over all it is a good action movie that those who like this stuff will love.

title: John Quick
text: John Wick is most likely the most realistic, fast paced, bloody and insane action movie ever made. Despite some scenes taking you out of the moment, John Wick was a good surprise with a fantastic pay off. It feels so original and fresh that you instantly get into all the fast actions sequences and the story (unlike most in it's genre) is quite great and easy to follow.Whilst John Wick isn't quite perfect, it adds all the ingredients for it to be the best action movie ever made. It almost pulls off the impossible, but a few touch ups here and there would have made this film one for the ages.

title: A really long ACTION sequence
text:
As an Indian audience, we think why Hollywood doesn't offer over the top action movies, and this one proves us wrong. A really over the top action movie, enjoyed almost every bit of it. The adrenaline kept pumping as the movie progressed. Loved how the director managed to convey the emotions so seamlessly. A f...... Bad... Movie . Please fill the dots ( it was a positive response). The main character is kinda like the superhero that we all wanna see in a Hollywood movie. Even though at certain points i lost my concentration, the majority of the movie didn't loose my attention, some action scenes was 'no blink' challenge, if at all u blinked you loose all the action.
The direction was on point. I definitely have to praise the guy in bringing about emotions in such an intense action packed film and also in that restricted duration.
The cast, well only one guy needs to be appreciated and you know who that is.
The story, well there isn't much of a story. That might be a negative of the movie. The premise of super short.
Overall its a good movie

title: An intense return to form for both the action genre and Keanu Reeves
text: I will start by saying i haven't really been a fan of many strictly action films that have come out in the last 5 - 7 years, until now. John Wick is a mostly well paced action film with many really awesome and intense action sequences that actually really surprised me. This film i feel just revived the action genre, well for me it did. It was so fun to watch while at the same time getting increasingly more interesting the more twists the film took. One thing i also loved was that once the action begins, it doesn't really take many breaks, it just keeps going with fight after fight and not one bit of action felt forced, it all made sense in terms of the plot. Lets talk about the plot, at first this movie seems like your average action film about someone who gets something taken from him and seeks revenge. But that quickly unfolds to reveal more and more secrets about who John Wick is and who the people he is hunting are. The movie felt like to me a perfect mix between 'Taken' and 'Hostel' making for a surprisingly awesome action film. In terms of the performances, i felt that everyone in this film portrayed their characters really well, in a way that felt pretty believable. But the most importantly, this felt like a real comeback to the action genre for Keanu Reeves, he was incredible in this movie, right from the beginning you are really backing his character and are cheering him on right to the end. I believe he can really take over from Liam Neeson and be the new face of badass action if only this film got the attention it deserved. The only issue i felt stood out was that the third act of the film although was still very entertaining and intense felt a little more rushed than the rest of the film. But other than that this film was a very pleasant surprise and restored my faith in the action genre. I love the world they set up in this film and cant wait for the sequel or any other films they decide to set within this world. - 8.1

title: I thought that it would get on my Wick, but it didn't!
text: John Wick (2014) -I was pleasantly surprised by this one. I hadn't expected much and after the first death I wasn't sure that I was going to like it at all.Keanu has never been an actor that I've ever regarded that highly. He always seems to be playing a permanently stoned teenager, which doesn't really translate to being an action hero and it's good that he doesn't say much here, because I think that's when he gives his best performances.However he was surprisingly good and the action fighter guy thing suited him. Other than Ted 'Theodore' Logan I think that this is probably his best role.I don't know why, but I also appreciated Michael Nyqvist in his role, he seemed quite effortless.And Ian McShane's cameo was enjoyable too, an interesting character that I hope reappears in the next two films.The dog was very cute as well, so the bad guys deserved everything they got.I liked the fight sequences and how the film was all put together. There was obviously some thought put in to the editing and story boarding in the first place and I liked the music that was appropriately used too. It worked really well to accompany a fairly rock and roll film.I also liked that it wasn't very long. It utilised a simple revenge storyline, that didn't need hours to explain and without it getting bogged down in complicated twists and turns and too much of the "Whose side are they on" idea.Overall a fun action film with an ease that so many others lack.666.77/1000.

title: best action movie for years

title: Really disappointment :( :(

title: Best Action Movie
text: The title and cover makes it look like a B-grade movie. However, the fighting choreography nicely linked with background music and dialogue lines that shall ever be remembered has made, in my opinion, a stand out of most action movies of the year and even the decade. I have seen many, many action movies, sure the Raid/2 has better action scenes, overall John Wick with the fighting choreography with music that set's it alight and the lines have made John Wick a great movie, it is a definite must watch and must buy.10/10 It has been a long time since I've seen an action movie where I was like, "Wow, this is really, really great!". Buy it, it's worth the money.

title: This's what I need!
text:
'Was that the Boogeyman?'
'He's not the Boogeyman. He's the guy you send to kill the Boogeyman.'John Wick was really depressed with the death of his wife. Furthermore, he lost his dog which she gave him as a member of his family. So he got very angry and his terrible revenge begun then. The revenge tragedy didn't contain the mind game, he just chased the target and bushed everyone who interrupted him up! I was so excited it on even such a simple setting.
