title: Ballet of Death and Condemnation
text: In most stories of revenge, the protagonist seeks redemption. With 'John Wick', the protagonist ultimately condemns himself to the hell he worked so hard to escape from.Overall, this film breaks away from the shoot-em-up genre in highly experimental and refreshing ways. You have a protagonist who has made a living taking the lives of others and managed to escape that world to experience a heavenly existence for a brief time. The spectre of his past returns once this heaven (his best friend and loving wife) is taken away from him and he plunges irreversibly back to the hell that he had attempted to leave behind.What most stands out about John Wick as a character is his vulnerability. In the first sequence of the film we see him break down crying when he receives the gift of a puppy from his dead wife. Even though he's killed countless people, he's retained his humanity and needs a companion to love in order to be complete. This all gets taken away from him through an act of malice and greed which leads to the death of the gift of love from the dead. As he buries this gift of love and digs up the instruments of death he'd attempted to leave behind, he's also leaving his temporary heaven and returning to the endless hell that he's truly given his life to.The choreography, editing and set design were all superb. Unlike most action films, there were very few edits in the very long action scenes which required expertise among both the performers and the crew. This film was sorely overlooked by awards ceremonies in all three of those categories as well and rightly deserves more critical acclaim for accomplishing what seldom few action films even attempt.What else stands out is that even though this film is full of violence and death from beginning to end, very little focus is given to the gore and splatter. At times the death blow isn't even shown. This elevates what could have been another run-of-the-mill shoot-em-up to a graceful ballet where the human emotion involved takes precedent to the base acts of violence.One area that did lessen the enjoyment of this film was the use of music. Much of the score was too overt which distracted from the telling of the story rather than heighten the drama. Too many times the music was melodramatic and cheesy, even utilizing the sort of ambient sounds you'd only expect in cliched television shows.As a whole, this film was innovative, cinematic and a refreshing variation of a genre that hasn't seen this type of new approach in a long time. There are many questions about John Wick as a character that are left unanswered as well as about the underground society he's part of and that seems to permeate every aspect of the world he lives in but the imagination of the viewer does a good enough job of filling in the blanks that this aura of mystery enhances the enjoyment of the film.

title: A Samurai with a gun
text: This isn't just a revenge movie. It goes much deeper than a man going on a killing spree to avenge the death of a puppy and stealing a man's car. John Wick lives by a code very similar to the Bushido or a medieval knight. This movie is about honour and keeping your word no matter what the consequences may be. It's also about honouring the memory of those who have departed. It's almost like a fantasy world that exists beneath the normal world where the criminals work with their own currency, their own kingdoms and laws. In this universe the criminal underworld live by a very strict code of rules that if you break them you will die. This movie is about the consequences for one's own actions and how they end up affecting the people around us.

title: i thought this was anime
text: sure nice fight scenes, but feels repetitive midway through. cool physical hand-to-hand combat with use of handgun, and other fight choreography. but that's seriously it. the world of these underworld hit men is decently well crafted but definitely not used to the fullest. it's like having made a really nice world for a video game, but not creating a story for it, when this is supposed to be a movie. isn't it more of a demonstration or trailer for what it could be? story line is lame. something a 10yo kid who watched some anime could think of. hence the title. actually it's worse than anime. it's not even close to being called a story. i could easily think of more better ways to kill john wick. come on, these mob guys stupid or something? pretty sure they're not. you have the money. use a friggin' bomb or a squad of rocket launchers or something. movie would have ended at 15min. holy hell please you want testosterone? yeah this review definitely came from that. and i'm laughing about it

title: typical action movie with some great twists
text: Legendary assassin John Wick (Keanu Reeves) retired from his violent career after marrying the love of his life. Her sudden death leaves John in deep mourning. When sadistic mobster Iosef Tarasov (Alfie Allen) and his thugs steal John's prized car and kill the puppy that was a last gift from his wife, John unleashes the remorseless killing machine within and seeks vengeance. Meanwhile, Iosef's father (Michael Nyqvist) -- John's former colleague -- puts a huge bounty on John's head.Confusing, weird, and slow-paced in the first 30 minutes; however, after that, the action begins. Nevertheless, it doesn't last for long, as the slow (but interesting) story telling recurs, leading to one really fun action scene. On that note, all the action scenes in the movie are beautifully choreographed. Fast forward to the end, the final fight scene was simply amazing, but I felt that it was a bit too short; It left me wanting more.After a series of unsuccessful movies after The Matrix, Keanu finally finds something to bounce back. He was perfect for this role with all the charisma and intimidation he possesses, not to mention the really solid support cast around him from William Dafoe to Ian McShane, Lance Reddick, John Leguizamo, Alfie Allen, Bridget Moynahan, and others.I found the way they displayed the translation and highlighted the key words really interesting too. The music, especially the one associated with action scenes, is perfect and goes really well with the mood the movie exhibits.Score:7/10.

title: best hitman ever made
text: 20th century's godfather or the latest hitman, we could call it either way.The kind of introduction given to the hitman by the villain shows how strong the protagonist's role was in his earlier life, passing on this message to the audience without portraying even a single scene itself shows how powerful the writing is.There are just so many characters in the film but still, it doesn't feel complex and is made in such a way that it's conveyed in a subtle way w/o any introductions or lengthy dialogues.The action sequences and con-man kinda stylish execution makes this film watchable even today after 8 years of its release showing how well the action choreography was made.The story/plot is so simple where the protagonist goes on a ride for personal vengeance, not for the usual reason but a slightly tweaked personal reason and that's where the character's depth is also conveyed.This film is purely for those hit man kinda movie watchers and not for the general audience as it might bore them.

title: Stylish but shallow
text:
What I liked:
I liked the stylish color grading, and the stylish fantasy of the assassin's secret society, where assassins are smartly dressed, pay for services with standardized gold coins, and are shown respect by so many people. The music was also quite appropriate for the feel of each scene.What I didn't like:
The plot was simpler than I hoped. Some plot hooks were set up in the middle of the movie, but many of them were resolved in an anticlimactic, straightforward way. Also, the fight scenes were too often unintelligible - just rapid-fire movements and gunshots meant to show how badass John Wick is, rather than making me understand the situation and wonder how John will get out of it. Finally, I didn't understand John Wick's motivation for his final fight, or the reference to a "code" that was mentioned around that time, or why a certain female character agreed to something near the end.

title: Simple, stylish and technically strong action movie
text: A bereaved hitman goes on a brutal revenge mission.The writers cleverly establish sympathy with the main protagonist before sending him on a blood-splattered rampage with an 80s/90s era bodycount.If you enjoy seeing continual scenes of violence, killing, and moments of torture then you will probably love it, as it showcases many action sequences that look slick and hit hard. All the gun play, martial arts and general violence are choreographed with flare.The cinematography, editing, colour grading and general art design are aesthetically very strong. Great care has been taken to set the tone and generally make Keanu Reeves look cool as he struts about dispatching baddies to the sound of rock music.It helps to be a fan of Reeves as an action lead. He looks the part, does the physical work brilliantly, has soulful eyes, and delivers certain lines very well like "Do I look civilised to you?". However, when it comes to the going through a greater range of emotions I think he has some limitations.The baddies are pretty one-note, so it is really just an exercise of watching the action unfold and appreciating the level of filmmaking skill required to create such spectacle on screen.

title: Cheap plot, unconvincing portrayal of mafia, animal cruelty. As bad as it gets
text: The poster looked really bad, specifically the suit, so did the summary of the plot, but since Kianu was playing I had to give it a shot. The movie starts really bad for the viewer when the unnecessary killing of the cutest dog every occurs during the first few minutes. I was that close to stop watching the movie, but I said to myself, it's a multi million dollar budget, Kianu is in it, if they did something so cheap as to kill a dog to grab my attention may be it will get better. It doesn't. The plot is dirt cheap and clichÃ©. Sad portrayal of the mafia, unconvincing cast, poor choice of music. No thrill, it's just a really bad movie. Remind of Steven Segal movies after Exit Wounds (which was good).I can go on about why the movie it got worse but I won't since I bet many people worked hard at it and I don't want to hurt their feelings, it just didn't work that time, in all aspects. The only good thing about the movie was the appearance of Ian McShane and the move with double shooting the guys in the head, the sound too may be. Everything else was like equivalent of action soap opera.

title: FINALLY A GREAT ACTION MOIVE WITH A GREAT PROTAGONIST
text: Really good movie and give it a watch you wont be disappointed. The action is intense and constantly occurring the reason of behind the entire plot is a little fun one and you are always rooting for them main character till the end. It may feel clichÃ© at times. But it is still soo good. Well-crafted action: The movie features well-choreographed, realistic action scenes that are executed with precision and skill. The fight scenes are visceral and entertaining, and they keep the audience engaged throughout the film.Strong lead performance: Keanu Reeves gives a powerful performance as John Wick, bringing depth and complexity to his character. Reeves portrays Wick as a man with a tragic past who is seeking redemption, and his performance resonates with audiences.Supporting cast: The movie also features a strong supporting cast, including Ian McShane, Willem Dafoe, and Adrianne Palicki, who bring depth and personality to their roles.Cinematography and soundtrack: The movie's visuals and music are also well-regarded. The cinematography is sleek and stylish, and the soundtrack adds to the film's intense atmosphere.Overall, "John Wick" is a well-crafted movie that combines a unique premise, intense action, strong performances, and impressive cinematography and music to create an exciting and engaging viewing experience.

title: 1983 Buick Regal- for sale, some rust, still works- make an offer
text: I'm glad so many people like this movie because I figure SOMEBODY has got to like this movie. A little dull. Many skilled actors given sh*t to work with. Lots of action to forget the real world, but so sterile. Like, I've never seen gun violence so repercussion-free in my entire life, just fire a bullet into the air, no problem. I would say my major complaint is that the movie is not exciting- despite a lot of gore and gun violence ( which is good, it works for me ) it all so obviously happens in a slick fake world that there's no sense of danger for any character. title: 10 For my Entertainment

title: Keanu's showcase of talent
text: As the only Keanu Reeves movie that I've ever seen, I'm glad it was as good as this one. When it comes to action movies, many fall flat (the exceptions being Kingsman and James Bond). The one man vs. the world is a great plot and is executed wonderfully. The backstory of John is mysterious and is revealed throughout the film. He's a wonderful retired guy and it is super entertaining to see his relationship with others. The antagonists are more like drones run by a leader as opposed to people. A great part of this movie is the cinematography, especially how it works in tandem with the choreography of the fight scenes. Even outside of these amazing fight scenes, the cinematography does not falter and is complemented by the beautiful lighting used in the slower dramatic scenes. Look out for the subtitles too, they are sharp and dynamic.

title: One of the best action shooters or all time.
text: John wick does something really special here. Keanu Reeves is astonishing is John wick here. His commitment and level of training is second to none when he's doing a great action film. No stranger to The matrix and other films that require him to learn martial arts and true gunplay he took up the task and was the Clearly is the best man to play John wick.I should go into exclusive detail into why this phone is so good as an ex film school graduate... Let me just try to simplify it and dumb it down a little bit.. this is completely genre bending in the sense that they have taken the role of an assassin and issue them up film and they have changed the entire nature of what we can think or know or feel about a shooter assassin film with someone set out in revenge. John wick clearly has a very large vendetta which is placed quite aptly as it should be. This film does something to the genre that no other shooter has ever done which is they have added a level of class sophistication high class and gentleman's guide book sort of sophistication to the entire feel and plot of the film. Ingeniously adapting the concept of the Continental to be a cornerstone of this exclusive high class feel they have recreated the genre in a way that has never been done. This film deserves to be considered one of the best action shooters of all time for its contribution to the genre its ability to be something completely different and change the game forever for all future films.

title: A fun action flick with a terrific main lead
text: John Wick tells a story of an ex-hitman, whose wife recently passed away due to a heart condition. After a group of thugs break into his house, kill his dog and steal his car, John goes on a bloody path of revenge and does whatever is necessary to find the people that caused him so much pain. This movie is an exhilarating watch from beginning to end. Keanu Reeves gives an amazing performance, his best since The Matrix. He does a lot of amazing stunts and whips ass like there is no tomorrow. The story is simple yet intriguing and never drags. The villain is a little weak but that's a minor nitpick.John Wick is relentless and definitely deserves your attention. 9/10

title: The "Baba Yaga" returns.
text: Thrilling story-telling is built by the villains to ensure that the entity that they have reawakened will be the last one they face. Although the topic of interest is often overhyped, he still lives up to his name by literally massacring his way through hordes of hired work to claim his vengeance. Aside from Taken, this is probably one of the more popular and well-made hit man movies.

title: a movie about an extreme overreaction, containing only bad guys
text: Very poorly written and executed.More importantly, the protagonist is worse than the "bad guys".A huge body count over a car and a dog.I have no sympathy for John Wick. A crazy, evil man, just like the people he goes after.The only decent character is the dead wife.I could forgive that -- if the film had some other redeeming attribute. It does not. (loved the series Dexter, and movies where the protagonist is an awful bad guy but there were excellent scenes of violence etc and interesting characters).I am glad I paid nothing to see this movie, but upset I wasted my free Redbox movie on it.

title: Great material here!
text: I like this movie. It is really good and I highly recommend you watch it right now instead of looking at this review. John Wick is about a retired hitman who seeks vegence against the person who killed his dog. The dog was a gift from his wife who had died from an illness. Keanu Reeves in this movie... dude this is the best we have seen out of him, ever since The Matrix. The action scens are absolutely brilliant and well choreographed. title: One word to describe this moview: "Oh!"
text: John Wick was a really positive surprise for me in 2014. I don't know why I didn't write a review back then, but I want to correct my mistake.John Wick may not exactly be a master piece in the story department, but the simple premise of the revenge story after the bad guys do something horrible to the main character just works perfectly fine.The background of the character becomes quite clear very quickly and you don't really need to know much more. John Wick is a very focused character and if you get on his bad side you will know that you've made a mistake.John Wick is very powerful, but he also isn't invincible. So it is interesting to follow him along while issues more and more dinner reservations. And overall it ends for me in a pretty satisfying way.

title: Wick Shines Bright
text: John Wick is a great revenge movie with a big and fast growing body count because a dog was killed - even Bronson or Eastwood can't beat that story indeed. The first John Wick was and is a pleasure to watch - great action and Keanu Reeves is finally back on the top. But I must admit, that the other three movies (John Wick: Chapter 4 released these days) are - despite lots of action and a fine production - a blur of action and fighting scenes. I watched the fourth movie these days but gotta confess that I have real trouble to remember anything that happened in Chapter 2 and 3. Anyway, the first movie is a have to watch movie if you dig the genre of revenge and hitman movies (if you don't know it yet) and after that one you can decide if you still want to follow the tour de force of John Wick.

title: Fast, Violent and Original
text: Keanu Reeves' John Wick is the excessively stylish, resilient and vengeance-seeking protagonist who introduced the true action blockbuster. Chad Stahelski executes this story beginning with a seemingly quiet man in a seemingly quiet life, which is unforgettably perfect when it suddenly connects to its first loud and brutal fight scene. Reeves delivers a fine performance, which then leads along with acceptable character development. But once that action switch is turned on, it remains on!The shock of the first action sequence really raises our hopes for the rest of the movie, especially considering that John Wick's themes are centred around the revenge of a former assassin. Thankfully, the movie really forces through and lives up to our hopes. There's extremely violent action sequences that are stylish in combat, but the plot is actually really easy to concentrate on which makes it an easy watch.Wick's enemy is certainly a very finely constructed antagonist, as we root for Reeves' character as he fights for vengeance. The whole plot, from start to finish, is also very entertaining and watchable. But the best thing about this action-thriller is that it creates a legendary protagonist who matches perfectly with the action-thriller genre. There's frequently stylish and thrilling moments of activity.If you liked this review, check out the full review and other reviews at aussieboyreviews.

title: 2023 rewatch
text: I was planning to skim this so I could watch chapter 2 but I couldn't' not watch it' again in its entirety .Even knowing the plot , which is simplistic but so well executed, I found every minute to be done so beautifully. It has stood up really well over time , the imagery feels appropriately timeless .Nothing feels forced or outlandish with the storyline and certainly not with the action ,which is quite a feat. I also find Keanu believable and excellent as John Wick.. Fortunately I won't have to wait for another installment or two !I am not big on rewatching anything and typically won't, so this was been absolute unexpected pleasure !

title: Good action movie
text: If you looking for an action shooting movie this movie might quench your thirst. With a good story and packed with high-quality fighting scenes this movie will makes you enjoy the two hours that you spend watching it.

title: Nothing like Bourne
text: John Wick is a big disappointment, in part I suppose because I erroneously inferred that since it was a trilogy and involved a contract killer in trouble because of his past it would be along the lines of the Bourne trilogy. Definitely not. There is nothing intelligent in this film at all. It's essentially a long concatenation of brutal homicides, all supposedly justified because some evil Russian mobster killed John's puppy and stole his 1970 Mustang. Really?It's total overkill, literally and figuratively, and I cannot recommend this blood bath to anyone who does not spend hours a day playing push-button whack on whatever the latest mass-murder apps are being sponsored and promoted by the Pentagon these days (in the hopes of recruiting newbies for their drone program). Ugh.Given the gross disproportionality of the revenge killing fest here, I'd say that the one redeeming quality of John Wick is that it is a perfect metaphor for the entire War on Terror. A handful of criminals kill 3,000 innocent people in NYC, so let's go annihilate another million or so!

title: Keanu + Hitman = BADASS
text:
"John Wick" one of the best action movies I have ever seen. That's it, that could be all I said and it would be enough. I mean really, this movie is so great, when it ended I was searching for something that wasn't right and I really struggled to find a scene or moment I didn't enjoy.Let's get the minuscule negatives I have with
this masterpiece out of the way. For one I didn't enjoy the last scene and thought it was forced. I also didn't really like what led to the 3rd act of the film and thought it was one of those things that had to happen to continue the movie. That's it. That's all the negative points I have to say about this movie because frankly, the rest is awesome.Keane Reeves is amazing in this movie and so is everyone else, but his role in this cannot be understated, he gave it his all and it shows. The action is at points orgasmic and has such fluidity to it I found myself jaw-dropped at points.The story is also pretty good, making us totally understand why John Wick decides to do what he does and while it's not revolutionary, it doesn't need to be because, in the end, this is an action movie with some of the greatest action I have ever ever seen, incredibly interesting characters and dynamics, superb comedy at points and that's all I wanted.Basically flawless!A

title: Solid, Solid, Movie.
text: I appreciate that they took their time in the opening act. While I generally don't think Keanu Reeves is that great an actor, he's used effectively here as a stoic and broken man in the beginning.Great choreography and grounded set-pieces throughout the entire movie. They pull the camera back and just let Keanu blast fools apart as cleanly as possible. My only nitpick is that John Wick judo throws people way too much. I dunno, I know nothing about real gunfights but I feel like you can't spend too much time tumbling goons to the floor.Also, I thought the ending sequence was fine but not up to par to a lot of the other parts. Also also, they got Willem Dafoe and I kinda wish he did more stuff. It's the freaking Green Goblin bro, come on.

title: One-Line Review: John Wick (9 Stars)
text: There is more than a neat and rich gentlemanly dressing up in Chad Stahelski's John Wick than I could handle, making it almost impossible for me to avoid another viewing. TN.

title: Keanu Reeves gives his best performance in years in a strong action spectacular.
text: Former assassin, John Wick (Keanu Reeves), has left behind his criminal past in favor of a quiet life with his wife, Helen (Bridget Moynahan). When Helen dies of a terminal illness five years later, John is devastated, but his wife posthumously arranged for a beagle puppy named Daisy to be delivered to John after her death. John bonds with the dog and allows John to feel still connected to his wife. When Iosef Tarasov (Alfie Allen), the spoiled, sadistic, arrogant son of crime boss Viggo Tarasov (Michael Nyqvist) takes a liking to John's '69 Mustang following a chance encounter at a gas station, Isoef makes an offer to buy the car which John flatly refuses. Later that night Iosef and his two thugs break into John's home killing Daisy and stealing John's car. After burying Daisy, John sets out on a path of vengeance as he chases Isoef through the criminal underworld while Viggo tries to protect Isoef by placing a contract on John.Written by direct-to-dvd action screenwriter Derek Kolstad of One in the Chamber and The Package, the foundation for John Wick began under the title Scorn with Kolstad seeking to evoke classic revenge and film noir classics with contemporary action stylings. Initially intended for a much older leading man (as popularized by Liam Neeson in the Taken films) the movie was rewritten and shown to Keanu Reeves who soon signed on. Reeves then contacted stunt specialist, Chad Stahelski and David Leitch (whom Reeves had worked extensively with on The Matrix films) hoping they'd wish to direct the film. Stahelski and Leitch jumped at the chance to work on the project with Reeves and the film when released ended up doing nearly double the expected box office that was projected and became critically acclaimed with word of mouth and advanced screenings making John Wick a dark horse that launched the directing careers of Stahelski and Leitch and was hailed as Keanu Reeves big comeback.While Keanu Reeves had major successes in the 90s with endearing classics like Point Break, Speed, and of course The Matrix, Reeves had stepped away from headlining major films following the end of the then Matrix Trilogy and the so-so performance of Constantine. While there were outliers such as The Day the Earth Stood Still remake and 47 Ronin (which originated as a supporting role but became a second lead following highly publicized reshoots) most of Reeves work had been in smaller scale productions or independent films. John Wick is without a doubt the strongest performance from Keanu Reeves since his turn as Bob Arctor in A Scanner Darkly in 2007. Reeves, despite a reputation for a stilted delivery, is very well utilized with his performance one of few words and more of facial expressions and body language with the opening scenes showing Wick's grief for his lost wife that culminates in the delivery of Daisy following her death truly heart wrenching scenes that make you invested in John as a character and helps you bond with the relationship between him and Daisy. And in addition to the physical performance, Reeves is at the top of his game in the action scenes doing approximately 90% of his own stunts and coupled with the strong directorial style of Stahelski and Leitch the action flows smoothly with minimal cuts and expertly crafted and timed choreography.The movie features a fantastic supporting cast with Alfie Allen an effectively hateful villain whose Iosef Tarasov is absolutely loathsome as the entitled preening sadist who serves as the impetus for John's rampage, the late Michael Nyqvist is also really strong playing Iosef's father Viggo whose controlled carefully planning crime boss makes a formidable antagonist for John to square off against. The movie also features some great turns by Willem Dafoe, Adrianne Palicki, John Leguizamo, Ian McShane, Bridget Moynahan, and Lance Reddick who add some strong personality to their characters and add to the richness of the world developed in the film. John Wick has some of the best world building I've seen in an action film with an established order based around this mysterious hotel called The Continental that serves as a neutral haven for the high end criminal element with its own monetary system of gold coins and an established code that when broken leads to undesirable consequences.The one point of criticism you can give this movie is that it's third act feels a little disjointed with the movie having seemingly come to its destination only for an additional climax to take place. While the action is still on point and the acting is still strong, it feels like the narrative flow could've been smoothed out by tying these two climactic sequences together into one rather than winding down from one only to jump into the other.John Wick is a white knuckle ride that despite its budget being on the lower end of the spectrum gives its audiences some of the most exhilarating and thrilling sequences in modern action cinema. Reeves gives his best performance in years and effortlessly handles both the action and acting needed for this protagonist, and a supporting cast of notable character actors brings life to this elaborate world and underworld created for the movie. While the plot does hiccup a little thanks to an additional climax, the movie has enough goodwill to make it a solid addition to any action fans required viewing list.

title: Why only 5 wins?
text: John Wick is a master builder and he has had way more wins than that. He once killed me with a Scar and outbuilded me to launch pad his way to his 700th Victory Royale. title: Classic
text: It is a film born to be a classic. A well-introduced story, a first-rate villain, a setting that glamorizes the underworld, a tragic hero who sees everything good in life run out of him and decides to take action. It is very well told, the cast very well chosen, the direction is careful and for the viewer each stage of the story does not stop making sense and adds elements for the solid finale.Another substantial element is that there are several lucky ideas in the script: the mystique of the Continental hotel where there is always space to park at the door, the underworld code that is charmingly displayed, the friendship and support between fellow murderers... It is very good as entertainment and its repeated vision does not tire. It is a classic and one of the best action movies of the decade.

title: An original action flick that takes you for an awesome ride.
text: The bait and switch that occurs here is fantastic. You start off watching John Wick mourning the death of his wife and rediscovers the meaning of life when he receives a puppy. When things hit the fan, you start to understand that there is more to the protagonist and immediately enter this bloodbath massacre with this complete badass. The plot is simple and yet you clearly understand the motivation and that this is one guy who you don't want to mess with. It's painful to see what happens, but the clear motivation is enough for even us to be onboard and cheering for this awesome character to kill some baddies.Keanu doesn't get a lot of lines, but I thought he worked perfectly well here being such a tyrant with all of the stunt work and action scenes that he had done for this film. Which leads to one of the best things I can say and that is the action. Everything from the cinematography to the choreography, everything was shot in such detail, making this action flick so stylish and fun to watch. There were plenty of times where I reacted out loud just on how brutal or amazing a certain kill was. Based on the motivation of the character, watching him get his revenge is so satisfying, making this stand out from the more recent revenge flicks we have been getting. With so much memorable moments, it is hard to recall which was the most entertaining or which part of the film I had enjoyed the most. Every single moment brings in that necessary punch and not overstaying its welcome by showing too much action.What this film gets right is building its world. You enter this world of assassins and rather than having long expositions that explain what goes around there, you are given enough glimpses and hints of the lore that has you intrigued and wanting to know more. The characters are all suave and each have their own characteristics, making this revenge flick all the more interesting. Everyone from the owner Winston, to even a few assassins that John Wick interacts with has such personality to them, making them quite memorable, despite the amount of screentime they have.Even with its sequels, this film is still so fun to watch and its rewatchable. Definitely recommend this for anyone who loves action.

title: The Power of the Dog
text: A solid action thriller.The first 10-15 minutes are relatively slow, and there is only one action scene in the first act.But as soon as the movie enters the second act, it is pretty much non-stop action, and it was pretty satisfying.The movie is shot well, you can especially feel this in the club/ hotel scenes with neon lights and colorful visuals.What this movie also does really well is the World-Building. There is this hidden, underworld of Assassins. John Wick is already a well-known name in that world, and the movie shows this with dialogues and actions of different characters. There are doctors, Body Cleaners and Hotel Managers. Such an interesting world. (A lot of potential for Spin-Off and Sequels you know)Keanu Reeves is good in the role. John Wick isn't a type of character that shows various emotions or goes through an arc(at least in this one). However he is such a badass & the movie succeeded in making the audience care for him.

title: John Wick Review
text:
A ex-hit-man comes out of retirement to hunt down the gangsters that killed his dog and took everything from him.This film has been recommended to me a lot over the years and yesterday I finally decide to watch it. Did it live up to the hype let's see.For starters this film is extremely well directed. Chad Stahleski created a extremely intriguing world that I've never seen done before in a action film. John Wick is of course the story of a man avenging his pet but there is a lot more at play. We get to see this underground world of criminals develop and it's a extremely well done.Every action scene is packed with intensity and urgency and a huge part of that is the performance given by Keanu Reeves, he is incredible. The way he Carrie's himself is unlike any performance I've seen him give and it may be his best.The rest of the cast is great as well. The villain played by Michael Nyqvist was great which is not something I usually say about action films.In terms of gripes the ending is a little weird. They add a couple of scenes that I feel were cool to watch but from a storytelling perspective the film probably could have ended a little earlier.Overall John Wick is Awesome, the film is packed with quality direction and provides us with possibly Keanu's best performance yet.9/10
A.

title: worst movie of the year 2014
text: Totallly pathetic movie. mindless shooting scenes. wooden keanu reeves.

title: Mindblowing action!
text: Action films nowadays have been a joke. Aside from the Mission: Impossible series, there hasn't been one where the action makes you extremely excited or grip the edge of your seat. Luckily, we have John Wick to show us how action is really done.John Wick is a hit-man who is in retirement but some gangsters take away everything he loves which forces him to come out of retirement and hunt them down.John Wick has a very basic plot. It's a revenge story that's been done many times and hence why its story doesn't feel very innovative but what sells this film is the ACTION! As directors this is Chad Stahelski and David Leitch's first film and they've done an exceptional job. As both of them are stuntmen it's logical for them to know a lot about action and it's evident from this film that they do. Each sequence has a stylish flair present within them and each kill is different from the other which makes this movie so entertaining to watch. The choreography and camerawork is simply perfect. There are some long takes used during the action which increases the intensity of the scene and keeps your adrenaline flowing.This film is filled with action which never ventures into boredom. This is largely due to the fantastic direction and extraordinary commitment by Keanu Reeves. After The Matrix, Keanu Reeves's career did go downhill. He needed something huge to bring him back into the Hollywood scene and John Wick did exactly that. Reeves is perfect for this role. He is the definition of awesome as he possesses this swagger that's present in each scene. His commitment to the action is praiseworthy. You can tell that he's doing most of the stunts rather than having a stuntman to do it for him. It conveys to us how much he cared about this film.Whilst the story is very predictable, the film does do a great job of showing us who John Wick is. Throughout the movie we learn how powerful this man was in the underworld before his retirement. We see how many people are associated with him and the film repeatedly shows how fearful people are towards him which portrays how unstoppable John Wick is.Overall, John Wick is one of the best action films made. The USP of this movie is its action and there is plently scattered across this movie. Keanu Reeves does a fantastic job as John Wick and I praise his dedication towards the film's stunts. If you want to have an exhilarating experience for 1 hour and 40 minutes then John Wick is the film for you.

title: A great fast-paced action film!!
text: The first 10-15 mins is the story build-up and after that, 90 mins of continuous action. The dialogues were impactful with extremely well choreographed action sequences. The camera work was praise worthy and especially they didn't used the shaky camera technique which actually spoils an action sequence. It's a noir/action-thriller genre so the themes are dark. There are no moments where the film loses its grip. A solid fast-paced action film. Probably one of the best in decades.

title: ... for 15 yr old boy's who need a hit of violence
text: Terrible film! Typical mass-produced garbage regurgitated from the same mass-produced garbage from the past. There is nothing original here and was made for 15 yr old boy's that need a hit of violence. Why take the grueling time to write a story when you have another plot you can build on from 25 years ago? With modern movies, everything goes into marketing; this is the new art form. The commercials, the distribution, the target audience, are all far more the focus than the actual content of the film - all in the name of profit. This movie definitely shows Keanu Reeves inability to act at all. The plot was like water and of course very predictable. They really build up his character, then when the fight sequences begin it's like watching something that they did back in the 70's. The movie "The Drop" with Tom Hardy is the same movie really, however 100 times better. Tom Hardy is incredible and has just begun to shine as an actor in film - so I recommend that film over this for sure. This movie is a complete waste of time and I don't normally write reviews, but really had to for this one.

title: A slick and entertaining action movie with a wickedly good sense of style
text: John Wick is a slick and fun action movie with a wickedly good sense of style. The cinematography and style is exceptional. The way they capture a gritty and dark style is awesome. It reminds me of Michael Mann's movies. Great storytelling and setup of the premise. I like how they slowly pull you into the story without telling you everything right away. The mystery is what keeps you watching and wanting to know more. The soundtrack is banging. I like how they got the actress from I, Robot to play John's wife - I like her. The little beagle is so cute, that was sweet how his wife posthumously gave him the dog as a final present. John's got some sick style. His house, his outfits, his car - all real nice and classy.It's kind of weird how he doesn't have an alarm system for his house. I can't believe what they did to John's dog, what scumbags. He gets two things taken from him back to back, a double whammy. I don't blame John for going beast mode. I loved the interaction between John and Jimmy (the officer). This is where you get a feeling for the movie's sense of humor. It was funny seeing the Allstate guy in the movie. He fits in oddly well. It was unexpected to see Willem Dafoe, but I definitely welcomed it - love the guy. Lance Reddick as the hotel concierge at The Continental is so good. Alfie Allen playing Tarasov's son was great - I hated his guts, god what a spoiled entitled cowardly brat.This movie has a surprisingly clever sense of humor. It's a movie that I was surprised to see didn't take itself too seriously. The dialogue is straightforward, to the point but also witty and lively. The choreography in the stunts, fights and gunplay is where the movie truly shines. They're amazing, like watching a beautiful, bloody and violent ballet. The way they integrate martial arts within the gun fights is something mesmerizing to watch. I wouldn't be surprised if they watched older Jackie Chan and John Woo movies for inspiration. There's so much storytelling and backstory that goes on just through certain interactions and introductions with characters without having a full long conversation - I thought it was brilliant how they did that. Saying less is more in this movie and I 100% agree with it. The pacing is excellent.Keanu Reeves owns it as John Wick - kills it. The guy was born to play him. What I love most about this movie is it's ability to be gritty, violent, slick and action-packed while at the same time managing to not take itself too seriously and feel fun. Awesome movie. Highly highly recommend it.

title: The start of an epic franchise
text: The start of an amazing movie franchise. John Wick is definitely Keanu Reeve's best acting performance, up there with the Matrix franchise. Definitely one of his best works. The story (albeit a bit silly with the whole revenge dog plot) was still pretty damn entertaining. The action was top notch and one of the more realistic and gritty scenes i've ever watched. The kills were amazingly unique, the soundtrack went hard and quite a few likeable characters in it.If I had to point out some bad about this movie, I would definitely immediately point out its boring "main" villain. I got nothing against the actor or the character he played, nothing at all, but that final boss fight was lame as all hell. But that's about all the bad I can mention about "John Wick". It's a brilliant action movie with a side of dark comedy.

title: Watching Keanu Reeves kick ass is so worth 101 minutes of my life
text: Almost no plot whatsoever but this man knows how to make an action movie appealing to the audience. Even me who doesn't like these types of movies.

title: Amazing film
text: Amazing film. Keanu Reeves does an amazing job as John Wick. The action, cinematography, and pacing are all super, and the plot is well-executed. Definitely watch it.

title: The Adrenaline Rush We All Need
text: A fun, thrilling introduction to a new world of hardcore assassins, mercenaries, and gangsters, John Wick is the action movie we never knew we need, but are so glad we got. There's elegance and grace to the fighting, the choreography a masterpiece. This first installment doesn't have the most grappling story, but a great one nonetheless. The man himself, Keanu Reeves, sets out in his mission for revenge as John Wick. With the help of friends, Willem Dafoe's Marcus, and Ian McShane's Winston, he hunts his prey in a glorious fashion. This movie is a must-see for any action junkie, and that's a fact, a promise from me.

title: A Man's Worst Enemy
text: Admittedly it feels dragged on for the first few scenes but quickly and effectively proves itself to be an outstanding action drama.

title: A Horrible Waste of Time
text: I wish there was a way IMDb could check and make sure reviewers aren't part of the production crew, cast, or distributors of a film because that's the only possible way this thing could have gotten more than 5 stars from anybody. I have to hand it to Keanu Reeves, though. For a guy who can't act in anything but a "Bill and Ted" movie, he's managed to make a decent living at it--some might even call it a "career." Amazing, because he's got to be one of the worst actors in the industry. Gary Grubbs, Everett McGill, and Keanu Reeves should do a film together. They could call it "The Tin Men." Other than Keanu's absolutely awful attempt at acting, the plot of this thing was laughable and the action sequences perhaps the choppiest thing I've seen on film since that Korean guy did the whole Gangham Style dance craze foolishness. I hate myself for watching the whole thing and I hate myself even more for enjoying it.

title: John Wicked.
text: Bit of prep work ahead of seeing John Wick 3 here.John Wick (Keanu Reeves) a retired hitman is forced back into that life when he's beaten, his car is stolen and his dog is killed by Iosef (Alfie Allen) the son of a Russia Crime boss (Michael Nyqvist). So begins Wick's act of supreme revenge as he uses his very specific skill set to track down and kill all of the crime syndicate.Seeing it again, I was surprised at how much time "John Wick" gave to establishing the character and world before unleashing him. It's probably 25 minutes or so before the action really starts, which is helpful as those 25 minutes are really the building blocks that the three films have been based on. It does go some way to establishing the world of "John Wick" too, with glimpses of The Continental and establishing the rules of the universe that will become more important in the sequels.Acting is not good, as you might imagine, though Reeves has somehow found a way to legitimise his one note deadpan style for Wick. The story is a basic revenge thriller but that's not really why we're here. We are here for glorious visceral expertly choreographed violence that has proved a stark contrast to the CGI heavy or edited within an inch of their lives action films that have been prevalent in the last few years. Though it's only a return really, to how films used to be made, particularly in the "Hong Kong" style, the fact it's been away for a while does make it feel like "John Wick" is special and unique.

title: Epic Action Film
text: Maybe this review is little bit unfair because I like action genre. But this is how I feel about this movie.From the beginning of the film, we know that this person is someone we shouldn't mess with. And although it's a bit long when introducing it, it's really worth watching. The story telling with the visual and great audio.Then when Viggo introduces John Wick is the best scene for me, the feeling when you know something epic will happen. Great, very great.

title: Action film is stylish, entertaining but extremely violent.
text:
If John Wick is the best looking action film in recent memory.it's also bolstered by a phenomenal cast of actors who, be they in parts big or small, manage to craft three-dimensional characters out of stock archetypes.
One of Keanu Reeve's best performances mainly because he barely has any lines but when he does he sure makes them count. The action is superb and never gets dry and every act of violence seems to be justified at a certain manner.
The action is good and very slick. Keanu always at his best when he has zero dialogue and can just do fighting stuff. To call the plot thin would be an understatement. Unfortunately there's only so much Keanu killing people one after another that Can maintain my interest and by the point we're halfway through the killing.
Love the entire series, each chapter of John Wick is a masterpiece to be watched and re watched again and again! Don't miss this.
But Parents need to know that John Wick is a brutally violent, frequently bloody thriller starring Keanu Reeves as an assassin. There's a very high body count: Characters are shot, maimed, stabbed, beaten, threatened, killed with firearms at close range, blown to bits in an explosion, strangled with bare hands, and more. And especially because so much of the violence is depicted in a stylized, semi-glamorized way, it's best reserved for the oldest teens and adults. Interestingly, a streak of humor also runs through it, and fight scenes choreographed so thrillingly that it's almost like watching ballet -- albeit a gunshot-riddled, rough-and-tumble one.Concluding , It's very interesting movie in my mind i just give it 10/10

title: It's good and feels somewhat fresh
text: I liked this film because it follows the formula of revenge but it's not terribly boring. It feels somewhat fresh. There are good believable performances and it manages to hold your interest at a medium level for the entire film. Some of it feels original as well. I like that. The gun work is amazing! The fight scenes are good and the create a world that feels believable. I was able to suspend disbelief for a little while and enjoy this world. To many film today operate with the premise that the audience knows it's all fake. A good film draws you in and makes you believe in the theme of the story, the plight of the characters and their emotions. I'd say this film has some success in doing this.

title: Boring, lacking story, real characters
text: This movie clearly wants to be in the original Taken category but alas, it cannot be. It's just a boring, one note action flick that would be a B movie if not for it's A- list star and obvious polished locations. I like looking at Keanu as much as anyone but him punching a lot of people does not a good movie make. It's as good as the Taken sequels, that is not say not good at all. There is no time spent to create a world behind each character, it's just, here's a guy, punch him, shoot him. It feels like a cartoon for very stupid boys. There isn't a good line in the entire thing. The most memorable scene is a girl entering a swimming pool in high heels.

title: Simple Plot, Complex World
text: The plot for "John Wick" is so simple, that when I first told a friend about the film, he scoffed, saying, "Who needs to see a movie about a guy getting revenge for his dog?" I honestly would've agreed with my friend, but "John Wick" received amazing reviews when it came out, and I ended up seeing it opening weekend, and I was absolutely blown away. Yes, the film has a rather simplistic plot, but the world that it crafts is so much deeper than what you see onscreen (and that world is further elaborated on in "John Wick Chapter 2"). The side characters all have interesting back-stories and murky relations with our titular character; the settings all have specific rules; the twist and turns of the plot are exciting; and beyond all that, the action is spectacular, the cinematography is great, and the sequel is just as good.

title: Action-packed awesomeness
text: I saw here people complaining about simple plotline, no twists and little dialogue. Maybe they expected something like No Country for Old Men. Well, no, it's not that type of movie. It's great though. Simple plot, great camera shots, script does not try to come in the way of entertainment. Combat scenes - awesome, believable, intense. In this category it's almost masterpiece, if only bad guys were more interesting, it'd be 10/10.

title: John Wick Delivers Non-Stop Action and a Compelling World of Assassins
text: "John Wick" is a 2014 action thriller film directed by Chad Stahelski and David Leitch, starring Keanu Reeves in the lead role. The movie follows the story of a retired hitman, John Wick, who seeks revenge after his beloved dog is killed by the son of a Russian mobster. The film received critical acclaim for its inventive action sequences, sleek direction, and Keanu Reeves' magnetic performance.The movie is a breath of fresh air in the action genre, as it deviates from the formulaic approach and delivers a stylized, well-choreographed action film that stands out among its peers. One of the most significant strengths of "John Wick" is its clear, concise storytelling that doesn't overwhelm the audience with unnecessary exposition. Instead, the filmmakers use the visual language of cinema to convey the backstory and motivations of the characters, making it easy to invest in the story.The action sequences in "John Wick" are a treat to watch, with the filmmakers opting for long takes and wide shots that allow the audience to fully appreciate the action. The fight choreography is inventive, with Reeves performing many of the stunts himself, adding a layer of authenticity to the film. The film's inventive use of props, such as pencils and books, as weapons, is also a highlight of the action scenes.Reeves is perfectly cast as John Wick, bringing a quiet intensity to the character that makes him both intimidating and sympathetic. The film's supporting cast, including Willem Dafoe and Ian McShane, also deliver strong performances, adding depth to the film's world.One of the criticisms of "John Wick" is that it can be overly violent at times, with some critics arguing that the film glorifies violence. However, the film's violence is purposeful, serving as a means for John Wick to exact revenge and highlighting the brutal world he inhabits.In conclusion, "John Wick" is a well-crafted action film that delivers on its promises. It's a sleek, stylish film that stands out in a crowded genre, thanks to its inventive action sequences, concise storytelling, and Keanu Reeves' commanding performance. While it may not be for everyone, for fans of action cinema, "John Wick" is a must-watch.

title: Hey John. Hey Jimmy.
text: A lot of people are complaining about lack of plot, which is absolutely fine. However, I really think the charm of this movie is that there barely is any plot, just pure mindless action. Not to mention the little dots of humour in there such as the "Hey John. Hey Jimmy" sequence

title: Fast-paced and entertaining
text:
Sometimes, I watch a movie because I want to think about it. Other times, I just want to shut my brain off and enjoy some cool action sequences. John Wick is an ideal movie for both. Starring Keanu Reeves in the titular role, the film is packed with unique characters, riveting storyline, beautifully choreographed fight scenes, and an intriguing world brought to life by directors Chad Stahelski and David Leitch.
The movie follows former hit man John Wick as he leaves retirement after the murder of his dog. Wick must return to the world he left behind in order to track down the man responsible and get his revenge.
I loved the performances given in this film. While some of the dialogue can come off as stiff, they still make it work. Reeves' acting without words gives incredible depth to his character. The antagonists of the film, Viggo Tarasov (Michael Nyqvist) and his son, Iosef (Alfie Allen), have fantastic emotional depth and well-developed dynamic. Stahelski and Leitch's directing serves to bring out the best of each actor.
The music in the score all fits perfectly into the film's atmosphere and the lighting creates a strong sense of place in every scene. Characterization through costuming was spot-on and the pacing of the film was fantastic. There was never a dull moment.
Overall, I really enjoyed this film and I'd highly recommend it to anyone who loves a good action movie. If you don't have a problem with a whole lot of violence, definitely check this out if you haven't already.

title: Excellent, perfect and worth your time
text: John Wick is an action, crime, and thriller which was directed by Chad Stahelski. Keanu Reeve stars as John Wick, the expert former assassin, and his friend Marcus (Willem Dafoe). The story about John's revenge from an old friend stole the last hope in life he had.The film is about John Wick recreceives a gift from her a precious keepsake to help John find a new meaning in life now that she is gone. But when his friend's son steals his gift, John determines to kill him and take his revenge in life. So John gets back to his job (assassin). And the journey begins.I was surprised by how amazing the film is. It actually made me stand at the edge of the chair. Keanu Reeve was literally talented all the action scenes were done perfectly. The soundtrack is really matched with the scenes. Overall if you like action films you will definitely love it.

title: Wooooow!!!! To quote Gomer Pyle: Surprise, Surprise, Surprise!
text: Wickedly action-pack entertainment is what "John Wick" brings! The movie instantly wicky wakey'd me up with its no-holds barred bravado tone. Kudos to Director Chad Stahelski for his masterful action orchestration of the picture. "John Wick" stars a sensational Keanu Reeves (yes, you heard right!) as the title character. Wick is a former Russian mafia hit-man who seeks all-out vengeance on his former boss' son for stealing his car and killing his puppy beagle. Hey, I am a beagle owner myself, so I can empathize with Wick, I would go bezerk if someone hurt my beagle. Wick is pretty much a badass one-man army in seeking his revenge as he battles an entire Russian Mafia Army! Sure, it goes over-the-top at times, but who cares? The action sequences is the paramount of the picture. Keanu Reeves has never been better, I don't know what kind of red or blue acting pills he took to prepare for this, but it worked. The always great Willem Dafoe also delivers a hit performance as a former accomplice of Wick. And Michael Nyqvist delivers a good performance as the baddie head Russian mafia honcho Viggo Tarasov. So hopefully I have Wicked you up before I go-go, and have convinced you to take a shot at "John Wick". ***** Excellent

title: A REAL action movie!
text: Saw this on DVD thinking that it would be another dull movie staring Keanu, Boy was i wrong. This has got to be up there with Point Break and Matrix for his best films to date. He stars as the typical action hero / anti-hero and unlike all the usual crap talk about how hard the main character is in all of Tom Cruise's films this one actually measures up. Its not stop action all the way and there isn't any stupid CGI to take over the screen or unbelievable action sequences that defy the laws of physics or gravity which is a major bonus in my book. If you want a flash to past when action hero's were tall, mean and shot lots of people then this is the movie for you.

title: A Pure Undiluted Shot of Adrenaline
text: Keanu Reeves has not been in the lead role of an amazing action film for some time. In fact I would go as far back as 1999's 'The Matrix', not including its silly sequels. That film showed audiences and critics alike that there was still freshness and room for expansion regarding the science fiction genre. Likewise, 'John Wick' has the same effect on the action genre. The last film truly off of the rails and full of excitement was 1988's 'Die Hard'. Yes, 'John Wick' is that awesome.John Wick is an ex-hit-man. He is overcome with grief when his wife dies from a fatal illness. Knowing that she has little time left, she leaves John a gift to remind him of her. A dog, Daisy. Within the next few days they form a close bond. Alas, it is not to be. Masked Russian gangsters break into his house, killing his dog and stealing his car. It is time for John Wick to take his revenge.If 'John Wick' sounds like the next 'Taken' film or average revenge tale, then you are mistaken. This film has style, energetic and frenetic fights as well as an actual plot. Think of it like 'Kill Bill' with Keanu Reeves replacing Uma Thurman in the title role. John Wick may not be as outrageous as the work of Quentin Tarantino. But it is far more daring and fun than the recent batch of action films from Hollywood's generic production line. This is what makes John Wick stand out from the crowd.Keanu Reeves in the starring role gives John Wick solemnity, thus lending him realism as opposed to Liam Neeson's Bryan Mills from 'Taken' who was stapled with clichÃ©s. We buy Reeves' character because he is a broken man with nothing left, as a result we can sympathise with him. Iosef the leader of the Russians who break into John Wick's house is played by an egotistical Alfie Allen, he makes the mistake of triggering John Wick's unstoppable anger. Iosef loses his cool real quick when he realises the gravity of what he has done. Enter his father, played by the sinister Michael Nyqvist, who shows little compassion and love for his son. Iosef strives to please him, leading to some very foolish decisions. Iosef does not think about the consequences of his actions, until it is too late and John Wick comes a calling. Willem Dafoe is never less than magnificent. His role makes an impression, he is John's trustworthy ally and gives him a purpose, when no one else in the world will.What is primarily involved in 'John Wick' and the centre of the audience's interest is the fight scenes. They take place in a variety of everyday locations. A house, nightclub, hotel, secret safe house and even briefly a church. Do not fear. Shaky cam is barely present. You will actually be able to tell who is punching who. This was clear in 'The Bourne Ultimatum' and anything but in the 'Taken' Trilogy. The action is not a rehash of the film's previous set pieces and each one is unique and wholly original in its approach. Take for example the scene in John Wick's house. The camera is locked down with wide angles. We can take in each punch, kick, stab and bullet wound with ease. 'John Wick' makes you feel alive. The set piece in the nightclub differs in style. As John Wick runs towards Iosef, the camera sways from the left to the right. It may prove disorientating to some viewers, yet you can always establish what is going on and who the enemy is. It does not prove distracting or poorly framed. I felt reborn and could revel in each detail to my heart's content.Most action films feel obligated to make it past the two hour mark. Not 'John Wick'. All the fat is trimmed off, so that only the meat and core of the film remains intact. Therefore, you are not left waiting too long for the next set piece. I do have one minor criticism of 'John Wick'. So minor in fact, that it is barely worth mentioning. The very first scene feels redundant, when you look back on the film. However, it does not hurt the film and only the most picky audience member will take issue with it.The score by Tyler Bates and Joel L. Richard compliments John Wick's uber cool clothing and look. It is in touch with the film and increases the mood and tension to a considerable degree. Undoubtedly, without this elegant score, the film would not be half as charming as it is.The cinematography is polished and sophisticated. The action takes place within the frame. This means you can stay focused without feeling ill. You only have to look at the most recent 'Taken' outing to see how poorly this can be executed.'John Wick' is a top tier action film. Filled with layered characters, confident performances, a suave score, radiant cinematography and free flowing fist fights. This is the best film of its kind since 'Die Hard' and miles ahead of 'Taken' in every aspect. If 'John Wick' does not become a franchise, then generic action flicks be warned, I am going to take my revenge upon you.

title: Wooden man shooting people in the face
text: A lot of video games have been influenced by films - the plots, the characters, the framing, the cinematography. And increasingly a lot of films are now influenced back by video games - the plots, the characters, the framing, the cinematography. And so it is the case with John Wick.It's set in a world where everyone seems to be a gangster or an assassin, or a formal part of that world. It's all rather cold and detached. There is the flimsiest of back stories but it mostly consists of a very wooden Keanu Reeves shooting people in the face, sometimes stabbing them, and of course the obligatory 'throwing people through sheets of glass'.The whole point of a video game is that you control the character. Even if the game consists merely of killing people, the fact that you are controlling them makes it an immersive experience.Just passively watching a wooden game character shooting people in the face, sometimes stabbing them, and of course the obligatory 'throwing people through sheets of glass', makes for a rather pointless and tedious 101 minutes.

title: Awesome action film.
text: First off I've never been a massive Keanu Reeves fan, to me the only decent films he had been in were, Parenthood, Bill and Ted excellent adventures and the Matrix trilogy. I thought Speed was awful and haven't watched point break yet. Yes he isn't the greatest actor in the world but think he plays this character how he should be played. Hardly any dialogue or emotion, the perfect Hit-man just doing what he needs to do until the job is done. I thought the action scenes were very well done with the shoot out scenes done amazingly. Yes the story isn't the best in the world and some of the acting is very over the top and unbelievable, and the ending could have been a little better, but with a film like this, sometimes it's just nice to forget all the little flaws like that and just enjoy the film for what it is. I enjoyed this film all the way through, I never found myself looking away or thinking it was over the top. I really hope they make a sequel to this.

title: John Wick
text: Keanu Reeves is back with a vengeance. A real vengeance. John Wick is easy to follow; Wick (Reeves), having lost his wife and attended her funeral, is taking the time to mourn the one he loved. An unexpected delivery in the form of a new pet jolts him out of misery, that is until a mob of Russians break into his house, kill his dog and steal his car. They have unleashed the monster in him; he tears through New York city leaving a rather large body count in his wake. First time directors Staheski and Leitch makes John Wick an incredibly powerful film. They're known in the industry for their stunt coordination skills, so it's only right that they're at the helm. Keanu Reeves' martial arts is replaced with raw grappling and gritty kills. The action is smooth, energetic and dynamic. Reeves is ideal as the wounded hit-man, saying little and expressing emotion through his brawling. The Russian gangsters and their boss play a familiar tune. Viggo (Nyqvist) knows his son's crossed the wrong person. Humour accompanies his importance as a leader, adding value to the film's atmosphere. Topping that is the film's rich, dark blue hues in every shot, giving us a tease of NY City's underground scene. I mean, who wouldn't want to check in to a hotel where all the other hit men stay? John Wick is stylish, sophisticated and compact. A sequel is already in the works.Check out my other reviews on http://straighttelling.co.uk

title: The Greatest Action Movie Of All Time!
text: John Wick is the greatest action movie of all time! I have seen all of the great action movies and none of them are better than John Wick. I have seen John Wick three times, twice in IMAX and once at home and the first time I saw it I was so blown away, I had to go back a few days later to see it again. Then I waited for it to come out on DVD and watched it again and thats when I decided it was the greatest action movie of all time. This movie gives you everything you want in an action movie! The story is perfect, it grabs you and keeps you hooked the entire time. They give you an action hero to root for the whole movie. The movie does an amazing job with first getting you to see John Wick as a human so you can understand the pain he is in and then the movie builds him up to be a feared and respected legend of this underworld and when the action starts you will understand why it is the greatest action movie of all time. The gun play in this movie is by far the best I have ever seen in any movie. John Wick kills so many people it is awesome, read the trivia section to find out how many! Keanu Reeves gives the performance of his career. The directors Chad Stahelski and David Leitch were stunt men their whole careers and John Wick is the first movie they have ever directed, which explains why the action is so perfect in this movie. I don't want to give any spoilers because I know as a huge movie fan that nothing is worse than finding out too many details before you see a movie. Trust me and go see John Wick right away! I recommend this movie to everyone!! I give John Wick a 10 out of 10!! A++

title: Engrossing thrilling from start to finish!
text:
This movie is the first in what up to now is 3 superbly written John Wick movies!It grabs your attention from the second the movie starts and takes you on one hell of a rollercoaster of thrills Keeanu Reeves is Excellent as John Wick to the point he has made the character his own and nobody could play the role as he does specially with the numerous fight scenes Keeanu's martial arts knowledge is well used. If you love Action superbly scripted thrilling movies then this will not disappoint.
I garuntee you will watch the follow up movies as well

text: If u are into action movies just go for it, it's one of the best movies of all times.

title: Boring, lame, with bad action scenes
text: I signed up to IMDb specifically to write this review. IMDb ratings are almost always exactly what I would have said, but this one is SO overrated.Firstly the action. It is just Keanu shooting people in the face the whole movie. Sometimes he rolls around before shooting them in the face. Sometimes he grabs their neck then shoots them in the face. Needless to say this is really boring.Second the acting. Keanu still can't act. His face is a bit older, which makes him seem less like a goof. That is the only positive thing about the movie.I really am in shock that people think this is a cult classic or at all good. It is painful to watch. From the beginning you know EXACTLY how the movie will go down. The only thing surprising during the movie is how camp it is (corny subtitles with different fonts, bad acting, extremely overused tropes redone with no extra effort).AVOID, seriously. I have low standards but this was awful.

title: A Comicbook-Like Movie Not Based On Any Comicbook
text: Watched John Wick with Kenau Reeves(47 Ronin)as John Wick ,Michael Nyqvist(Mission :Impossible- Ghost Protocol) as Viggo Tarasov, Alfie Allen(Game Of Thrones) as Iosef Tarasov,Adrianne Palicki(G.I. Joe: Retaliation) as Ms.Perkins, Bridget Moynahan(Battle Los Angeles) as Helen Wick, Dean Winters(30 Rock) as Avi, Ian McShane(Hercules) as Winston, John Leguizamo(Ride Along) as Aurelio, Willem Dafoe(Out Of The Furnace) as Marcus.I really enjoyed its semi Original and Film Anaylst Robert Meyer Burnett pointed out it was very comic book like I though Kenau Reeves This Has to be One Of His best Roles since The Matrix .Amazing Music By Tyler Bates(Guardians Of The Galaxy),Cinematography By Jonathan Sela(Law Abiding Citizen), Costume design By Luca Mosca(Paranoia) and Direction By Chad Stahelski(Point Break) A Comicbook-Like Movie Not Based On Any Comicbook 8/10

title: Addictive action
text: I do not get tired of watching this movie...the main character has a skill set that is powerful and compelling. The action, gunfu, segments are flawless and clearly resulted from very professional choreography. If you are into firearms you will want to watch this over and over. The sequence that featured the KelTech KSG shotgun made me go out and get one...it is a compact, powerful and lethal weapon for home defense. The underworld depicted, the Continental, the Red Circle were very believable although you know that they could not exist and I enjoyed seeing what dinner reservations turned into and how they used gold coins as their own private currency...very creative.

title: Non-stop boom-boom, bang-bang!
text: If you ever want to get lost for a while and forget about your immediate surroundings, John Wick may be the solution for you! The movie is 101 minutes of non-stop action through which the bad guys get it in all sorts of captivating ways! There are no twists, no mind benders, no smart was of taking someone out, just one straight shoot them dead sequence after another! The action scene choreography is really well done. Camera work is great so despite all the rapid action you will not miss any details.If you do not have the stomach for blood or violence, then skip it. Otherwise, get cozy and watch the Boogeyman do his thing!

title: You seen one spy-assassin movie you've seen them all
text: Yet another excellent collection to the genre that is "Assassin-spy movie". John Wick (Reeves) is described as the man who kills the Baba Yaga... Warns a Russian mobster of the gravity of his hot headed son's impulsive decision to steal Wick's car and kill his dog inspiring a campaign of vengeance against him.

title: What a Disappointment
text: The movie is just pure action. No story what so ever. The writers didn't do any effort to create any intrigue or suspense. The shift from the movie's lame beginning to the action was abrupt. Keanu didn't even prepare well for the movie. His body lacked the necessary muscles for such a super strong bad ass. Yet, he was hit so many times thrown off floors and he just gets up and continues fighting like it was nothing. I gave it 4 our of 10 because the action sequences were kinda slick. Totally unrealistic though, but still cool. And even still, the action sequences are repetitive without much change as the film progresses. Long story short, this movie has no plot, no logic, no hype, abrupt transitions, and a super hero with a white pasty body.

title: John Wick
text: John Wick one of the best movies I saw the first 15 minutes of the movie is sad and it makes sense what happened the acting is great I have not seen any matrix movies but Keanu Reeves is great as the character of John Wick oh yeah that night club sequence is so good Viggo Is an interesting villain in this movie So all-round John Wick Is a fun action movie with an interesting villain So I am gonna Give John Wick An A.

title: awesome
text: John Wick is one of my all-time favourite movies, full of highly stylized action, frequent droll wit, and a relentless pace. It's loaded with action and violence. But, unlike a lot of action movies, Wick's action sequences don't stop to dwell in gore -- they just keep blazing along. Suits me perfectly.I can't imagine better casting. The many supporting players are superb, and Reeves is outstanding. He does so much with extremely subtle movements and expressions -- along, of course, with all the martial arts gymnastics.I wish this could be rerun in theatres!

title: All Action, No Story
text: John Wick did a great job of bringing back a proper action packed movie! Don't be fooled; there is no storyline at all. There is just Keanu being awesome. I was entertained through the entire movie!This is the best Keanu movie since the Matrix! He goes back to his classic cool demeanor, and is extremely entertaining delivering his cheesy lines. He just kicks everyone's backside the entire time, and does it with ease. He basically takes on an entire army! The stunts and effects crew deserves a lot of respect for this. Its a great action flick, and that can't be done without a great crew. There were long, fantastically choreographed fight sequences. It is all fast moving and extremely entertaining! Non stop ACTION! This is exactly what you want in an action movie like this.John Wick was pure entertainment. Keanu was back to being Keanu, and the fight sequences were awesome. Watch if you are an action lover! 7/10

title: Does for Keanu Reeves what Taken and Harry Brown did for Liam Neeson and Michael Caine, respectively
text: John Wick is a 2014 action thriller directed by Chad Stahelski and David Leitch. Starring Keanu Reeves in the title role, the film successfully revitalises Keanu Reeves' career and brings him back into the spotlight as an action hero.In New York City, retired assassin John Wick (Keanu Reeves), mourns the death of his wife Helen to a terminal illness. Shortly after, John receives a puppy as per request of Helen to help him come to terms with her passing. One night, a trio of Russian gangsters break into John's home, beat him up badly, kill the puppy, and steal his car, after John refused to sell the car to their leader Iosef (Alfie Allen) earlier that day. Now with nothing left to lose, John vows revenge on the gangsters and comes out of retirement to settle the score once and for all.With a good amount of action, drama, and some cleverly choreographed shoot-outs, John Wick does for Keanu Reeves what Taken and Harry Brown did for Liam Neeson and Michael Caine, respectively. The filmmakers do a good job showcasing why the John Wick character is so feared, yet respected within the crime underworld of New York thanks mainly to Keanu Reeves' nuanced performance as the "one man army" title character. Often times, I feel that Reeves' approach to his acting is very hit-and-miss, however here, it is most certainly a hit. The film's creative use of colour and lighting gives an almost anime and noir feel. There were many times where I could tell the directors must have watched several anime and kung fu films to serve as inspiration for the overall tone.I rate it 7.5/10
