title: Criminally Underrated Movie
text: I just saw this movie today, roughly three years after release, and can't believe that it took me so long to watch this. The reviews don't do it justice. And as others have said, on paper, the premise doesn't look that interesting, which might also be why I overlooked this. This is a revenge action flick, and the only thing I can think of to explain the lower reviews, is that some people just don't like revenge action movies in general.The story isn't very complex, which is typical of revenge action. Typically, I prefer a little complexity. Pure action, like Transformers and Max Max Road Fury usually isn't my thing. However, while the story is simple, there is just enough of a story to separate this movie from the two I just mentioned. Some people say the action in this movie is non stop. But I disagree. There are small breaks, just when you need them to explain the films universe, and its characters. Another thing that separates this movie from pure action films like Mad Max Road Fury, is that there is an actual clearly established goal, and you are given a very strong reason to actually care about the protagonist and his desire to accomplish it. Not to mention, an unusually strong reason to really really hate its antagonist(s).As for the acting, I was very impressed by its lead hero played by Keanu Reeves. He's stepped up his game from previous films. He can really sell the emotion of sadness this time, which was critical in this movie. If he acted the way he did in The Matrix, this whole movie would not have worked for me.

title: $0.54 - way overpriced at Redbox
text: Ultra-edited and devoid of originality, this turd is ultraviolence sensationalized for the sake of show with absolutely no thought. It is an over-the-hill Keanu Reeves Star Comeback movie without the comeback. It is a diarrhea & vomit of direction. Rather it has overcooked music and cheesepuff rock, and is as poor a movie as I've seen in the last few years. Well this IMDb rating is here to help bring some honesty to how bad this steamer is. Bad accents, bad dialog, Russian accented English or Russian interspersed with blah, blah who cares semblences of conversation - John Wick the boogie-man killer...BLAH! Think of better or even average action-thrillers like Equalizer, History of Violence, or the Taken movies, and this movie rips off from every single one. Made by 9 year olds. Slogged through this utter drivel knowing better. Embarrassing for all "filmmakers" involved and the Mayhem guy from the insurance commercials catching a payday... 2/10 -

title: Action non stop
text: Now, I've seen Mr. Wick also doing something human, like sleeping in a bed, sharing some breakfast with a lovely little dog(impressive scene discovering the puppy and reading his dead wife's letter). As the first film of a man(Chad Stahelski, the director) who has previously been a stuntman and a martial artist, it's a great achievement. Accumulating considerable experience as a stuntman in films as "Point Break" (1991), "The Matrix" (1999), "The Matrix Reloaded" (2003), "The Matrix Revolutions" (2003), "Constantine" (2005), " Man of Tai Chi "(2013), all with Keanu Reeves, it was natural that Stahelski and Reeves will work together again, achieving something even more spectacular. Good action and great music!

title: One of my all time favorite movies
text: I'm a big fan of action movies and especially Keanu Reeves. He often gets crap over his acting skills (or lack thereof). I think hes well suited to action movies, where a lot of the time story is told through the action sequences and a bit more nuanced. It's hard to find fault with this movie, and I've seen it at least 3-4 times. All the actors supporting or main do a great job. There is a lot of action in this movie, and the movie does start out a bit slow, but then picks up very quickly. The action, gun fu and stunts are awesome, some of the best I've seen in a long time. You can tell they really practiced and tweaked the stunts a lot. There are often long action segments with a brief intermission of story, which is how I like most of my movies. The soundtrack is amazing as well, with Marilyn Manson contributing to the main theme of the movie and the composer for the movie doing a great job. I would have liked to see William Dafoe's character expanded on some more but that may come in the second movie (in flashback sequences).

title: Best action movie ever.
text: What can i say, this is not just a action movie, this is the finest of all. This movie is an art and the makers are the artist. Amazing direction, great action choreography and oh, it's JOHN WICK.

title: Stylish Action Thriller.
text: How far will you go for a murdered puppy? Will you be dare to challenge a Russian mafia for that? Well, if it was the last gift from the most beloved one?John Wick, is one of the most discussed films in these days. Well, it's the story about a man who hunts down an entire mafia, just because his dog was killed. What if I told you, this was loosely based on a real story? Definitely, it was exaggerated to the limit for filmy purpose.John Wick is mourning his wife's death. One day he receives a surprise gift that was sent by his wife before her death. An adorable puppy. That was a great relief for him. On a gas station, some youth, named Iosef Tarasov, was attracted to John's car and asks him how much? John says, she was not for sale. At night, Iosef with his gangsters break into John's house, beat him down and take the car away. The puppy tries to stop this, get annoyed by the puppy, those guys kill it. Iosef Tarasov was called by his father Viggo Tarasov, and asks about what was happened. Iosef learns that the guy he messed up with was really dangerous. And it was obvious that he will come for him.A very stylish movie. End to end beauty in the frames will be a feast for your eyes. Keanu Reeves made his name through The Matrix. The stunt double and action coordinator of these films Chad Stahelski with David Leitch are the directors. Therefore, action is the final word for the film. Jonathan Sela did an amazing job with the camera providing stunning visuals.If you are a fan of Thrillers, do not miss this film. #KiduMovie

title: I like this movie !!
text: I am very fan of yours Keanu Reeves. Good actor and I can certainly watch this film every time.I can't stand injustice either. Revenge is not my style, but in movies I love it a lot.I've watched all of John Wick's movies and I definitely recommend watching it.

title: Masterpiece in the action genre with superb fight choreography
text: John Wick is my personal favorite Keanu Reeves movie as it has everything that he is best at, spectacular stunts and actually great acting. With Chad Stahelski directing the movie it couldn't have been bad choreography or action sequences as that's the background he came from and it shows in the incredible choreography and action sequences that mixes martial arts and gun fu which is a blast to watch. Derek Kolstad wrote the movie and it isn't really that original script but it works perfectly for the action genre but where his writing shines is the world he built, from the assassin network to the characters, simply amazing.The ensemble cast is my other favorite thing about the movie, having Keanu Reeves as the main character is never wrong, having Michael Nyqvist and Alfie Allen as the villains was perfect as they portrayed the villain roles perfect and Michael shined the most of the two, stunning performance. There is a lot of other interesting characters that are played by Ian McShane and Willem Dafoe isn't either wrong. Simple to say it's a fantastic cast with A list actors.This movie is personally one of my favorite action movies of all time, it has everything an action movie should have and much more. Just the fight choreography is something I could re-watch this for and mixing it with the suspenseful story helps a lot.

title: John Wick
text: I loved this movie, people are saying this was a horrible movie but they are wrong this movie was fluid, smooth, stylish, and hit all the right notes, Keanu Reeves performance was excellent this is his best movie he has done since the matrix, and the but who directed the movie was a stunt man on the matrix, I hope that they make a sequel to it, I beard that they are planning on making a TV series out of John Wick, if I were to pick a best action movie of the year this would be in my top 3 list, people who are hating on this movie, just don't like Keanu Reeves, Keanu is an excellent actor and in this movie he shows off a lot of his best skills, the reason he hasn't really done any good movies is because the movies he was in wasn't him it was the director, but in John Wick he did a lot of his own stunts and the director let Keanu improvise which made the movie excellent, I really liked this movie will definitely buy this on Blu ray

title: A revolutionary new way to do an action film.
text: I'll be honest and say that I initially thought this film was just another action movie. Of all the action movies that come out these days, there wasn't much that intrigued me enough to spend the time with this particular one. However, after some of my friends were raving about it and I saw a few YouTube videos describing why it was so great, I decided to give John Wick (2014) a chance. To say I was pleasantly surprised would be an understatement. This film was not just another action movie. In fact, it was quite exemplary in its breaking of traditional action movie tropes.The most noticeable difference this movie has compared to other action films is its camerawork. Ever since The Bourne Identity (2001) changed the action movie genre, the cameras have been quite shaky, and the action is, therefore (increasingly) hard to follow. Not so with John Wick. The smooth and steady camera shows off the incredible talent of its titular main character as he performs a highly choreographed "dance of death," killing all who might confront him or impede his progress toward his vengeful goal. Surprisingly enough, because everything happens so quickly, the violence is almost toned down despite the enormous body count.Additionally, I liked the character of John Wick (portrayed by Keanu Reeves). Not only is he calm, cool, and calculating, but the universe in which he lives shudders at the mention of his name. The whole "infrastructure" put in place to support Wick was just as fascinating and entertaining as the stories people would tell of his previous professional exploits. And while the premise for John Wick leaving retirement was flimsy at best, it drove home the point that you should never, ever cross this character.A revolutionary new way to do an action film, I give John Wick 4.0 stars out of 5.

title: The subtitles got on my wick.
text: John Wick (Keanu Reeves) is a bad-ass: an ex-hit-man who comes out of retirement after the son of a Russian mafia boss steals his car and kills his dog (a parting gift from his dead wife). Busting out his weaponry, Wick cuts a bloody swathe through countless bad guys en route to his target, always finishing with a shot to the head.The problem is that Wick is TOO much of a bad-ass. At no point did I feel like he was in real danger. Even after receiving a gash to the stomach the size of my fist and taking a severe beating, Wick makes Liam Neeson in Taken look like a pussy, escaping every situation with a flurry of fists and feet and umpteen carefully aimed rounds. It's as though he doesn't feel pain. It's hard to feel a genuine sense of excitement knowing that our hero (if a ruthless killer can be called a hero) is virtually indestructible.The action is well staged, and the level of violence is high enough to please many fans of the action genre, but I was left feeling more than a little empty. In fact, I was hoping that Wick would die at the end to finally be reunited with his wife (and his dog), but seeing as there is already a John Wick 2, the chances of that happening seemed quite low.5.5/10, rounded down for the novelty subtitles. Really, ordinary subtitles would have sufficed.

title: Great action revenge movie
text: This movie may have a simple and unoriginal story but it is executed perfectly. With amazing action scenes and great music score to go along with it and the perfect casting of John Wick by Keanu Reeves makes this movie perfect. One of the best action films.

title: The confidence and quiet swagger of this film to come out of nowhere and to create such a universe;
text: John Wick is a superpowered revenge art-house action ballet, but it's the barbs of dry wit, and the little affectations and knowing detail that enrich this film as it is clearly made by lovers of the genre.A graphic novel adaptation of a Greek tragedy. Perhaps the perfect example of its genre. Easily a film that should have been bad but against all odds and including all tropes is an absolute delight.The cinema I saw it with cringed with every headshot and laughed at every sparsely applied line of cutting dialogue. It was a cracking, knee-slapping, riveting ballet written and directed by Max Payne.With reverence for comics, video-games, mythology, the creative team's history of action and their desire to create sequences both classic and totally fresh, John Wick is a true piece of art, an opera made of neon light, judo flips and gun-fu.When I heard about John Wick, a well shot, well choreographed, storyless action flick I thought, who cares. I already saw The Raid, fight scenes were good, Hummingbird was a pile of crap. I like gun-fu, and I love Keanu Reeves but how many strobing EDM-fuelled shootouts do I need to see?Turns out I could stand to see one more.The music fits every fight scene, providing a different tone to each one. The directors are fans of action flicks and they know what makes them tick in the mind of an audience member which is why there's about 10 smile-inducing beats a second. They're not here to get a quick buck, they want to make the right type of action-fuelled neo-noir.It's neither too generic or too outlandish, too swift or too laborious. It just totally works. Some nice beats exist, the fact that the father of the son knows he's an idiot, or two actors ripped from The Wire make an appearance, or a hitman hotel (something that is a such an simple and effective idea it's a wonder that it hasn't been done before). And Nykvist makes for a charismatic non-shouty bad guy which is refreshing.Like John Wick himself, the movie is relentless, sharp, brisk, terse, thoughtful and creative. If they made a thousand of these I would be a happy man to find out how they creatively diversified each time.

title: Came for the hype, stayed for the awesomeness
text: I started watching only because it was such a hype and people talked about the movie a lot. Thought I should just watch and get it over with, but boy was that a rollercoaster! John Wick, a man of few words but somehow manages to send his message through his body language.

title: Best action movie to date
text: John wick is a breath of fresh air for those tired of the jump cut style action moves of the 2000's. Keanu Reeves trained extensively for this film and it really shows, no more infinite magazines and confusing jump cuts.

title: An experimental film... no plot at all
text: Say you hate somebody who knows a bit about films, well, not that much. Buy him/her a ticket. You will never be forgiven . There is one thing that called my attention, PLOT DISPENSABILITY, no efforts were made in the making of this film to make any sense at all. This movie is a mere exercise of "keanu kills them all, everybody but keanu dies". There is some experimental value regarding film appreciation. DF has done a good job, the atmosphere in general makes the image appealing to watch. There are, at least, 10 things that don't make any sense; so it makes you wonder... Is the director challenging traditional film conventions? guess not.

title: A movie of focus, commitment and sheer will.
text: It's a basic gangster revenge movie, where bad men disturb a sleeping bear and live just long enough to regret it. It is also complete fantasy, a New York city where no one who dies has has family, no innocent people get hurt, and super-assassins stay in their own luxury hotel.The movie makes up its own rules, but it sticks to them: John Wick is destructible, he is not stronger than his enemies but merely faster, more resourceful, and more determined. His weapons run out of bullets, and do not do more damage than those of his opponents ... he just shoots them more accurately. It is not realistic - it isn't supposed to be - but the conflicts are balanced enough that his revenge feels earned.It is also stylishly shot, the small depth of field technique adds a otherworldliness, that does not distract from the entertainment but does serve I think to distance us enough from the violence that it doesn't feel sickening.But the best things about the film, what really makes it work, is the tight, focused plot, the minimal-yet-eminently-quotable dialogue, and the commitment of everyone in the cast to make their characters memorable.

title: An atypical action film that's Hollywood action cinema at its best!
text: There's a reason why John Wick works big time as an atypical action film.The film is dark, brutal and everything an extremely serious action film should be.The first 30 minutes are enough to prove this.Then we have some really unconventional action sequences that are both real and stylized at the same time. Keanu Reeves is really one of the greatest action stars, and this role is pretty much tailor-made for him.While the film might feel slow in the beginning, you can realize it later on that like any other intelligent action movie, it needed a proper setup to get us invested emotionally in the characters and action sequences that follow.John Wick turns out to be different from other killing-machine actioners in terms of its action and the universe it's set in. Every character has something to offer to the story, and the action sequences are filmed in a natural and realistic style. Honestly, I was expecting another quick-cutting action choreography like in most modern action movies (Don't get me wrong, I am a huge fan of the quick cutting technique), but the long-take action choreography involving mostly guns won me over. This is Hollywood action cinema at its best.

title: A Mother's take on this movie.......
text: My son kept telling his Dad about this movie, but didn't think I would want to watch it. So I thought why not give it a try. I've watched the Punisher....what could be worse than that. I can honestly say I've not seen anything close to this movie....John Wick. I've watched the Punisher, Taken 1, 2, & 3...and I can say....this movie beats them hands down. Brilliant acting. Little speaking. Keanu doesn't need to....he has a way with his look that speaks volumes. Lots of action. Amazing moves. Choreographer needs an award! Gets to the point of why he does what he does.....and why some people have to suffer. Matter of principal. Some people have messed with the wrong guy and a lot of people unfortunately are collateral damage because of one spoiled rotten brat. Whoever wrote the story line has a brilliant mine for detail. I wonder what the book reads like for the movie was chocked full of emotion, action, scenery, and good plot line with many little side roads to keep you wondering. This movie does what it is supposed to do....keep you entertained and on the edge of your seat not wishing to blink for concern one might miss something important. Bravo. I would watch it again withouthesitation....apparently my son is more worried about what I view than I am!!

title: If you hate John wick Idk what u gonna love !

title: great action movie
text: Great to see Keanu Reeves back, it must have been since The Matrix (1999) that I saw him in a flick. But I must say, even as this flick is available really cheap these days that I thought this must be bad, that I was wrong. This is a great movie and to be honest, I liked it very much.The story itself is rather simple, you know, wife died, getting out of business, receiving a dog, getting robbed and dog got killed, it's payback time, end of story. But from the beginning until the end I enjoyed it very much, the score, the fight scene's the shoot outs, the way it was shot and edited (the way they shown the translation of Polish) everything was great, and the acting of all the thespians was way over mediocre.It never really becomes brutal or you don't see a lot of bloodshed or even say nudity it somehow doesn't matter because the action is what it's all about. A surprise it was in fact, Reeves shows that he can still carry a movie and it was so great to see all those well known names from yesteryear and nowadays working together. And for the lovers of muscle cars, it do contains a lot, the mustang, chevelle, charger and challenger are all in. Gore 1/5 Nudity 0/5 Effects 3/5 Story 4/5 Comedy 0/5

title: Keanu Reeves reinvented
text: What can I say? This was a turning point for Keanu Reeves, this is where middle-aged man broke every stereotype and became a legendary killer of hearts. He basically conquered the internet and all cinephiles with John Wick's performance.The plot is simple but this is exactly what it takes to introduce ruthless killing machine. You need only a slight push and a sledge of calculated revenge will go right down the track. Precise choreography of fights is absolutely amazing, you can feel the flow and all the skill set that John has developed throughout his career, but the age takes its toll, so you can see that humanizing rustiness. The gun wielding was incredibly entertaining, you could add it to the list of things you can watch forever, like fire and water.Another interesting feature is that the Russian language was spoken pretty decently without the iconic Jason Bourne random letter stuff. I mention this because it boosts Keanu Reeves' dedication to the role, even a smallest detail is approaching perfection in hands of this guy.Additional perks of the movie include an amazing soundtrack with Marilyn Manson's song "Killing Strangers" that immediately jumped into my playlist. Talking about a treat to your ears: voices of Ian McShane and Willem Dafoe as well as their on-screen presents are just a blessing.Overall, the movie is a keeper. I will definitely revisit it again, and recommend you to see for yourself this quality action that gives you the charge of brutality and dedication from one and only Keanu Reeves.

title: Save yourselves the time & the money
text: John Wick was by far one of the worst movies that I have seen in a very long while. There was no plot, no point, no script and absolutely no acting. Reeves as Wick was a joke. I hope he got a stupendous amount of money for this awful attempt at a movie because picking up his carrier from this mess is likely going to be a tall order. Save yourselves not just the time but also the frustration of watching this debacle. I came out feeling that if someone had handed over the same cast to a group of aspiring college students and offered one tenth of the script and production budget, they would have worked wonders but this was just shameful.

title: Sweet, stylish action flick that redefines Keanu Reeves as a visceral action hero
text: With the action genre running low on fresh, if not entirely original ideas over the past several years; this stylish action film starring Keanu Reeves as the titular character is one that comes with surprise. This movie sees Reeves reuniting with Chad Stahelski and David Leitch who served as the fight choreographers for the 'Matrix' trilogy, and redefining himself as a new hero with high-trained set of skills with guns and hand-to-hand combat. Although Reeves is no stranger to the action genre since he exploded as the visceral action hero Neo in the Matrix, this film pins the actor into a fine, polished role as a gun-totting hero facing down the guys. Calling this film is a game-changer in the genre would be saying a bit much, but it does indeed stand as one of the most entertaining films of the category. In further words, it shows the genre is still far from dead. Keanu Reeves plays John Wick, a former assassin devastated by the death of his wife. After days of mourning, Wick is surprised with a gift of cute little puppy to help cope with his lonesomeness. While trying to readjust to his life, Wick is visited by a group of Russian mobsters lead by Losef Tarasov (played by Alfie Allen), son of corrupt mob moss Viggo Tarasov (played by Michael Nyqvist), who brutally attack him, destroy his house, steal his Mustang, and murder his poor little puppy. In an act of revenge, Wick must rally up his former accomplices including Marcus (played by William DeFore) and chop shop owner Aurelio (played by John Leguizamo) to hunt them down.This movie provides action movie junkies with plenty of thrills and visceral action set pieces to fuel the adrenaline for most. Although the plot is rather thin and falls short of originality beyond a simple revenge story, the major driving force of the film is the dazzlingly choreographed action sequences along with the compelling character study of our tragic titular protagonist. From the opening scene, John Wick is established as a man with a grim past and faces a deep tragedy with the death of his wife from an illness that is never specified. The beginning effectively breaths humanity into the character without being overly sappy or manipulative, and the final product is a protagonist viewers can sympathize with; even when he journeys to the dark side of gunning down countless individuals. When the action begins, it is truly stunning. The first action set piece takes place in the main character's house where he fights and mows down an array of criminals in a sequence choreographed in a style of what almost resembles a poetic dance routine. And this scene is only the beginning of the enormously high body count he racks up throughout the film. While the action scenes stand out gracefully, the film's shortcoming perhaps come from the characters, mostly from the antagonist category. Alfie Allen and Michael Nyqvist both do their duty in the villain roles but fall victim to rather underwritten characters. Why did they try to kill John Wick, a explanation is never deeply explored (or at least not in a way that is understandable). And William DeFoe's character is given rather little to do. Overall, these come as only minor gripes and should not stand in the way to witness the alluring direction Chad Stahelski and David Leitch drive this fast-paced vehicle.John Wick is a sleek, stylish action thriller that redefines its charismatic lead actor as a visceral action hero, and at best, sprouts as a shining star in the slowly diminishing genre. This film may not shine as a game changer in the genre, it clearly sets a solid example of what meets the criteria of a good action flick.

title: Watching someone playing a video game
text: While starting out okay you'll soon be left to wonder why the heck the protagonist takes his Mustang to an empty airstrip just to do donuts and burnouts for no apparent reason. Obviously this is supposed to showcase the protagonists superhuman car driving abilities - disregarding the fact that any idiot can do donuts on an empty airstrip.The rest of the movie unfortunately follows: each scene works like a video game level that you have to survive to reach the next level or cut-scene. If you ever played Max Payne or something similar (or better still: watched someone playing) you'll feel at home right away.I give points for some decent acting, recognition value of some actors, not too bad cinematography and rather promising first twenty minutes.See for free only and keep your expectations low. Else avoid. It's surely not the worst film from 2014 but definitely very far from the best.

title: Truly Cinematic
text: While this movie is definitely light on story and characters, there's no way you'd be watching this movie if that's what you were looking for. This is a fantastic action movie filled with perfectly choreographed violence and an epic soundtrack. The cinematography and color palette are what really kept me watching all the way through. This movie is a feast for the eyes of anyone who appreciates great filmmaking. I would highly recommend this movie to fans of amazing shot composition, and action. If you're not too into violence, I would at least urge you to check out the soundtrack, as its great.

title: I cannot understand for the life of me how this movie doesn't have a higher rating
text: This is up there with "GoodFellas." This is a strong with strong emphasis on structure, and storyline. This is a great movie, and a UPN/Warner Bros./WB flagship offering too, as this movie was released internatinoally by Warner Bros. (although not the glorious narrow shield WB UPN/Warner Bros./WB flagship, but post-narrow shield WB UPN/Warner Bros./WB flagship). I don't know if this ever aired on MyNetworkTV (it should, because that network is more popular), but back to the story.Everything about this movie is like "GoodFellas" (I reject the notion this is based on Greek mythology, being it implies that every bad thing about American society came from the Romans or Irish or Greeks, when Allied culture is purely Nordic and Yankees are Allied, yada, yada, yada, and Germanics were bad in history). It's realistic. John Wick is a former hit man who lost his wife. I think everyone knows the familiar story so I won't say it for those who saw the movie. One fatal event brings him back, as the posters do show, and in this movie we get a hard-hitting film: we see many great fight scenes, lots of gunfire and bombs to keep the action going. Strangely enough, with the exception of the Russian gangsters and some of the club scenes with the cuties, there isn't much in the way of cursing or sex. Toby Leonard Moore's performance is even more electrifying as Victor, the main arrogant gangster. This is a classic movie.

title: Wow. What a load of steaming poo.
text: This movie was so bad that I decided to leave a review for the first time ever. So many things wrong with this...1. John Wick has serious communication issues. Basically the movie glorifies this guy who think it's okay to kill hundred while putting the public in danger because someone killed his dog and took his car.2. John Wick suppose to be a dangerous man. Well, his security system is bad. People apparently can just waltz into his house in the middle of the night unnoticed. Plus, I'm not convinced that unskilled thugs can just waltz into some ex-hit-man's house and kick his face in. Supposedly these ex-hit-man sleep lightly and carries something heavy at all times...3. Why do all the brainless thugs just walk into John Wick "circle of violence" with their guns drawn pointing down so they can get their face kicked in? Who does that? 4. Right, he doesn't miss anyone except when he tries to shoot at Iosef? That's a naked Iosef running around without shoes. Maybe John Wick is gay and wants some fine piece of Greyjoy for himself.5. Who the heck are these people and their stupid rules? Oh, no shooting at the continental or else we'll round you up with 4 guys all shooting at you standing in the middle. I was hoping they'd miss and shoot each other.6. John Wick never got his car back? And got a Dodge instead? John is okay with this? I'd keep on shooting until I get my freaking Mustang Boss back just to keep the story line consistent/less cramped with poo.7. The question is, "Can Keanu Reeves sleep at night knowing how bad this movie is"? Wait, these people don't care. When you, as an audience, hold the bar so low you have only yourself to blame for bad movies.8. How is Marcus(Willam Dafoe's character) always at the right place at the right time? And how the heck would Viggo know that Marcus betrayed him when Viggo doesn't know anything most of the time? 9. Was it necessary for John Wick to take the stab from Viggo so he can break Viggo's arm and counter-stab? Wait, it is necessary. I was hoping they would both die from this stupid nonsense.This movie glorifies violence over senseless crap. The dog's live is worth more then the thugs went after John Wick. This movie is perfect for people who over simplify the world and want to resolve "issues" with over-the-top violence. The action will keep you mind occupied but at the cost of having to accept twisted logic.The thing is, I don't think John Wick ever wanted to retire and was hoping something like this would happen. Remember, this is the guy that doesn't really have job or hobby and likes to drive his car on some airport tarmac for fun while he feel sad for himself. Maybe that's why he let those thugs kick his face in in his own home. He needed a reason to go back to the only life he knew. I'll bet he was awkward as poo trying to live a "normal" life with the wife. Can you imagine how terrible it'd be trying to live with an ex-hit-man who has communication issues? Who knows, maybe the wife faked her own death so she can leave him since I don't think an ex-hit-man with communication issues can just casually breakup or divorce.What a dysfunctional piece of crap.

title: This feels like a very good comic book movie
text: The World of John Wick is different from the one we live in. His wife had died and after a hold-up he instinctively sees a chance to snap out of his sadness and lethargy. He has been an assassin, a legendary mafia killer. Everybody knows that, even his friendly local policeman. Now he has a reason for revenge, to go back to work -- to live, to kill.John Wick's world is the world of organized crime. His vendetta will not lead him anywhere else. He's fighting against the Russian mafia organization he formerly worked for. His most important quality - repeatedly stressed by his former boss - is that he is 'a man of focus', which in a society with rampant attention-deficit disorder might well be considered a superpower. This world of crime is a rules-based order with draconic punishments for transgressions and its own currency, golden coins of a very inexactly defined value. In "John Wick I" the superstructure of the organized crime is represented by the hotel Continental, a gentlemen's club where everything is about honor and rules. It is a silly idea, but here it is just an unintrusive subplot giving this shoot-'em-up actioner an original and intriguing flavor.Keanu Reeves looks great, this is his most iconic role. The plot is straightforward, not too simple, not excessively complicated, the action scenes are pleasently staged and timed. It is so far from reality that it feels like a comic book adaptation, but if you can accept that, JWI offers a really good time. It doesn't go too much over the top.The three sequels do, head-on. The nearly almighty, all-knowing government of the crime world, the 'High Table', becomes the center of the Wick-story. It's not organized crime, it's totally controlled crime. Sometimes Wick's world seems to belong to the "Matrix"-universe: Suddenly everybody turns into an assassin or passers-by completely ignore ongoing fights. Everything is about rituals, rules, Table manners. John Wick killing an endless queue of faceless thugs trying to off him gets more and more boring and ridiculous. In JW4 John Wick's main adversary is a blind super shooter, another man of focus. They are openly mocking their audience.The original "Matrix" and "John Wick" movies are great, because they walk the line between a conventional, relatable story and one that's just pretentious and nonsensical. Their sequels left the golden vagueness and embraced the most silly elements of their predecessors. Visually JW2 to JW4 are marvelous though.

title: Revenge is all he has left
text: John Wick is a 2014 action thriller that follows a legendary hitman who comes out of retirement to seek revenge on the men who stole his car and killed his dog.This is an incredible film that takes you on a hard hitting action packed thrill ride that keeps the entertainment levels as high as they go. Written by Derek Kolstad and directed by Chad Stahelski, John Wick is an action flick that takes no prisoners and shows no mercy.Keanu Reeves stars as John Wick, a retired hitman who gets sucked back into the life he left for love after his wife passes away and the dog she left him is killed by Russian thugs trying to steal his car.As far as action movies go, this film is an absolute masterpiece. It's an explosive high energy level adrenaline rush that will keep you on your toes the whole way through. Reeves performance is phenomenal, the fight choreography is amazing, and the story although simple sets off a chain reaction of events like no other. If you've never seen this great film before, I would highly recommend checking it out.

title: This whole John wick series is awful

Her fighting seemed more realistic. Them Belgium Malinois was great also. 20 stars to Halle and the dogs. The rest was awful.

title: The One That Changed it All
text: This movie was a game changer. Keanu Reeves as the famed assassin seeking retirement and obscurity whose encounter with the son of a Russian mobster changes everything. Reeves, as the dog loving and deadly hit man, is phenomenal. This movie was the first of a trend towards understanding that action and story can both be first rate in a movie. One doesn't need to take a back seat to the other. The cinematography is great. The action is amazing. The gun play is epic. The cast and the eye into this dark world is intriguing. You can not watch this one and NOT want to immediately watch the rest of the series.

title: Non stop action
text: This is a fun action movie. Keanu Reeves is a force to be reckoned with as John Wick. The fight choreography landed most of the time. Definitely not a dull moment in this flick.John Wick gets a 8/10

title: Enjoyable revenge action flick
text: A classic tale of revenge wrapped up in a gritty technoir aesthetic. What I love about this film is how 'sloppy' the fighting and gunplay is - giving it a much more realistic edge over its more stylish peers. The plot we have seen time and time again, but regardless this is an entertaining flick that comes highly recommended.

title: John wick
text: The only word that keeps coming back to mind when reviewing this movie is: exhilarating. The fun factor this amazing action film has is probably the highest of any movie this year. I could not stop myself from having a blast!First and foremost, being also the first thing you notice, "John Wick" is self-conscious of what it is and doesn't, for not even one second, take itself more seriously than it should. Fortunately this doesn't shut out the place for character connection and empathy. People often think the two of these things exclude themselves, but that is not what I think and this movie is proof of it. It has such a genuine sense of fun and humor, so much so that you are often laughing WITH (not AT) the movie at the preposterousness of everything and at the same time feeling genuine tension for the characters you're rooting for. I know it sounds ridiculous, but every single kill by John Wick feels exciting and liberating, it was incredible how much I was rooting for him. To this contributes some stunning, fast-and-furious level action scenes that benefit amazingly by the practicality involved. Hats off to the director and the special effects guys for staging such a flawless string of adrenaline-pumping scenes, in particular to the director for the highly energetically stylish direction that never feels as a gimmick or out of place, yet instead makes everything all the more enjoyable. Furthermore this is one of the few movies in which sound actually stood out and contributed in making the film a great success. Keanu Reeves is perfect for the role and brings to the screen so much charisma I could not help but root for the guy. He is surrounded by a great cast too that has very fun moments on their own. If all of this wasn't enough, "John Wick" has some great original ideas and plays with them in the best way possible.Despite having a blast in the theater and wanting to maybe see this movie again in a year or so, it isn't original, stylish or innovative enough to say: "we've seen this plot before, but not quite done this way". Yes it has its brilliance, but it is kind of cheesy, even if in a good way, and predictable. It doesn't rank up to a higher standard of action movie because of its straight-forwardness. It does have some stakes, but all in all there isn't really an overwhelming set piece or twist that makes it highly remarkable.Obviously, that is not what it's aiming for and because of that I could recommend this movie to anybody, just go and have the best action entertainment fun in the theater!

title: Throwback to James Bond
text: "John Wick" is a classic action-thriller with a vintage anti-hero performance from Keanu Reeves. At the end of the film, a menacing Russian mobster remarks that the veteran hit man John Wick looks like the John Wick of old. Reeves looks fantastic at 50 and is comfortably, securely back in action-star mode, reminiscent of Liam Neeson's recent resurgence in movies like "Taken," "The Grey" and "Non-Stop." Keanu Reeves is still quintessentially Keanu, with a Zen-like calm that makes him both elusive and irresistible. His face belies the wisdom of his years, and he's smarter than he looks, but he doesn't go out of his way to prove it. John Wick is a character that allows him to be coolly confident, yet deliver an amusing, deadpan one-liner with detached precision. When the time comes, he can deliver with a graceful yet powerful physicality. John Wick (Bridget Moynahan) is forced to retire from his life as an assassin after Russian bad guys steal his prized 1969 Mustang and kill his dog, Daisy, a posthumous gift from his dying wife. Moynahan's character is barely even a person, but her loss provides Wick with a melancholy that lingers over his demeanor and every decision. "John Wick" is an aesthetically heightened, specifically detailed world in which Wick, his fellow assassins and other nefarious sorts inhabit their own parallel version of New York City. They have their own currency, gold coins, and frequent an upscale hotel and bar called The Continental. The courtliness of it all provides a welcome contrast to the non-stop carnage. You can check out any time you'd like, but you can never leave. John Wick is an action movie that combines the suave filmmaking of Skyfall, the sly visual humor of Die Hard, and the singular action sequences of John McClane, Jason Bourne, and John Wick. It is one of the best action movies of the decade and will be attempted to be replicated over and over again to middling success, but will always be remembered as a pinnacle of the action genre. John Wick is a world of interconnected hitmen and women who are part of an exclusive and elegant club called the Continental. It is a master show of world-building, with no exposition and trust that the audience can figure out the universe. This is rare in action and appreciated.

title: Idiocy
text: Fans of Keanu Reeves, rejoice. He actually cries in this movie. Yes, the man is able to show some sort of half-a...d personality in this film that people just EAT UP. You want a review? Here's a review: this is one of the most pathetically cheesy Hollywood films ever made, and to top it off, it's all the more reasons for the average low-intellect American to absorb the watered down caricature version of "New Russia." As a native Russian speaker, I couldn't even understand any of their fake, senseless babbling that they call "Russian." It's all the tacky, predictable bull... Hollywood junkies crave. It's all the fighting, shooting, fancy cars, explosions and blood, and minimal plot line that an anti-intellectual could ever ask to see. Take everything typical and combine it all into one lame Hollywood failure. I can't believe I lasted 3/4th of this retarded movie. And it miraculously won awards? Wow! ÐÑÐµÐ±ÐµÐ´ÐµÐ½Ñ!

title: Surprised by the 10 stars?
text: So... 10 stars? This better be the best movie of all time.Caution: minor spoilers.To clear one thing out: this movie is a action movie. Therefore it's focused on said thing: action.The main cause of action for John in the story - one which everything else settles around - is John coping with his late wife. She gives him a puppy. Cute. Until this point, we see John as a normal guy, sad guy, who lives in a nice house - which is hellish clean, it's a bit unsettling - and has a nice car.Then the mood shifts, after the son of a russian mobster (played by Mikael Nyqvist) steals not just the car but kills the dog and trashes his house. So John starts his revange and the story is put in the background and gets replaced by brutal action. But it's good, because it's executed perfectly - but they also manage it to make you remember the cause John fights for.In conclusion: this movie sure consists of a lot of action but it has hearth put into it and meaning behind it an let's you dive deep into the characters.So it's 10 stars for me, because it is not just thrilling but can also make you think about what you've seen. Either way, this is quiet simply THE Jihn Wick-movie for me and will be.

title: Really Bad
text: Keanu Reeves was unreasonably hero, I started lacking trust in the IMDb rating,

title: The start of a franchise
text: Brilliant opening to an amazing franchise. Keanu Reeves performance is always praised when it comes to the John Wick series, but it's every other actor in the film that makes John Wick what he is. The sheer nerves when mentioning his name really makes the films what they are. John Wick has almost became a household name, the films aren't amazing but they give what you get once you already know what you're in for. This first film does a lot of world building, with the origin story being the stand out feature for me, the only downfall being that the soundtrack is a bit over the top, especially during the really intense sequences. Something more toned down or even nothing at all would work better for me. Overall, a brilliant introduction to a now famed character in cinema, the films may not be critically acclaimed or rated 10/10 on IMDB, but they achieve what they aim to, deliver brutal, entertaining, cinematic action. A must watch.

title: A story worth telling.
text: The first instalment of The John Wick trilogie has a pure but refined plot, one that many have tried to reproduce but none have Yet to even come close to the visual master piece that is John Wick. Its plot though can seem comical has very much the opposite effect on the storytelling from then onward with true character developement around every corner. Even though i am not the most educated on the topic i found that every scene was beautifully executed within its composition. No i believe that this masterpiece is not deserving of being put in the action movie genre, for it is way more than that in every possible way. If you feel interested in watching this movie rest assured that your time and effort shall be rewarded asmuch as mine have been watching this.

title: Phenomenal story and action.
text: This movie is phenomenal, quite possibly the best Keanu reeves movie and best action movie. The story is a very basic revenge story but the camera work and symbolism tells the story in a surprisingly well done way and I think this is some of the best acting Keanu reeves has ever done. The action is so so good and the set pieces are both visually outstanding and super interesting and expand the outside world of the universe. The film is super funny and they build up John wick in such a unique way. Finally the action is extremely realistic from the way the fighting happens, the way they use guns, the struggle and gritty realism of each action shot and even down to John wick having to reload everytime his mag would be empty. Great movie if you've not seen it watch it.

title: Lit wick explodes
text: What a surprise! Was this action, was this sci-fi, was this the guy who played Ted? This movie took me to places I didn't know existed. For me it just reeked originality, grit and it was a wild, welcome ride. Nowadays you see this type of thing coming out of Hollywood all the time. They have the budget, they know their audiences and good action flicks are always welcomed ... even if people pretend to want peace, love and goodwill towards their fellow man/woman ... the thirst for gladiators and blood sport lingers deep in the psyche of civilized man ... it's the way that it is. So why does it work so well in John Wick? Beats me as I've seen variations of this before. And yes they have turned this into a franchise, so now there is more John Wick 2 and 3 ... I am so glad there is. Never mess with a dog lover.

title: An Above Average Action Thriller
text: 25 October 2014. John Wick is graphic with plenty of bloody special effects, especially to the upper body. This movie introduces an appealing cerebral element that the director or screen writer along with a more layered antagonist making making for its own Bourne Identity (2002) character. The interplay between John Wick and his former partner is consistently developed and brings a tense evolving relational element not part of too many action thrillers. There are two lighter scenes which offer up a nice break in the action without having to sacrifice the serious dramatic tone of the movie. Entertaining, satisfying, and adding some nice new martial art touches. Worth the money to see it though.

title: Dog Sad :(
text: This is a super well done action movie. It gives enough plot to keep the action interesting and never feels dry. title: Great Film
text: Finally, a good hit- man movie. I find most action, hit-men movies are all basically the same to the point where they blend in, but this one was down right good. It stands out and shines bright. Keanu Reeves was perfect for this role. He conquered it. It felt like we had Neo back from the Matrix. An unstoppable force of nature who is just down right cool. The movie has it all. A kick butt character, a well written script, something fresh and new and just down right gritty. You have John Wick, the top hit-man assassin who is dragged out of retirement to exact revenge. His revenge is epic and worth the watch.

title: As base as it gets
text: Even for an action movie, this film is as simplistic as it gets. Even for a mindless diversion it's boring. I found myself interested for a full 4 minutes during this hour and a half drone. In a world cram packed with action movies this offers absolutely nothing new, interesting, or beneficial.There was some action, which was no different from every other action film. There was mindless machismo-ism based around tired, meaningless revenge, completely void of inspiration. There was no plot-- whatsoever. It's no more than a long series of repetitive, uncreative trigger-pulling scenes with no redeeming factors.Save yourself the agony and watch something that will bring you reflection over base, retrogressive diversions.

title: One of the best action films ever
text: John Wick is absolutely one of my favourite films every, if not the the top. Everything about this film is well thought out and tight. The music is excellent, paring beautifully and fitting well with scenes. The cinematography is absolutely outstanding, the fight scenes are incredible, visceral and have a much greater sense of urgency and reality compared to other films. The story is plain but that is exactly what the films needs. It's almost ridiculous plot, if anything, adds to it's greatness. John Wick would do everything he did for something so "minor". The way the world is shown not told is also exceptional. It feels deep and interesting and real albeit over the top at times. This is done better than the later films which give too much exposition for the various things/factions. The way people just know who John is is wonderful to and seem scared.Everything is very well put together even down to the interestingly coloured subtitles when people speak languages other than English.Would absolutely watch again and again (and that would be near my 10th watch)

title: The Action movie we all deserve
text: For years, decades, Hollywood tried to shove stupid action movies down our throats.Every bullet misses, punches aren't heavy at all, and the hero aaaaalways has to say something.John Wick, featuring the fantastic, amazing, wonderful Keanu Reeves, is showing Hollywood how it's supposed to be done. In a 100 minutes long movie, which is actually rather short for today's trends, the movie makes us feel like John feels, hate like John hates, and cheer as John kills. It's one of the few non-superhero action movies, that wives and husbands can watch together, and completely enjoy it.While respecting the "The Heroes Story" timeline, John Wick mixes it up, and shows us all that all it takes to create a bad-ass Action hero and a great action movie (franchise).Shoot, kill, repeat. No senseless talking, explaining, dramatizing. John Wick does exactly what every single one of us watchers would want to do in his situation.Great movie, great fun, awesome Keanu.The only thing that could improve the movie would be Brendan Fraser.

title: Impossible but fun!
text: I must have watched the JW trilogy about 4 times now and recommended it to a whole bunch of friends. But why?It's an action film and people die. That sounds like a lot of 80's action films so far. Except this is done to a high standard and is very classy. There is minimum cheese, and it's about a world that we can't really imagine exists.Yes, it's impossible, both in his actions, success and the world it's in, but that's the whole point of film, right? It's escapism, not a documentary. At least, I hope it's not a documentary, because if it is, I as never going outside again.Give it a try. This is the cleanest of the three as it was only meant to be a single film. But if you want more than guns, keep watching the series...

title: Short, sweet, breathtaking cinematography.
text: The action shots for John Wick are some of the best in cinema. With a groundbreaking feeling on parallel to the release of another Keanu focused movie, The Matrix, action and fight sequences feel natural and steady. None of that shaky cam fake action.The movie doesn't add any unnecessary padding that doesn't feel necessary to the story. However, this sometimes plays to it's detriment when we see characters come and go that try to show complexity without the time to properly develop them and make us care.My biggest criticism would be in the antagonist's character, which seems to flip about halfway through the movie for no apparent reason, and feels wildly inconsistent in his behaviour and decision making.This movie reeked of comic book adaptation, and it's no surprise that a comic book series has been put into motion after the films release. It plays off the comic book balance of just enough origin story to grasp the protagonist's motives, but not too much as to ruin the mystery or close off possible story archs in future titles.

title: I would react in the same way if someone hurt my pets
text: John Wick was the film that started it all: a big successful franchise and it reinvented the action genre in the 2010s. The story was simple, a retired assassin lost his wife, and the arrogant son of a Russian gangster killed a dog, leading to a bloody path of vengeance. It seems silly but there was a bit of heart to the film as John Wick dealt with his grief and there was a tongue-in-cheek approach due to secret assassin world.The big selling point was the action. It came out when there were shake cam copycats, superhero fare, and safe PG-13. John Wick was a breath of fresh air since there was elaborate stunt work, gun fights, and a lot of violence. And the filmmakers did one important thing, they made sure they could follow the action sequences.

title: Hard to understand high rating
text: It is impossible to write a spoiler for this movie because it is completely predictable. Just read the storyline - the movie doesn't take you anywhere else. Yet another movie where the only driving force is revenge. I wonder if most movie goers find hate and revenge to be acceptable motivations in one's live. I don't think one can blame the actors to make the same facial expression throughout the entire move - I rather think that the story doesn't have characters but rather figures like in a chess game that you move from here to there and that can perform only a single type of movement. But for those who like it loud with a lot of 'bangs' perhaps it is good relaxation and to take emotional revenge on one's boring job and unbearable boss...

title: Slick and fun

title: A Surprisingly Stylish Action Movie
text: This exceeded my expectations and I really enjoyed it. The plot is a basic one almost bordering on ludicrous, retired hitman is wronged and seeks revenge but when the action starts, wow. Reeves is excellent as the hero, the action sequences are slick and original, the mood, lighting and soundtrack rocks. There is humour and originality in many aspects to the movie. I especially liked the hotel for Villains storyline, which I believe they may be turning into a TV series. A really good watch. I only had one real gripe. Reeves is wronged at the start of the movie by three/four Russian Mafia but then goes on a rampage where he quite easily slaughters hundreds without breaking a sweat. Surely these few hoods at the start could not take out such a seasoned assassin. Then again it is Hollywood and without it we would not have a movie so will let it slide. Great Saturday night popcorn movie entertainment

title: Awesome movie

And that's all thanks to a group of filmmakers with the simple gusto to actually make a dog revenge movie. But that just becomes our waypoint into a world full of weirdo hit-man hotels, tactical double tap-laden action, and a populace filled with nothing but goofy reverence for Keanu's pulp menace (where's he's really at his best).So yeah, this one is absolutely awesome.

title: John Wick the action and emotionally packed movie that doesn't shift away from violence
text:
This movie is such an overwhelming film filled with so many exceptional action packed scenes that have insanely great choreography to match it. But at the same time the movie has spectacular dialog to help us understand why John Wick does what he does in this movie. Another fantastic thing in this movie is all the acting in this movie is just so perfect and acted out amazingly by every actor.
John Wick is about a legendary ex-assassin named John Wick (Keanu Reeves) who is brought back into the fold out of retirement from his violent career because some ruthless mobsters take away John's favorite car and kill the last present his wife gives him after she dies which is a puppy. But John releases the unforgiving killing machine inside himself and is out to get retribution for their actions. While at the same time the leader of the Russian mob named Virgo Tarasov (Michael Nyqvist) puts out a giant reward for John's head because he is trying to kill his son Losef Tarasov (Alfie Allen).
Directors Chad Stahelski and David Leitch did a great job with this movie showing how they can make a really slick looking movie with superb action scenes but also create amazing dialog scenes to go with the movie. Both Stahelski and Leitch are veteran stuntman and in John Wick they really show how well they can direct a movie. Unlike Victor Armstrong who is also a veteran stuntman, he was great at being a stuntman but when it came to directing a movie it didn't go as great. Also I love how the directors are able to understand the whole action packed parts of the movie and just how wonderful they are to showing it. One of the only problems I have with the movie is the beginning and the ending to John Wick, it just seems so tacked on and could have been done better.
I would personally say that John Wick is one of Keanu Reeves best movie performances he's ever had to do, well all of the John Wick movies so far. But this is probably one of his best yet. John Wick requires so much out of Keanu Reeves from all of the stunt work he does to all of the emotional scenes. On a side note I would like to add that Keanu Reeves does almost all of his stunt work in John Wick so to get prepared for this movie he had to do a lot of extra training to get physically prepared for the movie. But I would personally say that it really paid off for Keanu Reeves to do the extra work.
In the trailer for this movie you see that some Russian mobsters kill his puppy and take his car and then he goes to seek revenge. I would say that in the movie it explains more into the reason why he goes seeking for vengeance and at first when you watch the trailer you're probably telling yourself how stupid of a reason that is to go on the bloody trail that he does in order for vengeance. But when you watch the movie from start to finish you start putting yourself into John's shoes and you are more understanding into why he does what he does.
Also when you watch the movie, you start to see how the writer (Derek kolstad) is kind of building the world that John Wick is in and how it helps set up for more John Wick sequels to be made and not seem forced on us. The writer creates this whole underground secret organisation of criminals. Unlike the movie series called The Maze Runner where at the end of the movie it just says and there's gonna be more movie. In John Wick it just builds the universe for more sequels to happen and it also shows the immense potential in the franchise.
John Wick is such a wonderful piece of work and I would recommend every action movie lover to see it. But also I believe that this movie would be great for almost anyone above the age of fifteen only because it is rated R. Also if you are a Keanu Reeves fan then I definitely believe you should see it due to his performance. But whatever you do when you see this movie don't view it for just the action. Take the whole movie all together.

title: Oh god at the awesome violence.

title: Real action

title: A Phenomenal artwork in modern cinema
text: John Wick is a action packed film and one of the most visually impressive in recent years.Although it is quite insane for a man to go on a rampage quest over the death of a dog, the meaning behind it is verytouching and heartfelt.Besides also giving the audience what they love to watch the most - Keanu Reeves kicking ass.The movie is accompanied by dark and beautiful visuals which fit the tone and pace of the film. The cinematography is among the most beautiful of the 2010's movies and the choreography for all the fight sequences are stunning.John Wick is not just a great movie but the beginning of a franchise and the legacy of The Baba Yega.

title: I expected sheer enjoyment and that's what I got
text: Pure entertainment, thisHappy to have finally got around to watching this franchise! I expected sheer enjoyment and that's what I got. 'John Wick' is good fun! It is more hammy than I thought it would be, not that that's a criticism. Some characters duck out surprisingly abruptly too (justice for Clarke Peters!), even when the one who should get taken out immediately somehow manages to stick around for a while.Keanu Reeves is always a pleasure to watch act. His character is a badass, that's for sure. If I'm being truthful, none of the others stood out to me too much - not in a negative way, just moreso they are all on the same level as each other behind Reeves. Willem Dafoe is the best of the rest, though.I look forward to checking out the sequels, which I'm expecting positive things from - especially with, presumably, bigger budgets.

title: The action is so smooth and stylish.
text: I'm watching through all the John Wick movies again before I see Chapter 4. John Wick is about a man, a retired ex-hitman, who loses his wife. He gets a puppy as a last gift from his wife after she dies. Then his car is stolen and his dog is killed by some gangsters. Now John Wick is angry. Now John Wick wants revenge. Then the rest of the movie is filled with revenge seeking action. It's almost like one long action scene.It is a very entertaining action style. The gunfights are very stylish and innovative. His gun really feels like an extension of his arm. He is so confident with his gun. One would almost like to have a rating displayed and upgraded after every kill he makes. Like in the video game franchise Devil May Cry! The action is so smooth and stylish. I was so entertained by this movie, but I feel it has the potential to be even more stylish and entertaining, so it is good that there are sequels!Final stylish rating: B+

title: Great action film.
text: John Wick is a great action film, the kind of which are rarely made today. It is R rated but not frenzied like most action films- you know who is killing who and more importantly why. This no- holds barred action film is an example in execution. Keanu Reeves is at home in an action film and once again proves that he can do stunts as good as any actor out there even though he is well in his 50s. There's not much to write about John Wick because there isn't much of a narrative, but boy is it totally worth it. Just go watch John Wick.

title: Watch your back !
text: At the instant Wick is given the safehouse address of the russian mob leader's son, John starts the hunt. Only problem : the troubled father is still standing less than ten feet away and could easily have shot John in the back.It took me several viewings before noticing this mistake. However, I'm just a movie fan. I believe someone from the movie staff (script, director...) should have realized the optics were bad. With a shot or two in the back, no finale for John Wick and obviously no sequel either !I feel that recent productions don't pay attention to details. Specially when the survival of the main character is at stake ! Do aim higher !

title: John Wick: Mom's Favorite Action Film
text: John Wick is a movie that my mother just can't get enough of. She recommended it to me, and I must say, I was pleasantly surprised. This movie is a fun ride from start to finish, and the main character, John Wick, played by Keanu Reeves, is just fantastic. His performance is both intense and hilarious, and the action scenes are just a treat to watch.I was thoroughly entertained by John Wick, and I would highly recommend it to anyone who's looking for a good time. The humor in the movie is just as good as the action, and the story is well-crafted. The film is a perfect example of how a movie can be both serious and fun at the same time.The characters in John Wick are also fantastic, and the storyline is full of twists and turns that will keep you on the edge of your seat. The movie is definitely a must-watch for anyone who loves action movies, and the performance of Keanu Reeves is just outstanding.John Wick is a film that my mother loves, and I can understand why. It's a fun, action-packed movie that will keep you entertained from start to finish. So go ahead and check it out, I promise you won't be disappointed!

title: Simply amazing
text: An incredible action film beyond comprehension. Keanu Reeves delivers the best in his career not 1 boring moment. You will want more and more and more.

title: Good Evening, Mr Wick
text: On paper, this film looks like a typical action film. However the things that set this film apart is the stylishness of the film and the incredible world it createsFirst of all, Keanu Reeves shows he still has what it takes to be a successful actor. He gives a multi layered performance as Mr Wick, and makes you fear this fictional character, and after watching the film i am thankful. One thing that adds to the film is that Reeves did that majority of his own stunts, this makes the action feel more fluid and the man even more bad-ass. After seeing Reeves in this film, i could imagine no one else in the role. The films strongest trait, is the fight sequences. Once the action starts, it never seems to stop. The fights are brilliantly choreographed and they seem realistic and brutal. The mixture of martial arts the character uses shows real skill, and adds to the realistic feel of the film and world created. John Wick proves himself capable of killing with both hands and firearm. If you're a fan of brilliant action sequences, then this is the film for you.The only criticism of the film is the plot. Although the story brilliantly creates a world of assassins, the plot itself is nothing new and has been seen before, however despite this i was left satisfied that i had not seen an action film like it.Overall, John Wick left me wanting more and is a real treat for action fans and Keanu fans. Bring on John Wick Chapter 2.

title: Point Blank on Steroids
text: In the classic 1967 Neo-Noir Walker (Lee Marvin) is left for dead. In the John Wick, John is effectively left for dead. Well Walker didn't die nor did John Wick. His protagonists wish he had. In Point Blank Walker set out to revenge his attempted killing and make the people who left him like this pay. In John Wick, John sets out to revenge the men that wrecked his house, killed his dog and left him for dead or at least that is what it looked like. In Point Blank the protagonists. Carol O'Conner, John Vernon wish he was dead. Michael Nyquist and Alfie Allen (Theon Greyjoy = Game of Thrones) also regret that John Wick didn't dieI confess I hadn't seen John Wick until now. I avoided it because I thought it was just a cheap shoot 'em up with bodies everywhere. Well it delivered that as well. That John Wick he goes beyond nine lives. The rest not so much. Anyway this turns out in the end to be a stylish neo-noir. Even some classic turns by Willem Dafoe and Ian McShane. Oh yes typical revenge flick but done with some decent dialogue, a story behind all the bodies and pulsating music. But gee the dog. What creeps. I might even look up John Wick 2 and 3.

title: Simple premise, rich world
text: Surprisingly good movie. It seeems like there is little to work with at first but the world from which John Wick retired is very interesting and I want to know more. The solid writing and performances and the brutal action scenes make this a gem.

title: Keanu, Action, and Skillful treatment.
text: Lots of gunfire, lots of whirling car rides, lots of violence, lots of blood....and lots of FUN. One should shudder at the thought of all of the frequent bodies flying across the screen, but, here, it amounts to a roller coaster ride of vengeance and retribution. Keanu Reeves handles this kind of chore easily, although, one of these days, he should have the chance to show his skillful acting range (Damn, he has played Hamlet, other Shakespearean works, and sturdy drama and comedy(. Nonetheless, John Wick zooms along with the speed of bullets flooding the screen, and the direction and editing and cinematography are all of the highest order.

title: Another Review
text:
John Wick (2014) is a typical action movie about a man taking revenge. The movie started with John Wick get out from a car while badly injured, then the screen goes black and showing him at his wife funeral. At the first 20 minutes of the movie, it's showing us about the daily life of a no one man named John Wick and how his dog killed and how his car get robbed too.
But after that 20 minutes running time, the movie started to show us about how badass he is and horrible his job world before. its turn out that John Wick was an ex-legendary hit-man that retired after his marriage. Even the car robber father who's was one of his old clients afraid of him so much and tell us how dangerous John Wick was that he killed 3 armed men just with a pencil. Then after that, the movie continues with John Wick shoots people in the face until the end of the movie.
As far as I know, John Wick is the best action movie series. This movie is just filled with pure action, there was never a dull moment happened. There is no pointless long dialogue that makes action sequence to sequence felt confusing. Every action sequence in this movie is amazingly executed, you will never have trouble to understand what happened in front of you. All you need to do is sit tight and enjoy the movie.

title: Don't set him off
text: John Wick (2014) was such an awesome action movie starring Keanu Reeves. This movie shows how cool Keanu Reeves can be, and that this movie was directed very well with a simple plot that we might have seen a bunch of times, but it works in this movie.Keanu Reeves as John Wick was fantastic; you understand where he comes from with multiple tragedies happening to him, involving his wife and his dog. Keanu Reeves was awesome in the action sequences doing great stunt work and a lot of shooting people in the face. He was simply great as an amazing assassination being dragged out of retirement and killing people for a justified reason.The action sequences are fun and cool to watch; a lot of them are in beautiful camera long takes with a lot of particularly good cinematography. The fighting style Jiu Jitsu Keanu Reeves uses in the movie was amazing to watch how skilled he was in the movements, and how much time he took to learn this style of fighting for the movie.The world building in the movie involving an assassin hotel called The Continental was remarkably interesting, and the friends that John Wick knew were interesting to watch. Also, some of the rules in this assassination world they are building were cool but also interesting on how this world runs.John Wick (2014) is a fantastic action movie that I recommend watching if you have not already. It has a simple premise we all know but the way it is executed and shown works very well, making this a fun movie to watch. This movie is also worth watching Keanu Reeves being awesome in such a cool character like John Wick.

title: A perfect action movie
text: It's got literally everything that a great action movie needs. A villain who is easy to hate, a hero who isn't exactly a good guy, incredibly well-choreographed and well-thought-out action scenes, cool cars, a cool soundtrack, some interesting lore (The International Hotel is such a cool idea) and cool scenery. I love this movie and if you want to watch a long-haired, sad Keanu Reeves be the baddest mamma jamma on the face of the planet, in interesting and vaguely sinister and settings you are in the right place.

title: Slick, brutal, and satisfying, 'John Wick' is the type of action film that all others of its ilk should aspire to be like.
text: It delivers intense, kinetic, expertly filmed gunplay with an ice-cold performance from Keanu Reeves - who does virtually all his own stunts - but also manages to carve out much more from its simple premise, transcending its revenge formula with a sprinkle of world building when the bullets aren't tearing through bodies and environments.The soundtrack only adds to the intensity of the shootouts, with a standout sequence being set in a nightclub: a dizzying, exciting whirlwind of carnage against a backdrop of blue strobe lighting and set to the pulse of hardcore electronic music. Stunning.Ultimately, I could watch Keanu Reeves kill bad guys all day.9/10

title: This is where it all started!
text: Evenin', John.Evenin', Jimmy. Noise complaint?Noise complaint.You know what makes John Wick revolutionary? It's not so much about the action as the presentation of it. If you notice, most of the sequences are shot with wide angle lenses, and that does two things: one, our focus lingers on the choreography, and two, these wide shots and longer spans in-between transitions and cuts make the scenes more believable and immersive.The use of practical effects, such as wire work and stunts, also contributes to the action's realism. Furthermore, sound design plays an important role in amplifying the impact of each hit and punch, making the action feel even more intense and visceral.Then you throw in a character such as Wick, who isn't like any other demented, troubled murderer but someone who has a calculated, willful mind. As he seeks vengeance for the death of his beloved dog, John Wick's character is not only unique but also relatable. His skills, backstory, and incentive combine to render him a compelling central figure for whom audiences can't help but cheer.

title: I Love You Keanu
text: John Wick, directed by Chad Stahelski, is a stylish and action-packed thriller that follows retired hitman John Wick as he seeks revenge against the Russian mobsters who killed his beloved dog.Keanu Reeves delivers a standout performance as John Wick, showcasing his impressive physicality and emotional depth. The supporting cast, including Michael Nyqvist as the villainous Viggo Tarasov and Willem Dafoe as Wick's fellow hitman friend, adds to the film's gritty world-building.The film's cinematography and fight choreography are outstanding, with stunning visuals and brutal action sequences that make John Wick a standout entry in the action genre. The film's use of practical effects and minimal use of CGI add to its immersive quality.The film's plot, while simple, is well-executed and allows for the film's action sequences to take center stage. The film's pacing and tone are also well-balanced, with moments of intense violence and emotional depth that add to the film's overall impact.However, some may criticize the film for its focus on violence and revenge, and the film's treatment of its female characters can at times feel objectifying and stereotypical.Overall, John Wick is a stylish and thrilling action film that showcases Keanu Reeves at his best. While it may not be for everyone, its impressive action sequences and immersive world-building make it a standout in the action genre and a must-see for fans of the genre.

title: Dreadful movie
text: If you like fast cars, squealing tires, gratuitous violence, shoot-em up bang-bangs and a weak plot, then this is the film for you. Don't watch it with a full-stomach; the very essence of the film will make you sick.Some top notch actors, but they are miscast. What are Ian McShane and William Devane doing in this garbage? I guess times must be tough.A dog is killed very early in the film. The plot is very unlikely and is tailored for the violence.If you are anywhere near civilized, stay away.This is not a movie for children. It's not one for adults, either, so save whatever money and time you can by not viewing it.

title: Dialogue not needed
text: Some films are at their best when they are monosyllabic. Every rhythm, moment and action sequence here was familiar, but this movie knew what it was...through and through. The action did the talking, and the characters did the opposite. The stylized violence became almost a dance: music + guns, no words required. And - other than the few moments of Keanu talking - it was pretty perfect.
