title: An example of a good action movie
text: John Wick is a film made by two former stuntmen and you can feel it in it. Everything about it is good. Script, cinematography, acting and music.The plot tells the story of a former assassin John Wick, nicknamed Baba Yaga. But at the very beginning of the film we see cutie Keanu and his loving wife, who soon dies of illness, leaving the main character a dog as a parting gift. And now Wick has only three things in life that are dear to him: a car, a dog and the memory of his wife. And they take everything from him except the third. So John goes for revenge...The film deals with how others treat John in a very funny way. Everyone goes to fight against him, as if it were a deliberate act of ending their lives.In the film itself, a lot of screenwriting work was done to create the lore of the secret world of killers. They have their own currency, their own hotel system and their own social package (doctors, gunsmiths, workshops, etc.)The camera work is top notch. All locations are so pretty and memorable. After the film, I spent two hours looking for where the real continental was located. The hotel looked very cool.The actors play in such a way that you believe them. I liked Keanu and William Dafoe the most. They are ideal for the roles of mysterious killers with a difficult fate.The action scenes stand out for their choreography; this is, in fact, the calling card of the film. The cartridges are running out, John is counting them and uses his own original moves during gunfights and brawls. I was also surprised by the fact that Reeves did all the stunts himself.Therefore, everyone who loves good action films, be sure to watch it!

title: best action film ive seen in ages

It had everything really lots of action and fighting carried we'll by keanu and eacho actor in their own right are believable . john makes you actually feel for him and stay on his story though out. One of the most important things I take from this is that unlike a lot of action films I've seen recently. This stays consistent with no boring bits or fragmented conversation. You know who's who and can just enjoy it. Well deserved 9/10,:)

title: This is a magic carpet ride
text: I was concerned this will be another dull same old same old movie.But it wasn't.This is a great action movie that creates a new superhero assassin. It pulls you in emotionally and then kicks the holly out of the baddies. I love it! There is very few words spoken in the movie, but it achieves something incredibly entertaining. title: John Wick is a standout entry in the action genre
text: I recently revisited John Wick (2014) on Netflix. The film follows a retired assassin who emerges from retirement following a devastating home invasion that results in the death of his beloved dog. Seeking vengeance, Wick hunts down those responsible, leaving a trail of destruction in his wake.Directed by Chad Stahelski (known for the John Wick series), the film features a stellar cast including Keanu Reeves (The Matrix), Willem Dafoe (Spider-Man), John Leguizamo (Spawn), Ian McShane (Deadwood), Alfie Allen (Game of Thrones) and David Patrick Kelly (The Warriors).For fans of the action genre, John Wick is a feast for the senses. Reeves shines as the stoic yet relentless hero, while Leguizamo and McShane deliver captivating supporting performances. Dafoe's presence adds an extra layer of intrigue to the narrative. The film sets up its backstory and circumstances effectively, and the action sequences are nothing short of spectacular. With well-choreographed fight scenes and impressive gore, the film keeps audiences on the edge of their seats. The intense shootouts are executed with precision, making it easy to rally behind the protagonist in his quest for justice. Plus, the film boasts a memorable soundtrack that complements the adrenaline-pumping action.In conclusion, John Wick is a standout entry in the action genre, earning a solid 7.5-8/10 rating and a strong recommendation.

title: A baba yaga film
text: I'm a man w focus, sheer will and somethin' when I'm reviewingSypnopsis: it's about a russian punk who stole a car and killed an ex hitman dog named john wick. A retired boogeyman who's coming back to bury the hatchetPros: action packed film. The choreography, action sequence.. straight up classic. It's just fight after fight. The best part? They introduced us to the lore of wick's universe. The services, utilities and amenities that have been provided by the continental are so envious. The transitioning, camera works.. just straight up top notch.Cons: it's an action packed, one man vs one army... it's illogical but it's john wick. Can't say much about it other than... it's a classic film but not a masterpieceOverall? A good film to watch while eating w friends... not family, of course. It's a conversational movie and a very good written one as well. Recommendable to watch with masculine friends.

title: Very good action movie
text: Very good action movieKeane is great as always! Smooth moves and great acting. Always been a fan of Keane, every role he plays he does it so good, but this is really his best role ever played!The story was very well written. Not too slow, not too fast, enough information so you know what is going on, but does not get boring. The fighting scenes were very smooth and cool too watch.The music very well chosen. It helps too really be in the story.I do not give 10s that easy but this movie was definitly worth a 10! I can not say anything negative about this movie.If you are looking for a very good action movie with a good story, then this is the movie for you!

title: It doesn't get better than this!
text: The first thirty minutes of this film are pure perfection. John Wick's wife dies of a disease, she gives him a cute puppy to love, Russian thugs steal his car, beat him, and kill the dog. Wick seeks revenge. Best line of the film- Michael Nyqvist, when told that the reason his son was punched in the face was that his son stole John Wick 's car and killed his dog, simply replies, "Oh." Must see film for Keanu fans!

title: Have you ever wanted to go on a crazy rampage because someone killed your dog?
text: Have you ever wanted to go on a crazy rampage because someone killed your dog? John Wick stars Keanu Reeves, Michael Nvqvist, and Willem Dafoe and is directed by Chad Stahelski (Who funnily enough was the Stunt Coordinator and instructing actor for Keanu Reeves in The Matrix) I enjoyed this film for the most part. There was some very good realism that you rarely see in movies, mostly in the action sequences (John actually reloads!!) They used really cool unique subtitles for the Russian dialogue. And some of the comic relief in serious situations was perfect! My issues with the film have a lot to do with the story, and characters I never was really interested in Mr. Wick or anyone else there. I found myself waiting for the next action sequence rather than enjoying the story itself. I also have had a hard time with Keanu Reeves ever since I first saw him in Hardball.That combined with my lack of excitement for most action movies today due to clichÃ©s is the reason I gave this a B (6/10). #JohnWick #KeanuReeves #Hitman #ActionMovie

title: Absolutely terrible movie
text: Uncreative, amateurish plot with terrible acting (like most Keanu Reeve's films). Ridiculous "shoot-em-up" action throughout with no redeeming moments. I gave up after Reeves had slaughtered his 153rd victim with little more than a few scratches in return. One of Willem Dafoe's poorest performances and typical of Keanu's high-school acting. Even one of my favorite actresses, Bridget Moynahan drowned in the murky waters of this garbage film. The musical score sounded like it was produced by a bad garage-group of teenagers. The cinematography sucked and it took an uncommon staying-power and determination to sit through it 'til the end. This flick is a total waste of time and anyone who gives it more than a 2 has been smoking bad weed.

title: A Brand New FRANCHISE!
text: I don't know how deeply I want to get into this. It's like stepping into a septic tank.So let's keep it short. Keanu Reeves is John Wick, wearing a cloak of ordinariness. Some Russian miscreants insult him at a gas station. That night, they break into his house, beat hell out of him, steal his car, and kill his dog. Well! The beating, yes; the car maybe; but the dog -- NO! His response is first-order change. He knows who dunnit because he just retired from a Special Ops group and he's skilled at martial arts, the use of deadly weapons, and has a talent with macramÃ©. None of these guys with a hidden past ever turns out to have been a busboy or a plumber. Similarly, the bad guys, as here, tend to be either Germans, Russians, or Arabs. We've never quite forgiven the Germans for World War II. Russia was balanced on the fence but now with Putin in charge, a dictator manquÃ©, they seem to be fair game again. I'm certain that in the crepuscular recesses of Hollywood board rooms they are DYING to drag Muslims into the narratives but it wouldn't be PC now, would it? The plot? Oh, the plot. John Wick shoulders his way through a crowded night club where the Russkies hang out and shoots everyone who looks disagreeable. His gun is quick. And he's thorough. One ugly adversary gets three bullets in the abdominal cavity and one in the center of the forehead. The wounded lying on the floor, he shoots and kills more or less in passing, not really paying much attention to them. That's just the first brutal encounter. Several others follow.In between massacres there are a few minutes of metaphysical discourse. "John, what happened? You and I were colleagues." "Yes, but bonds fade with time." "Surely some symbolic interactionism persists." "Well -- YES AND NO." "At least as the systemic level!" "But not as individual traits." "But how can you KNOW that?" "My epistemological intuition." (Bang, shoots interlocutor in center of forehead, dead center on the saggital suture.) By the end, Wick has either killed or brought about the death of dozens of men and women. Willem DaFoe dies horribly, for reasons never explained. It was just time for another bloody killing, I guess.Someone else suggested that this was a perfect action movie because it had nothing much other than perfect action. And if you don't like action movies, then stay away from them. I suppose I don't like most action movies -- the Stallones, the Schwarzeneggers, the van Damms, although I have a few on DVDs if they have something going for them besides blood -- if the narrative is properly jelled ("The Bourne Identity") or if its so silly it's amusing ("The Terminator") -- but "John Wick" takes itself seriously, as if it were structured in a way that distinguishes it from one of those skin flick with just enough of a thin plot to link the sexual episodes, the genre that begins with a happily married couple, then drags in a new lover for each, then the chauffeur, then the mule, and so on. Yet, the perceptive viewer is able to discern a moral message beneath the mayhem. Leave dogs alone.Why go on? John Wick, Chapter 2, is already in theaters.

title: the boogeyman
text: First of all, the cast. Of course Keanu Reeves is the heart & soul of the film but we also got Ian McShane, Willem Dafoe, Alfie Allen, Adrianne Palicki, & Lance Reddick. All very talented. But I gotta hand it to Keanu. There was actually a scene where he made me emotional. His line delivery caught me off guard. I can't say I've shed a tear for Keanu's performances before now. He did such a good job.The concept is really cool. Any sort of Assassin or Secret Agent premise is solid. John Wick is thankfully one of the many takes on the idea that didn't fall through and had solid execution as well. It really throws you off though given how John Wick throws himself back in the Assassin's Creed. Not only do you not expect it but it's unnecessarily tragic... Let's just say that next time I get on the Sims 4, I'm going to create John Wick and give him all the dogs he deserves.Really enjoyed all the fighting sequences. They're all well choreographed and believable to some extent. It also looks like Keanu a lot of the time, as if it's not just a lot of crazy motion blurring a stunt double. It actually looks like he did a lot of the fighting, which I think he did.

title: forget Neo

title: Bruce Lee meets Fred'n'Ginger, with Uzis and Mustangs
text: I was there when Bruce Lee came out (the movies, not the other thing), before they tried to do it in English. You sat openmouthed at the grace, rhythm and yes, beauty of two expert combatants attempting to break one another's bones. The plot? Revenge, served hot, and countless stooges doing what little boys do - play-acting a spectacular death. The End, apart from the hero being invincible.The John Wick franchise has brought the Bruce Lee/Jackie Chan martial arts genre into urban America; you don't watch it for anything but the stunts. If you enjoy 'Grand Theft Auto', you'll enjoy this.Not much more to say. The production team know exactly what they're doing, and it all comes together. Just the right amount of humour; maybe a little heavy on the style.

title: What more could you ask for?
text: Except maybe a more creative title. Keanu Reeves really embodies this stoic character and takes him on an exciting journey through some really, really impressive fight choreography. John Wick is a great action thriller that thrilled me the whole way through.A clever world of assassins is developed here, but the main things driving this movie are honor, respect, sadness, and anger. A lot of this is about sadness and anger; there are a lot of revenge flicks out there, but this one did a good job of making me feel for John and why he's doing what he's doing.

title: As good as advertised
text: This movie doesn't waste time on stupid trivial filler such as storyline or dramatic plot. No, it plays to its one strength and it does this very well and relentlessly. Non-stop gunfu action.The movie is a graphic display of Mr. Reeves' intense training and time spent becoming a martial arts expert and marksman. I think this feat is actually more impressive than the film itself, and videos of his training truly made me appreciate the cinematic expose far more than if I had just watched the movie.There are some standard tropes - Russian mobsters and a guild of assassins. The rest is all a gun-play fuled revenge fantasy where John Wick becomes an unstoppable juggernaught of fury murdering the ever-loving snot out of each and every Russian Mafia lacky on screen for the next 80 or 90 minutes.It is glorious mindless violence and noise. It does this very well, and I recommend this movie for anyone's viewing pleasure.

title: Superficial Action Film Derivative
text: I got a couple recommendations to see this movie from friends and heard online that it was great. Huge disappointment I am legitimately annoyed that I watched that, at times it was so cringe worthy, I wanted to look away.The plot is very shallow. There is little character development and the action movie clichÃ©s are off the radar. Its like a pre-teen action movie enthusiast wrote this and no one critiqued it. My favorite part was John Leguizamo's scene, but its all downhill from there.I thought maybe Keanu wrote and directed this himself since he is so adept at shooting guns in real life, and maybe he wanted to show it off. Also since you would have to be so full of yourself to even do this movie. But the firefights were boring and as you can imagine, gun handling prowess is not exactly entertaining.The thing is, straight from the beginning you can tell its bad, but you say, well maybe it will get better. There is nothing original about the badassness being displayed, it is painfully contrived. I am gonna have to draw up an action movie script myself to see if maybe being original is hard at this point just to try to justify the staleness of this movie.The whole boogeyman thing was corny, and Keanu did not do anything we haven't already seen a million times before. And how about when he was taking a shower and all you see is the Pillsbury dough-boy and you expect me to believe he is the deadliest killer alive? I would have liked to have seen a more cerebral assassin style of rampage mode movie. Do not recommend, I would recommend Wanted over this its got a better stylized action.

title: "You, uh, workin' again?" "No, I was just sortin' some stuff out."
text: Had this been a vehicle for a more established actor, an older actor as had been initially intended, I imagine it would have been assigned to someone like Willis or Stallone and become yet another forgettable effort lost in the twilight of their careers. Its not that there's anything wrong with either Bruce or Sly, its just that they've made an unfortunate number of mediocre films in recent years in an effort to keep themselves relevant. Willis' recent "Death Wish" folly is an example of a film that shouldn't have been made, and yet he seems all too eager to make this rip-off of an altogether superior Bronson film. Indeed Hollywood in general has developed an industry of unintelligent, one dimensional action films, most of which are lack lustre remakes, and - through the miracle of marketing - have made them disproportionately successful. The golden era which produced Dirty Harry, Rambo: First Blood andTerminator(s) 1 and 2 appeared a distant memory in the wake of the Cranks, average Expendables sequels and the never ending stream of The Fast and the Furious films. All hope seemed lost for a decent action film which had both entertaining action sequences and some measure of intelligence applied in its creation.Enter John Wick.The film weighs an apparently simplistic revenge plot against a counter balance of ironic black humour, stylish cinematography, exceptional fight choreography and a star who approaches the eopnymous charcater as though he were performing in a serious dramatic role. Keanu Reeves' class adds credibilty an sympathy to a character that wuld have appeared predictable and dull had some action has-been been cast. He invokes the quiet, underplayed menace of Bronson in his best roles while also injecting a wry sense of locaonic wit.Overall, I diodn't expect to enjoy this move as much as I did. Previously, I've found Reeves' earlier catalogue to be a litle trying, but since the Matrix he appears to have evolved into an altogether different class of actor. He brings the method intensity of a younger De Niro to roles which other actors would consider throwaway action stereotypes, and would only play them as such. Reeve's Wick is both terrifying in his capability for violent retribution and also tragic in his isolation and grief, something which surely cannot be said for Bruce Willis' Paul Kersey rip off. So if anyone is on the fence, sit down and hit play on Netflix (UK, I can't vouch for other regions). I was expecting, as I've said numerous times, a dull and over-hyped revenge flick. What I watched might just be a modern masterpiece in this genre, both in its narrative simplicity and artistic approach, and I find it hard to fault.Watch it!

title: John Wick is the man you hire to kill the Boogeyman
text: Holy crap!! Keanu Reeves is a boss. I always thought of him as an okay actor, mostly because of the way he delivers lines, but here it really works. The story is simple but effective, and you understand John Wick's motivations. The action and stunts are amazing! They're some of the best fight scenes I've ever seen on screen, and the best part is that you can SEE the action. No quick cuts or shaky cam nonsense, the action is clear and brutal. Best action scene in the whole movie is the night club scene. This is an action movie lover's wet dream. Only nitpick I have with this is that the end fight scene is a little standard and clichÃ©d, but its a small gripe, the movie is still amazing. Its a must see and is one of the best action movies of the 2010's.

title: Thin story and a lot of blood
text: The film ÂJohn Wick" has well deserved my straight one-star-rating: for the fantastic looks of Keanu Reeves and the absolutely cool music.Unfortunately the story line is not at all carrying the whole length of the film: An alighted former order killer who started into a normal life again, is just mourning about the death of his beloved wife when he is being attacked by the brutal and greedy son of a former opponent. The nasty guy and his friends not just stole his nice car but also killed his cute little dog. Now he is seeking for revenge. The whole story is told in the first quarter of an hour and the remaining film is focusing on the merciless seeking for revenge.Not too much surprising content: A lot of clichÃ©s, black and white characters, not even the dialogues are too bright either. Funny impressions just arise from the absurd exaggeration in violent scenes.A certain amount of dullness and murderous frenzy is very helpful to enjoy the amount of blood squirting out of heads and chests during almost the whole film.Mr. Wick knows no mercy and there's no satisfaction until the last one is dead. Unfortunately that takes incredibly long: You will inevitably get bored of it although there are some minor variations in the killing methods presented. Don't trust the average rating of this film: it's possible that the ratings are provided by some enthusiastic violence and / or car lovers and / or numb heads among those who are switching their brains off as soon as the film starts. All you disappointed viewers: Why don't you share your opinion to balance this completely inappropriate good rating for this film???

title: Just Straight Up Some of the Coolest Action
text:
Keanu Reeves will always be known for The Matrix, and this movie reunites him with his stunt double from those films who takes a shot in the director's chair. The film basically has 2 directors (and one is scheduled to direct Deadpool 2 so there's that), and since both come from a background of doing stunts from dozens of your favorite action movies, this film gets boiled down to its essence. They aren't going to try wowing you with a special plot; no, they're going to deliver high-octane action. And really it's quite successful. Keanu did some major training for the highly choreographed scenes and performs most of his own stunts, and the result pays off. Expect a high body count, and expect many of them to have some really cool kill shots. This film knows its goal is to entertain with cool, quick action, and that's exactly what it does. I will say, however, one of the best and worst parts comes from the beginning. The film honestly almost takes an Up approach of giving the audience all the exposition it needs in a small time without much dialogue at all. And I love that. But it-along with just a few action moments-gets heavy-handed. Like at one point Keanu is grabbing all his guns and gearing up, and the movie blares a rocking song about guns and killing and it feels a bit too obvious. I wasn't going to talk about the plot because, well, who cares for this film, but it leads to my other critique. The film gets a nice supporting role from Willem Dafoe and gives way too little screen time to John Leguizamo, but the plot gets going after a mob boss's son steals from John Wick and leaves him for dead. This son, Iosef, is annoyingly stereotypical. He's brash, arrogant, and above all else, completely inept. He fits the bill of all the stereotypes, and it just makes you wonder how long it will take John Keanu Reeves Wick to hunt him down. It's been awhile since an action film has had this much style to it. It overcomes typical shortcomings by thoroughly delivering in well-executed action scenes.
You can find this review and dozens of others at gillipediamoviereviews.blogspot.com

title: Coolest movie ever
text: Action-packed and adrenaline-fueled.Keanu Reeves' portrayal of the titular character, John Wick, is nothing short of iconic. He brings a stoic and relentless intensity to the role, making John Wick a force to be reckoned with on the screen.The film's action sequences are expertly choreographed and executed, setting a new standard for intense and visceral combat scenes. John Wick's proficiency in gun-fu and hand-to-hand combat leaves audiences on the edge of their seats, craving for more.John Wick boasts a captivating and stylish visual presentation, with a noir-inspired aesthetic that adds to the film's gritty and dark atmosphere. The world-building is intriguing, establishing a mysterious and dangerous underground society of assassins.The supporting cast, including Ian McShane, Willem Dafoe, and Adrianne Palicki, complements Keanu Reeves' performance with memorable and well-rounded characters.The film's straightforward and focused plot adds to its overall appeal, delivering a satisfying revenge story that doesn't rely on excessive exposition.Beyond the action, John Wick explores themes of loyalty, vengeance, and the consequences of a life lived by violence. It adds depth to the character and elevates the film from being just another action flick.While some may argue that the film's relentless violence may not be for everyone, it's the skillful execution and commitment to its action-driven narrative that makes John Wick a standout in the action genre.In conclusion, John Wick is an action masterpiece that combines visceral combat, stylish visuals, and a compelling performance by Keanu Reeves. With its intense action sequences and intriguing world-building, it's a film that leaves a lasting impact on action movie enthusiasts.If you're a fan of heart-pounding action and want to witness Keanu Reeves at his best, John Wick is an absolute must-watch. So, gear up for an adrenaline-pumping thrill ride and join John Wick on his quest for vengeance and redemption.

title: Common Sense-U don't mess with Keanu Reeves!!!!
text: John Wick is a 2014 American action thriller film directed by Chad Stahelski and David Leitch. Starring Keanu Reeves, Michael Nyqvist, Alfie Allen, Adrianne Palicki, Bridget Moynahan, Dean Winters, Ian McShane, John Leguizamo, and Willem Dafoe, the film stars Reeves as John Wick.Legendary assassin John Wick (Keanu Reeves) retired from his violent career after marrying the love of his life. Her sudden death leaves John in deep mourning. When sadistic mobster Iosef Tarasov (Alfie Allen) and his thugs steal John's prized car and kill the puppy that was a last gift from his wife, John unleashes the remorseless killing machine within and seeks vengeance. Meanwhile, Iosef's father (Michael Nyqvist) -- John's former colleague -- puts a huge bounty on John's head.

title: Three men and a pencil, the result choreographed art!
text: The narrative of John Wick isn't one of complexity, somebody manages to piss off the man they send to kill the boogeyman, still, the final product is one of great entertainment value. (Keanu Reeves) A ex hitman is suited and booted for this type of role nailing it whilst providing many of his own stunts. I was pleasantly surprised to find I enjoyed this fast pace action from start to finish. One of the reasons for us being able to accept the linear narrative is because it brings high quality in different departments. We the audience feel John Wicks pain and anger in the early stages at the demise of his pet beagle puppy and therefore are able to empathise with him on his journey as he exacts revenge. First of all, the man has lost his wife; so he isn't somebody you'd wanna be messing with at this point in time. Secondly the guy took out three guys in a bar with a god damn freaking pencil! The build up to this epic legendary character is phenomenal at times leaving us waiting in anticipation as to what he might be capable of. Described by the man who becomes his nemesis early on we are well prepared for what might be a rollercoaster of carnage waiting to happen.So why am I impressed with the first entry? How come I only just watched this in 2023? And will I make it to the forth instalment currently in cinemas? I'm impressed with the level of cinematography combined with outstanding choreography, emulating various fight scenes to the highest level that keep me on the edge of my seat as well as being fascinating to watch. Believe me the carnage doesn't disappoint. It's just a really well shot movie with a dark atmospheric tone alongside neon club lights creating a palette of artistic nature. It's in a New York far distant from real world but it sets a mood sticks with it...And, really works! At times it's aesthetically pleasing in the eye, visually stunning. I saw the forth film advertised and decided to find out what all the fuss is about by viewing the original first. Often the first one tends to be the elite when it comes to film franchises as it is fresh whilst bringing you into the world of these characters for the first time.When we first meet John he is grieving a loss going along minding his own business until he is provoked into selling his car 'the mustang' by a group of Russian gangsters; which he refuses of course! This sets the dark tone, conflict seems eminent perceiving trouble ahead. (Keanu Reeves) is accompanied by an exquisite array of talent in this first movie that helps convey to us the high profile of status John Wick has built up over years as we join his journey at retirement stage. Retirement isn't on the agenda for people like Mr Wick though, as he soon realises he will be back in the thick of it all! Evidently it's a lifestyle you can never run away from, a grey ghost! (Willem Dafoe) Marcus leaves us guessing at times, having just enough screen time to keep us intrigued in his character arc. (Michael Nyqvist) provides us with some dark humour as Viggo Tarasov and I can't help but feel sorry for him as he finds himself in a predicament outta his control. The part is played effortlessly well with a natural and believable charm, an old school bad guy that isn't without sympathy. (Alfie Allen) Loseef Tarasov is the naive son of Viggo acting through brute force rather than thought, the entire movie you are rooting for Wick to catch up with him so he gets his comeuppance. (Alfie Allen) does a good job in making you hate him with a rather self absorbing entitlement feel to his character. Then we have the continental owner Ian McShane or to me (love joy) playing Winston the man who makes the rules that are clearly at some point to be broken. Each character has been well thought out to provide some sort of normality around this world of chaos; just another day at the office as fights spill out of control in the background. The most prominent scene furthering this point is when a police officer knocks on John Wicks door to warn him of noise complaints, only to brush it off as another busy night or a night with few things to sort out as John would put it! Providing female fatale is (Adrianne Palicki) as Ms Perkins there to take a bounty with a price on Mr Wicks head. It's hard to pick fault with any of the cast in this movie right down to Lance Reddick as the hotel manager, everything seems to fit and work perfectly.The most exciting and enticing part of this film for me is the freshness within the dark humour around the idea that everybody appears to be calm, they have come to terms with the fact that whatever disruption goes on around them it's just another day at the office. The continental provides a memorable backdrop too knowing that it's the one place where the rules must remain intact. You can see that although the plot is fairly simple a lot of thought has gone into the characters surrounding John Wick each either helping or hindering him throughout the course he takes. Which characters does John trust? What is his relationship with them? Each aspect gets you thinking as they are revealed one by one like a game of cluedo! If like me you are experiencing John Wick for the first time in 2023, trust me see it out, I promise you won't regret it!

title: Animal Rights Propaganda or Revenge Story? Take a pick!
text: I'm a vegan. Yes, I know the old joke that don't worry, a vegan will tell you he is vegan. When I first watched this movie, I was still early in my journey and thus had gotten all gung ho about animal rights, clean eating, and all that jazz. Since then, the vegan food market has exploded and Barnivore is a great way to figure out if your beer or wine is vegan. Basically, I have chilled out and am not so in your face about it. But I will still stand up for veganism. Anyway, where was I?Oh yes, John Wick. When I heard the premise, I knew it was for me. I had recently adopted a couple of little dogs of my own so I was really in the whole paternal spirit for animals and the preservation of animal lives. My local vegan community was a little perplexed how to label this film. In a way, it had the universal appeal to us as a violent rage fantasy in the name of animal rights, but it also had a pretty grounded outlook on the events that lead our titular character back into a seedy and admittedly cool world. Even with my car broken down, I walked to the cinema near my house and waited for the thrill ride. I was not disappointed.If you have never seen a single John Wick meme or gotten a laugh out of it due to not seeing this blistering and violent masterpiece, you are living a sad life. Keanu goes on a killing spree because his dog got killed. Okay, but also it was due to the memory of his wife being defiled (who was most likely his only emotional link to the "real" world), and also due to his sweet Mustang being stolen. For any emotionally stunted male, this would send anyone into a blood lust rage. What made this even cooler is several hands from the ol' Matrix trilogy came to help out, which is why anyone that claims to love the Matrix might have a sweet fondness for this film.The world building is top notch, the fights are awesome and Keanu is believable as this retired hitman. While the sequels went bonkers due to the added budgets, the clean simplicity of this film makes it much more endearing than its sequels. Either way, watch this film for the underrated cast, the great fight scenes and the overtly cool world that makes you wish you were a part of the carnage.

title: It's one of the greatest movies I've ever seen
text: "John Wick is an adrenaline-fueled rollercoaster of a movie that effortlessly combines heart-pounding action, a captivating anti-hero, and a meticulously crafted underworld.Keanu Reeves delivers a career-defining performance as the titular character, exuding an aura of stoic determination that makes Wick an unforgettable cinematic icon.The choreography of the action sequences is a work of art, blending gun-fu and hand-to-hand combat in a mesmerizing display of violence and style. The world-building in the film is rich and immersive, hinting at a vast and intriguing universe beyond what we see on screen.With its impeccable pacing, relentless action, and a magnetic lead, 'John Wick' is a modern action masterpiece that sets the bar high for the genre. It's a must-see for anyone who appreciates visceral, stylish, and intense cinema."

title: A good movie
text: After all these years, though, he's still quintessentially Keanu. He radiates a Zen-like calm which makes him simultaneously elusive and irresistible, especially in the face of great mayhem. There's still a boyish quality to his face but it belies the wisdom of his years. He's smarter than he looks but he's in no great hurry to go out of his way to prove it to youâat least, not on screen.A character like John Wick is right because it allows him to be coolly, almost mythically confident, yet deliver an amusing, deadpan one-liner with detached precision. But when the time comesâand it comes often in "John Wick"âhe can deliver with a graceful yet powerful physicality.

title: "John Wick" (2014) Puts the "Wick" in "Wicked"!
text: 2014 action movie" John Wick" proves that simplicity is beauty. The story is about a retired assassin who exacts revenge from thugs who have stolen his car and killed his dog. We witness a basic revenge story, but with sensational fight scenes. The movie is so engaging that it doesn't need elaborate set pieces from the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) franchise and larger-than-life action sequences from the Transformers franchise. The fight scenes are one-take shots so the actor and the stuntmen have practiced the moves like a dance number. It's very obvious that Lionsgate unlocks another cash cow franchise.

title: New Action Classic!
text: John Wick is easily the best action film since Skyfall. I might even like this more than Skyfall actually. This is better than any of the Expendables films, even Expendables 2. John Wick is a badass revenge flick that knows what it is and goes all-out with it. This film doesn't try to be something it isn't or be overly complicated to try to appease a certain audience. This film is really what the film Machete should've been. Machete was advertised as an awesome revenge film that brought back classic action films, but it really wasn't. It tried to be deep and relevant with constant preaching about the border and it really detracted from what the film initially was supposed to be and it was very boring and quite disappointing. This film knows what it is and it is really refreshing. Keanu Reeves brings his A-game, as does all the side cast. The action is great and well-choreographed. The villain is badass and humorous at the same time.The character, John Wick, is definitely a badass you don't want to screw with. He doesn't talk much and he doesn't need to. He lets his actions speak for him and he's merciless. He doesn't screw around at all. He reminds be a lot of Liam Neeson in Taken. This film has a very similar feel to Taken. For example, I like how it's basically John Wick verses everybody for the most part. Dafoe helps him out a bit but it's mainly John by himself wasting an army of mobsters just like it was Liam Neeson by himself wiping-out a ton of bad guys with no mercy or hesitation. There is no pointless love-interest, goofy sidekick, or stupid comic relief characters put it. It's just John Wick by himself which is how it should be. However I like this film more than Taken for a couple reasons that I'll get to.What's particularly cool about Wick is just the amount of build-up and praise he gets by everyone in the film including the main villain. What I like is that all the characters in this film seem to know each other particularly John himself. Everyone in this film respects John Wick and/or fears him which makes all the more badass. This shows that Keanu Reeves is great if given the right role. Many people trash him but I never found him a bad actor.Another thing that makes this film awesome is its side characters. William Dafoe has a smaller role as John's old friend and fellow Hitman. Dafoe is always awesome in any role he's in. You can put him in a lame Goblin costume straight from the set of Power Rangers and he'll come out awesome. The rest of the cast is equally memorable. The side characters don't get much time but they make the most of what little they have to do and all of them have presence.The villain, Viggo, is okay. I like that him and Wick know each other, have worked together before, and that Viggo has a respect for John and is even quite scared of him. The way he describes John in the beginning and his constant uneasiness when he finds out he's back I find quite funny and awesome at the same time. He could've just been a nothing villain that was basically just a punching bag for Wick, but he has some pretty badass moments and has a presence to him. This is the reason I like this film more than Taken. In Taken the side characters weren't very strong and neither were the villains but that is not the case here.The action is great as I said earlier. The fights are well-choreographed and there is hardly any shaky-cam. It's R-rated so they go all-out and it gets bloody. The film looks great and has an atmosphere to it. The length is just right for the film this is. If it was any longer it would've felt padded-out as some action film of late have.Overall, John Wick is a new modern action classic. It is definitely worth checking-out if you're into action films.

title: Great action movie with great dialog
text: This is one of the best action movies I've seen in a long time. It has shoot outs with Mr Wick and the Russian mob, great car chases and wonderful one liners. title: Best film I've seen in years and the best Keanu Reeves film since The Materix if not arguably better.
text: For the people rating this film low, quite frankly I find your lack of taste and intelligence disturbing as your narcissistic view of other people like me who adore this silly yet badass film about vengeance. Nevertheless there is little I have to complain about this film.NOW SPOILERS AHEAD! I think it simply a near perfect film about how a oddly relatable super assassin who is just grieving the loss of his wife and just wants to be left alone and have some semblance of peace in his life but some punks who think they are just the coolest guys ever come in and break into his home kill his dog and foolishly because they are typical foolish thugs leave the man alive... from the beginning of the film up to that point you are 120% on John Wick's side as he effortlessly just dispatches men like they are ants with the mob boss running scared doing everything he can think of to keep the legendary Baba Yaga from slaughtering him and his entire family and his entire syndicate even attempting to hire a man that could have possibly picked off John Wick but ultimately betrays his own mob boss client in favor of John at the cost of his life. I really don't have much bad to say about this film other than it is admittingly silly and over the top but that is also what makes it so charming and fantastic and the film even is aware that it is silly but yet it's entertaining from beginning to the very end. It gets a very rare 10/10 from me.

title: One of the best action films of all time
text: Keanu Reeves is an immense performer as John Wick. He is an elite hit man on a revenge mission. His name is enough for his enemies to question their decisions, its foreshadowed in the whole movie.It is an awesome action movie a deep story and a strong character arch and produced with the slick action techniques of today. Unlike most action movies of this era, this film does not rely on quick and nauseating camera movement to show off its cool action moves, instead it uses steady and uncut scenes for you to appreciate how much of a bad ass Keanu Reeves is.It one of those hidden gems that are between these piles of garbage. If you hit it you are rich. It one of those which deserve popularity but is dragged down by the lack of promotion. I am so glad I watched this. Looking forward to John Wick: Chapter 2.

title: Unremarakble, DVD bargain bin standard action flick
text: STAR RATING: ***** Saturday Night **** Friday Night *** Friday Morning ** Sunday Night * Monday Morning After the tragic death of his wife, John Wick (Keanu Reeves) is given a dog as a parting gift from her, in order that he won't return to his former life of violence and mayhem. However, a run in with gangster's son Iosef (Alfie Allen) results in his home being invaded, and his pet being brutally murdered. This sets the fire raging in John's heart again, and before long, he returns to the streets to enact brutal revenge. However, Iosef's father is Viggo (Michael Nvquist), a Russian mob boss and his former employer.It's remarkable that, while far better actors have descended into a DVD bargain bin hellhole from which there seems no return, Keanu Reeves would still appear to have the star power to headline a Hollywood action film. He could be comfortably settled into that world quite nicely now, but here he is in this fairly well received action film. Quite hard to fathom why, really, when what we have is a fairly standard, join the dots piece of work, with unexciting action scenes that are too sped up and hyper kinetic to make any impact.While Reeves broods, and does the action hero typeset that he's so suited to, singer Lily Allen's brother Alfie appears as the despicable young villain, and the likes of Willem Dafoe and John Leguizamo are drafted in as support. Its appeal seemingly lies in its simplicity, with what seems to be a deliberately straightforward, uncomplicated plot that takes you from A to B pretty easily. It does this pretty competently, but rather than be an admirably simple bit of fun, it's just a piecemeal, ineffective affair that washes over you like rain. **

title: Great action film
text: John WickWow! This was amazing. Well choreographed fight scenes. Gun battles so fantastic that the film even pokes fun at itself with a video game scene with gun battles.I knew nothing about this film, other than it existed. So I was hit hard by the first 10-15 minutes. I'm not putting spoilers in an almost 10 year movie, but I was not expecting that at all.In all fairness, if that had happened to me, I would have reacted exactly the same way. Sort of. I'm not a retired hitman, but metaphorically. Revenge is sometimes appropriate. And in this situation, I applaud it.I found interesting that our main character, Mr. Wick, has an honor code that he practices. I know this sounds silly, but, he only kills who he has to, even if that means "Anonymous Henchman number 6". I found the scene with Francis touching, to be honest,Another silly thing I enjoyed was how John seems to be a well respected member of the community, with the most interesting interactions with people you would not expect.I am looking forward to watching the sequels, because, well, I think pretty much the entire city of New York was wiped out in the bloodbath.

title: It is still the best one out of the four thus far
text:
(2014) John Wick
ACTIONThe set up has John Wick (Keanu Reeves) in the middle of the night pulls up at a gas station with his 1969 Boss 429 Mustang is being observed by Iosef Tarasov (Alfie Allen) and he offers to buy it from him. And as soon as Wick refuses, Iosef and his goons decide to wait for him at his place of residence beat before taking his Mustang from him, including shoot and kill his beagle. And by the time, Iosef brings the mustang to his dad's garage to get it refurnished, we then find out more about the character he took the car from. As soon as Iosef's father- a Russian gangster, Viggo (Michael Nyqvist) found out Aurelio (John Leguizamo) smacked and refused service to Iosef, he informed him by phone that it was John Wick's car that his son had brought to the shop. And it was at that point, Victor hung up and demanded to see his son. And as soon as he sees him, we know more about the character of John Wick, who had just lost his wife a few days ago and is still in the grieving process, with the only thing she had left with him was the beagle. Without Iosef knowing about Wick's past history as a professional assassin who used to work for his dad, that the reason why he did not work fro him anymore was because he wanted to settle down and have a family. And now Wick has his eyes set on executing Viggo's only son, which this set up is nothing more but a backdrop to showcase Wick doing his thing which is to take out as many people Viggo can send over to him, including a bounty on his head. And as the movie continues the world of assassins created by the movie is a hotel where professional hit mans hang out, introducing us to the owner, Winston (Ian McShane) and his receptionist, Charon (Lance Reddick) with William DaFoe starring as another former hit man Marcus. Out of the four John Wick movies I had seen thus far, the first one is still my favorite, even though the others had more action sequences, this one had a mystique that a mythical tone.

title: Fun Popcorn Movie...
text: This film surprised me...Because I didn't expect it to be so much fun...When I first saw the trailer for this film...I figured it was just going to be this really over the top action movie that will certainly be loved by animal rights activist...What I didn't expect was for the main character, that being John Wick, to have so many layers...Nowadays, many action films tend to lean toward the protagonist being this icy and remorseless human being who wouldn't show any expressions even if he stepped on a nail...But John Wick didn't do that...He had a difficult past, he cried when he was sad, he loved his car and he showed a great deal of affection to his dog...The story had a few plot holes and was a bit choppy and silly from time to time...But at least the movie had substance...This is one of those films where there is no need to be concerned about character development, a well written story, or Oscar-caliber performances...This is a good old fashioned popcorn movie to which the audience can simply kick back, relax, and have a good time...And that's all there is too it...

title: John Wick when Keanu Reeves snaps
text:
The action films are all built on a single bar. For the most part, there's a hero who spits into the soup of the bad guys. But John Wick is not like that. He was basically a bad man, meanwhile married and on the right track. But his wife dies, and he gets caught up in it. Only his wife's last gift, a puppy, pulls Wick back into reality. However, members of a Russian criminal association are upset by all this, and John Wick has to take revenge for the lost hope.
This basic concept is simply brilliant. John Wick specifically sucks on clichÃ©s. The leader of the criminal organization, Viggo Tarasov, is a true mafia leader, respectable, and no one dares to contradict him. Michael Nyqvist's play helps with that. Every single movement is dignified and absolutely convincing. In contrast, his son Josef is an unfortunate little dick.who lives in the shadow of his father, without whom he cannot even breathe. The casting is completely understandable as to why Alfie Allen was given the role. Specifically, this role Theon Greyjoy is only small. Not only is it not so much mentally ill, but it still brings a correct shaping. Willem Dafoe as Marcus the big old assassin is fantastic. Dafoe's role is very small, but still very important. Ian McShane, as the owner of the Continental Hotel, works here like a real boss who connects the criminals and no one commands him. It has its own rules and acts accordingly. Yet the loosest supporting character, Charlie, is the cleaner, who specifically summons Pulp Fiction's problem solver, Winston Wolf. He is an equally loose yet powerful figure.
And Keanu Reeves proves that he can still act as an action hero after the Matrix. The motivation of his character is completely understandable. After all, the dog has a symbolic meaning. It symbolizes attachment and humanity. The film also excels in the technical field. The film cut is tight and well scheduled. The parallel cuts are simply brilliant. The cinematography work is also very nice. Its brilliance goes well with the dark mood of the film. Both the bar scenes and the street fighting photography are very strong.
The screenplay for the film (Derek Kolstad) is very super written. It feels like the screenwriter is at home in the world of action movies. There's a mystique to Wick's character that makes it clear why he's such a good assassin. This film is reforming the world of action movies. Instead of blank visuals, we get a determined, motivated protagonist who makes the entire film himself. The main evil is a loose yet ominous figure. The action scenes are hectic and it's good to watch these scenes. A pleasant fun action dump that nails all the way in front of the screen. An unmissable creation. His sequels are sure to carry on Mr. Wick's revenge campaign and complete revenge.

title: I Am Overwhelmed By The Accumulated Dumbness
text: The three dumbest things in the world are Keanu Reeves, action movies, and music videos. So now, here's an action movie starring Keanu Reeves that's shot like a music video. I am overwhelmed by the accumulated dumbness. Imagine PAYBACK with Mel Gibson, only without the wit, guts, human suffering, and wisdom. And Mel's been replaced by Tab Hunter, Frankie Avalon, or someone like that. Imagine THE REPLACEMENT KILLERS, only without the romance, elegance, tension, and simmering sexual heat. There's no Mira Sorvino here, and Chow Yun Fat has been replaced by Beavis and Butthead.All through this movie, there are moments that are laugh out loud stupid, where the film makers clearly expect the viewers to fall into a worshipful stupor and start jacking their bones. Wow, look how fast that car is going! Man, that is a sharp looking car! I am getting so hot now, just looking at that car! And the music is so LOUD, man. LOUD MUSIC MAKES ME SO HOT! And now guys are getting killed! Man, I love to see guys getting killed. LOUD MUSIC CARS GUITARS GUNSHOTS OH MY GOD I'm COMING RIGHT NOW!!!! And of course, Our Hero must look "cool" at all times. He can't just take his guns out of the closet. No, he has to take a SLEDGE HAMMER and SMASH the floor to dig out his old guns! So cool!!! And when the bad guys are coming, he has to put on a sharp, three-piece suit, with cuff links, so he can fist fight and pistol his way around. I mean, a ripped t-shirt and jeans might be better, yes? To move fast and have quick reflexes? But no, it's so much COOLER to watch him put on a suit and tie. With all that going on, take some time to notice the sadness on the faces of all these veteran actors. There's that old black guy from THE WIRE -- he looks almost grateful to be getting killed after five minutes. There's Willem Defoe -- he still hasn't forgiven himself for making all those Spider Man movies. Oh, but it's not just aging has-beens who are being humiliated here. Who's that good looking young chap running through the crowded disco in a towel? Can it be . . . can it be . . . it's Alfie "THEON GREJOY" Allen. Did you see him running through the crowd, looking like a goofball? No? Let's slow it down! How many minutes of Alfie running in a towel do we need to see? But it's okay, he's got tons of music blasting away. And it's LOUD!I really wanted Keanu to ask Alfie, "did you pay the IRON PRICE for that car you stole?" And then Alfie's last words could have been, "what is dead may never die!"

title: Excellent action sequences with proper writing.
text: In what is now a legacy intellectual property, thanks to breathtaking and premiere fighting sequences, "John Wick" is the first installment in a series of action movies revolving around a retired hitman done wrong. Believe it or not, a lot of thought has gone into the construction of this tale of atonement; everything from setting up value, leaving key details ambiguous, and a very astute script; one which absolutely adds weight to the esteem of the titular character. "John Wick" is not your average shoot-em-up, and it's no surprise that the series has continued success.Direction of "John Wick" has wisely been kept in the capable hands of Chad Stahelski, and its future may very well hinge on it. Producers sticking their crooked noses into development of Hollywood material is nothing new, but in the case of this series, Basil Iwanyk and his peers either know better or do so discretely. Derek Kolstad was already a successful screenwriter before this film, and his talent is notable. In the script: when a policeman comes knocking on Wick's door and notices commotion, your typical, horrible, Hollywood screenwriter would have had the man get involved immediately. A decent writer, instead, would have had the officer simply offer help. Kolstad goes beyond any typical thinking and has the policeman recognize Wick and immediately bow out! The absolute brilliance of this take cannot be understated, as writing this simple moment cements in the viewer the depth of respect Wick has achieved in his profession. Similarly, when Aurelio, at the car shop, notices something is wrong, he doesn't reveal the details of the issue to Iosef Tarasov; any average writer would be itching to splurge all the minutiae to the audience immediately. Kolstad, instead, withholds information, enriching his characters and deepening the value of the screenplay.A host of colorful characters, sudden twists and turns in the story and all the trappings of flawless Hollywood combine to make "John Wick" an American action classic.

title: They killed his dog and there will be hell to pay!
text: Masterful action flick still hold up for a second viewing. "John Wick" is a top tier action revenge flick worthy the likes of "Point Blank." Keanu plays a grieving recently widowed husband who then suffers a group of punks breaking into his home, stealing his '69 Mustang, and killing his dog. What the punks don't know is that Keanu is a retired hitman for the Russian mob who now has nothing left to live for except revenge. To complicate matters, one of the punks happens to be the irresponsible son of the head of the Russian mob who Keanu once worked for, pitting the two former allies against one another. Keanu then roars and rampages and gets bloody satisfaction, leaving a ridiculous number of bodies in his wake. Directed by Chad Stahelski and David Leitch (uncredited due to DGA issues), who both worked with Keanu doing stunk work on The Matrix films, made a knockout directing debut. The action is terrific, both the hand-to-hand martial arts and the shootouts, not appearing as fantastical as The Matrix and a bit more down to earth and physical, but are still jaw droppingly impressive in their choreography. Written by a first time screenwriter, Derek Kolstad, he's crafted a lean, efficient, no nonsense script. The story is straight out of the old school Walter Hill style of stripped down storytelling. The filmmakers even had the wisdom to cast a few Hill film alumni in this picture, David Patrick Kelly ("The Warriors" "48 Hrs." "Last Man Standing" in a memorable small role as a clean-up/body disposal service guy), Willem Dafoe ("Streets of Fire" "Dead For a Dollar"), and Ian McShane ("Deadwood"). The film even has Hill's usual nameless-urban-city type of setting. Top off a tight script and terrific action with an amazing supporting cast of character actors who, besides the aforementioned Hill actors, includes John Leguizamo (as a chop shop owner who does a great job of subtly building up for the audience how dangerous a man John Wick is), Kevin Nash (of WWF/WCW fame), and Clarke Peters ("The Wire"), it's impossible not to love this film! You also get some bigger names like Michael Nyqvist as the Russian mob boss, Dean Winters as his consigliere, the under appreciated Adrianne Palicki as a former colleague of Wick's and now rival hitwoman, and you even have Bridget Moynahan as Wick's wife for all 8 seconds of her screen time. Overall, this is probably the best action film to come out of Hollywood in years and hopefully moves action films aways from the overblown Michael Bay and Wachowski Brothers bombastic style of action. Focusing on the action film basics of stunt work and simply letting the camera capture the action has given us the most badass action flick you'll have seen in year. BONUS FILM SUGGESTION: If you want to see another contemporary back-to-basics style of action flick that seriously delivers the goods, check out the Indonesia action flick "The Raid: Redemption."

title: Keanu proving he still has what it takes
text: Keanu Reeves makes a very welcomed return to the spotlight in this amazing action film, backed up with a bunch of great actors. We're introduced to a very interesting hit-man type of underworld and a what feels like a throwback to the 80's style of action films minus all the unnecessarily large explosions and awkwardly placed sex scenes. Some very impressive action scenes, decent comedy, a good plot, fitting soundtrack and a very appreciated backstory made for a great ride. Beyond that, it's hard to find negative things about this film, the only bad thing I can really say is the villain(s) felt very generic and boring, very forgettable. Bottom line, this is a film I'd highly recommend.

title: Not just a shoot 'em up
text: While this movie can be seen as a run-of-the-mill shooter, it has more than just that. The story IS basic, though I have to say that the love story is more compelling than the entirety of the "Twilight" series in the span of 2 minutes and 10 seconds. The subsequent 3 minutes and 5 seconds pounds it home even more and only the hardest of hearts isn't at least made misty eyed.From there, it is a story of revenge and the mystery of John Wick is revealed. It's obviously meant to be an over the top spectacle, but that is where it EXCELLS.The SPECTACLE.The cinematography is second to none. This should be in EVERY Master's class on cinematography. The use of colors, grading, bokeh, framing, etc. Is just ON POINT. It doesn't matter who you are, this is a MUST SEE. Even skittish YouTube reactors who have seen this may get turned off by the violence, but they all say that it is one of the most beautiful movies they have ever seen. All I can say is the the Director of Photography Jonathan Sela should be paid as much as Keanu.

title: Pathetic, fun-not so much.
text: Pathetic, fun, not so much.I watched John Wick for the first time yesterday and decided to do an analysisJohn Wick is a legendary retired assassin who deals with suffering after losing the great love of his life. When a gangster breaks into his home, kills his dog and steals his car, he is forced to return to active duty and begins his revenge.To begin with, the plot of the film, which had everything to be great, did not please me as it should, until it starts potentially well, but then it gets lost, unfortunately. Besides, the script is very predictable and basically everything that happens next is boring and loses a lot of logic (does that mean John was a famous and skilled killer who was also part of a mafia? Oh, man ...However, the most impressive thing is the violence of the film, which some found for free, and I even agree with that a little. There came a time when it was very tiring throughout the film. Unfortunately, the film apparently chose to leverage that point.On the other hand, the film is not entirely ignored, the fighting choreographies are very good, to say the least, and are merely watchable today, but not enough to make up for what should have been the film's strong point: the story .Well, I don't know if I'm going to check the other two sequences, because it probably must be more of the same: a skilled killer with cold-blooded killing and blood spurting everywhere ...I regret the laziness of writing this text, but it is my first analysis of a film.

title: The New Standard of Action Cinema
text: John Wick is a master class on taking every movie trope and delivering an incredibly fresh and innovative franchise that delights avid action fans and casual observers alike. Chad Stahelski and team break free from the now overused shaky cam to hide mediocre acting and push their stars and stunt team to give us some of the best action sequences in film since The Matrix. But to take this movie even further into brilliance, Stahelski prefers to show and not tell the audience about the world in which John Wick lives. As a result, everything is mysterious, leaving viewers intrigued, questioning, and wholly immersed in this assassin-filled world. The unusual gold coin currency, the legend and fear of John Wick, the enigmatic Continental hotel that forbids any assassin "work" on the premises, and much more sweeten a typical action revenge story into a cinematic treasure.Overall : The mastery of stunt choreography and world-building make John Wick the new standard of action films.

title: Best Action
text: And when I say the best, I know exactly what I'm talking about. I love Rambo and Die Hard, I love Mission: Impossible and James Bond, I love the raid and Once Upon a Time in Mexico. In general, I know what a good action movie is.But Josh Wick puts an end to all of the above in terms of action, drive, setting scenes and the universe in which we are invited to immerse ourselves.The world of hired killers and criminals, where orders are sent by SMS to individual performers or to all who are in the asset. A kind of freelancing with a well-oiled pay system, cover and a brotherhood that cannot be transferred.In general, the universe is great.Visual, my respect. What kind of picture is there, well, for an action movie it's even too much, in my opinion.The plot of course yes, simple as a stick, but the characters are one more beautiful than the other. It's really interesting to see new characters emerge. They are all silent and straightforward, but at the same time, because of their appearance, habits, weapons and style, you yourself think out who he is and build a legend around each fighter.In general, if you like action movies and for some reason you haven't seen John Wick yet, run and watch.

title: A start to a great franchise
text: John Wick is one of the action films that has changed the genre forever with its excessive violence, unique cinematography, and over the top fighting sequences. Keanu Reeves returns to the world of action genre as John Wick, a retired legendary assassin whose wife has died of cancer, is trying to move on from life after tragedy. When a gang of thugs that are related to a mob boss he once worked for breaks into his home, beats him and kills his dog his wife left him as a last gift, he decides he has nothing left to loose, but seek revenge by returning to life as a assassin. This film has so many unique fighting styles and action sequences unlike any other film made and is a great way to start this franchise for years to come, while also being Keanu Reeves's comeback into the action genre. Rating 8/10.

title: John wick
text: John Wick has a very simple, maybe even laughable plot. It is a typical guy takes his revenge movie. It can be easily summarized as "Keanu gets pissed and shoots people in the face for 101 minutes" but the thing is you actually can see it is really Keanu who is doing it. Instead of shaky cameras and dozens of superfast cuts, you can see kick-ass long takes which are amazingly choreographed. Since this is their first film, the director duo has a few problems with storytelling but I am glad that they made me realize how much I miss watching an action movie and actually see what's going on.

title: Simple and Elegant
text: The film tells the story of the life of John Wick, a hit-man who retired because of his lover who died of illness. In memory of herself, she left a farewell gift - a dog named Daisy. By chance, the character of Keanu Reeves has to say goodbye to everything he had and return to his former life.Acting is not the best but not terrible. Not everywhere the actors managed to play quite convincingly, but in general this does not ruin the overall picture much. Camera movement deserves praise. The cameramen managed to convey all the dynamics of combat scenes, the noir atmosphere is preserved in each frame.Editing is also at the high level, branded subtitles fit well into the picture and do not distract from viewing. Sound specialists did their job quite well: cars and shots sound cool and pleasant. Separately, I would like to note the soundtrack. Electronic music fits perfectly into fighting scenes and the main theme reflects the atmosphere and mood of the film.The world in which the events of the film take place is very attractive with its thoughtfulness. Each character has its own lore, which is not properly revealed, but outlines the contours and nature of all the characters with whom John interacts. Secondary characters do not stand out with special charisma, but they do not feel empty eitherAs a result, we can say that "John Wick" is a simple, sometimes clichÃ©d, but good action movie that is pleasant to watch.

title: Quite good!
text: Now, this is an action film ! From the beginning ( well, not actually first 10 minutes or so, but....) to the end is full of action, interesting plots and scenes and really keeps you entertained!I must say that I have not seen in a long time a better action movie! Keanu is perfect in the role! All other actors are too. The story is great. The moving of the film/plot is done perfectly. All those secret society mafia agents living by the rule are great! There is really nothing that you can say is bad about the movie.The language they use...I thought it was Romanian almost entire film. But when they mentioned the Russian church, I figured out it must be Russian.Loved the ending of the film. Most of the films have some kind of a bad ending and that can ruin all, but this one is perfect!My favorite part/scene: when those 'cleaners' come to his house after the first shooting and wrap those dead bodies like mummies ! Man, that was something!Nine from me. Don't know exactly why it is not ten, but 9.50 would be more exact.

title: "A COMPLETE AND UTTER DISGRACE TO HUMANITY"
text: The marketing posters should have read:"101 DIABOLICAL MORONIC MINUTES""A BARRAGE OF APPALLING PREPOSTEROUS NONSENSE""A TOTAL EMBARRASSMENT TO THE ART OF FILM-MAKING""AN ABSOLUTE ABOMINATION - THE LIKES OF WHICH CAN NEVER BE EQUALLED""A COMPLETE AND UTTER DISGRACE TO HUMANITY"I'll make this as concise as possible because I don't want to give this film any more time than I already have.This film is completely one dimensional, devoid of script and therefore has absolutely no character depth, nuance, beauty, interest or message and thus we are left with a deluge of meaningless, non-stop violence in the name of revenge.Apart from the sequel to this film (which incredibly, plumbs to at least equally low depths), probably Keanu's worst outing - and he has had a few bad ones.It was no surprise to me that the "director" is NOT a director at all but actually a fight choreographer because that is pretty much all this film contains - and in my opinion, neither well choreographed nor well-shot fighting scenes at that!In a nutshell, it watches like a video game on automatic play and as the poster (should have) said; a complete and utter disgrace to humanity, though no doubt revered by the brain-dead of the 21st century gaming generation.

title: Excellent
text:
An ex hitman and a boogeyman story amongst criminals is brought out of retirement to do what he does best when idiot criminals steal his car and kill the dog his recently deceased wife gave him as a present. John then proves why he is boogeyman story to the underworld and absolute legend in his field as a now not retired hitman.

title: A modern masterpiece; action cinema at its finest.
text: Not only does 'John Wick (2014)' feature fantastic action that's tightly choreographed and cleanly shot, it also has a tight story that doesn't rely too heavily on exposition and manages to create a unique world that feels tangible. A lot of people talk about it as if the action excuses the story, as if it is a 'guilty pleasure' or only good because of its above-average - phenomenal, I'd say - fight sequences, but that's actually not the case here. This isn't simply about a man who kills some people because they kill his dog. No, it is much deeper than that, with a tangible connection to the characters and solid reasoning behind everything they do, and just because the story is simple doesn't make it any less compelling or well-crafted. The film is truly fun, somewhat self-aware but also serious enough to be properly impactful, and wholly engaging. You'll be smiling throughout, at both the breathless action and the effortless craftsmanship of narrative. Keanu Reaves and Michael Nyqvist are both fantastic in the piece, two sides of the same coin, and the way that the latter is used to build this ominous legend around the former is almost genius. The flick also offers glimpses into an interesting and fully formed world but never lets that detract from its beating heart, either. I truly believe this is a near masterpiece, a marvel of modern cinema that distils its story to its most basic of elements and is all the more effective because of it. One of my favourite action films of all time. 9/10

title: A Wham-Splatter Video Game that will always have the same result
text: I am growing tired, and saddened by the growing phony, inflated reviews on IMDb, a medium with great potential that is losing all credibility as a useful evaluation tool. 7.4 average?! - Oh, Yea, indeed.This was basically a plot less non-stop killing spree. It's a great movie to make pizza while watching - it demands no attention or brain activity whatsoever. It's your time, waste it as you see best.I suppose it might be fun to watch with a group of friends and try to count the close-range head shots vs. the on-the-fly rapid machine gun clip changes.I would also love to attend a club like the one in this Charade where about 30 people are blowing each other to pieces at close range with high-powered machine guns but no one even stops dancing during the action.
