title: Substandard and mediocre.
text: This movie is riddled with a quite a few plot-holes and the movie suffers, as a whole, because of it; especially the 16,000 pound elephant in the room: Secrecy! From the documentaries that I have seen, from what I have read, any person working for any secretive organization, CIA, organized crime, whatever, ..that is at least not an idiot, especially people who are the most dangerous & are therefore generally regarded as the most hated/feared, i.e., assassins, they do not allow themselves to have/be directly connected to any material object; automobiles, boats, homes, whatever. In the real world, if you get the license plate # off of a car that belongs to such a person & run it you're basically going to find information that tells you nothing about who that person is. Usually, ..it's registered to a dummy company that exists on tax records & is, maybe, on file with another company, maybe a delivery service. And if you could dig & find out you'd find that while that other company is a different company, at least on paper, it's really just a front for the same person.It is common for these companies to have a physical address in the same country where the person in question lives. But, if you were to go to that physical address you'd find that it's a warehouse or a small 'hole-in-the-Earth' office in a building that's been abandoned for 15 years. It's common for these physical addresses to be located on some open-air loading dock that is so 'out-in-the-middle-of-no-where' that nobody in their right mind ever goes out that way. Or on a closed loading dock, where you have to have ID to even be on the property & perhaps more than that. In such locations, buildings can sit abandoned for decades. So long as the company that is registered at that physical address has its rent, taxes, whatever, paid, consistently, on time, how much in bad shape the building is does not matter. At all.And, often, these companies are not registered, such as for tax reasons, in a part of the world where the person in question lives. The person in question might live in North America... Somewhere. With that physical address, somewhere, in North America. But, the registration of that company, for those tax reasons, might be in Antarctica. Or Brazil. Or somewhere in Europe. Or the Cayman Islands.So, when John Wick was in the gas station, at the beginning of the movie & the Russian psychopath chats him up, did that guy put a tracer in/on his vehicle to find him later to steal the car? Or did he get the vin/plate #, run it & track him him down that way?Â¿ Regardless of how they did it, the fact that they were able to find him so easily implies how little thought went into, at least, that part of the script. Especially since John Wick is a guy with no security, whatsoever, on the home that he lives in... Seriously, how about a motion sensor security system to sound an alarm any time anything larger than a medium-size dog comes on the property! If John Wick is a person who is so good at what he does, then, the bad guys shouldn't have been able to find him. At all. And if John Wick is not that good, then, the title character would never have lived long enough to see even the beginning of this movie; because, he would have been taken down long before the story in the movie got started.And then there's the car that John Wick has immediately before going into the hotel. It's gone & replaced by a different car when he leaves, with no explanation for what happened to the previous vehicle. And there is the scene near the end when John Wick stabs himself with a knife, as it is in the other guys hand, evidently, just to get the knife away from the guy. Dumb. And then there's the scene right at the end where he stumbles into the dog pound, to get medical supplies, & staples himself back together (Really dumb!), inevitably bleeding DNA all over the damned place! As if someone wouldn't show up for work in the morning, see the mess, call the cops... To say nothing of the SUV at the beginning and at the end of the movie! (I gag just thinking about how much of a person's DNA would be all over the inside of any of the vehicles that the title character was in throughout this film!)Off the top of my head, I can't think of a shoot'em-up action flick that does not do this; but, in order to enjoy a shoot'em-up action flick that is written this poorly you need to suspend your support for/belief in reality. You need to not care that the movie sucks. And I think that's extremely stupid!I prefer reality.

title: Ridiculous action movie trying to be serious
text: I could talk for a long time about weak writing, one-dimensional characters and stupid and boring action scenes, but these are the things that simply make this movie bad. What makes it truly ridiculous, however, is its portrayal of Russians and Russian mafia.Don't get me wrong, I don't mind Russians portrayed as bad guys, it's just one of many action movie clichÃ©s that I easily accept. The ridiculous part is, this movie actually tries to focus on Russians while knowing NOTHING about them.First, let's take John Wick, who is supposed to be a badass hit-man. The mafia calls him Baba Yaga. This fact alone is so hilarious it would send a Russian roll on the floor laughing, because it sounds about as good as calling a badass hit-man "the Wicked Witch of the East". Baga Yaga is a folk character mostly known through fairy- tales, she's an old witch who is portrayed as wise, scary and occasionally villainous, but quite often helpful (and she's mostly known from fairy-tales where she's practically never a big villain). "Baba" isn't really a part of the name, it simply means "old hag". That's right, a badass hit-man called "old hag" and a female name. I assume at some point there was an idea to find a word similar to Boogeyman and use it as a nickname for John. There indeed is a Slavic "boogeyman" called Babay which they perhaps confused with Baba Yaga. Boy, how many laughs this confusion produced.Naturally, not a single character in the movie can speak Russian at all. Plus almost nobody has a real Russian name. I understand that Americans tend to struggle very hard with Russian surnames, but first names? There are no Russians named Iosef, let alone Viggo! The mafia boss looks about as realistic as Boris in Snatch, but Boris was purposefully over-the-top, while John Wick is presented to us like a serious movie.And there's the hilarious scene in club sauna where Russian mafia guys actually sing Kalinka-Malinka. It's about as stupid as American criminals getting reading Dr Seuss aloud together. In real life there's a whole genre of criminal songs called Blatnyak and in many ways it fulfills the same function as some types of rap; it's songs sung by criminals (or people pretending to be them), for criminals and about criminals. This is something that Russian mafia could actually sing. Not goddamn Russian 19th century songs that were common on Soviet TV!And I could accept all that, even though it's crazy to see this silliness in 2014, if not for one thing: somehow this movie pretends that it actually is ABOUT Russians. Russians are everywhere, they talk about their thoughts, customs, motivations, et cetera et cetera, while NONE OF THIS has ANYTHING to do with real Russians. This reminds me of a historical museum scene in the movie called "Idiocracy" in which future people got so stupid they think that Charlie Chaplin fought with Nazis and dinosaurs that shot lasers. That's how far this movie is from reality, and for the life of me I simply can't understand WHY the authors of this movie tried to talk about things that they literally know nothing about.

title: Fair is generous
text: Keanu Reeves does not act in this movie. This is simply another violent copy of so many other movies. I can't think of anything positive to say about this movie. I am half way through John Wick 2 and can't watch anymore. With so many people raving about these movies I am sure a third one is already in production. Too bad.

title: 2-bit gangster cliche
text: I considered turning this film off early on, but did not, because i was hoping that something would take place to redeem it, not to mention that, in general, i tend to watch films to the end. Whatever style was attempted for this film failed miserably. The hotel? John Wick could have taken out the murderer of his dog and thief of his car very early in the film when he eyed him in the bath. He shoots everyone in sight except his target? I find that kind of scene, a mechanism to keep the story going, to be weak. Thumbs down! I don't know what i was thinking ordering this movie; I generally do not care for Keanu Reeves' acting.

title: watch Oldboy (2003) instead
text:
I have seen john wick twice, once before watching Oldboy, and once after.
On my first viewing, I loved the film. The scenes at the start which kick-start the plot were so unexpected and shocking that I immediately wanted John Wick to go out and kill many, many people.
The film was not plot heavy, but it wasn't really about the plot, it was about the action scenes, and the action scenes were beautiful. The styling of the action scenes, were it pulls away and creates a dynamic movement, that's elegant and precise, and isn't cut to shit, so you can actually see what's going on, was amazing to me at the time. The nightclub scene alone is one of the most incredible pieces of action cinema that I had scene. The action styling was perfect, it didn't reduce impact and cut away for a PG-13 rating, and the way in which it dimmed the sounds of the violence and turned up the music made it seem almost like a dance. and the world building, I was fascinated by this world, the golden coins and the hotel and all of the little intricacies laced into the movies were incredible. In short, I loved this film first time around.
Then I watched Park Chan Wook's Oldboy.
Oldboy is a masterpiece.
Watch it.
On my second viewing of John Wick I was viciously let down. 
After the first fifteen minutes in which the events that kick-start the plot take place, the plot ends. That's it. After that john wick kills people, for an hour and a half. Even the world building that enchanted me so much the first time around fell flat, on a second viewing it just seemed rushed, and only existed so that john could kill somebody else, it was a means to an end, and that showed. 
John Wick, people could argue, isn't about the plot, it's about creating a clean stylish action flick, with stylized, yet unflinching and realistic violence. But to those people I say: have you watched Oldboy. Everything that makes the violence in john wick so good, came from Oldboy, the dulling of the impact, not clear and precise, but thick and realistic, comes from Oldboy. The long action takes, the gorgeous action choreography, all from Oldboy. 
The other thing that Oldboy has that John Wick doesn't, is plot. Now, the clean stylish action flick is fine by me, but if it's as unoriginal as john wick, and everything in it has been done many times better, in a movie that didn't sacrifice plot for violence, and delivered masterfully on both, just don't bother, watch Oldboy. It has a plot, and fight scenes cooler than the ones in John Wick, where enemies don't feel the need to come one at a time so John can pick them off.

title: Dog dies horribly don't watch
text: This just makes me sad before I knew much an innocent puppy got beaten to death with one hit of a bat. Don't care about rest of the movie

title: Need to completely shut ones brain to watch
text:
Why can't an action movie be logical? Need to ignore story, and even common sense while watching this movie.
Each and every bad guy, looking super sophisticated, forgets that he is holding a gun and not a piece of metal to come so close to the hero before pulling the trigger.
The friend of hero, reaches the rooftop of the building opposite to the room of the hero, points the sniper and waits. He shoots inches beside the hero to only alert him off approaching enemy. He could have called him up or shot the enemy if he is so concerned. But no, it's an action movie and it is not supposed to be logical, right?
The villian gives up the EXACT address where his son is hiding and patiently waits, having few drinks at his home, till the hero reaches there and kills his son. He then becomes angry, captures the hero, and leaves him with couple of idiots who tries killing him with a plastic bag. Seriously?
Each and every scene seems to to desperately made to look nonsensical.
Such scenes, which the movie is full of, spoils the pleasure of the action scenes and the curiosity that is initially created.
I'm so much confused how such good a rating it is attracting.

title: Why?
text: Why was this so popular?A broken assassin is reminded of his pain with the death of his dog, leading to a crap ton of egregious violence with thousands of wasted rounds littering the floors of hotels and nightclubs.That's my summary. What am I missing?

text: This is a decent action movie, but don't expect much more. Just so so.

title: An Insight into American Gun Culture
text:
What I saw in this 'movie' was the firing of more bullets than I could count. Guns.. guns.. and more guns. The movie that Trump would love. And that the civilised world should revile. How can this sort of film exist at a time when massacres are becoming a very frequent event in modern America?
Is it not time to devote creative endeavours to something a bit more meaningful?

title: Guy flick
text: The main character found motivation to get back to his mafia hitman life after a group of punks decided to steal his car and kill his dog. What ensued was a brutal war with incredible fighting scenes but little plot substance.The plot was so lazy, the bad guys wanted to kill JW so bad but backed off at the right time, every time, so the fighting can continue. I just don't get it. You are trying to kill the guy so badly then when you finally get him on the ground passed out, you decide to sit him down and give him a chance to recover so he can continue kicking your ass. Incredibly lazy writing.Of course then there's all the misses from point blank range so our hero can live...and the politically correct fighting scene with a woman who kicks his ass right after he got done kicking the ass of body builders but a female is tougher apparently.

title: Mindless Entertainment
text: I love an action movie but in amongst all the stunts, car chases and fight scenes i do expect a little bit of suspense, intrigue and good script. This film has none of the latter. This might sound very snobbish but you'd have to be of a certain age and/or intelligence to rate this movie highly.Yes it's fun and mindless entertainment but nothing mre than that. I've never seen so many people killed in one movie and that includes war films; and all killed by one man! John Wick!There was easily about 100 different gun shots to the head and face in this movie. The first few are kind of 'entertaining' and then it gets ridiculous.I can't recommend this movie to anyone...period.

title: A waste of time.
text: The guy kills 350 people with shots to the head because they killed his late wife's poodle!A script like this is unbelievable.Come up with a minimally credible story to justify a murder like this. And when a guy is arrested, the villain comes up with a stupid conversation, he doesn't kill the hero and then the guy who looks more like a superhero forces the villain to tell him where the stupid son who created all the trouble is.It's unbelievable that they would pay a screenwriter to write a story like this. Story for adults with cognitive deficits and there are even worse things. A reflection of the imbecility that the current world experiences.

title: What is this movie?
text: I asked myself over and over, is this movie a parody of good movies? Is it owned by the same people who own RED? (Yes it is.) Scene after scene mimics and actually copies RED. Even the music does, too.The writing is absurdly childish. Good actors are force to deliver the most clichÃ©d lines I have heard in a film for years. Years. And what was that guy from the insurance company television commercials doing in it? His commercials were all I could think of whenever he was on screen.So was John Wick meant to be a take-off on far better films? Was it made to target a specific audience of half-brain-dead young males? And why, oh why, were these professional killers using Glocks? Glocks are for cops and other amateurs. No serious professional would ever consider using them.John Wick was a disappointing puzzlement to me. I gave it a 3 for the effort.

title: What was that ð
text: I'm sorry to be rude but that felt like some director's first movie !The action scenes felt pretty realistic but the story and transitions actually made me laugh !

title: Good, but could have been great
text: If you start a drinking game where everyone takes a shot whenever someone in John Wick gets shot in the face, there's a good chance at least one of you will be admitted to the ER with acute alcohol intoxication. I see this film as an opportunity missed. Keanu looks amazing at 50 and definitely carries the sad action antihero role well. The technical aspects of this film are excellent. The action sequences flow beautifully in their cartoonish brutality, but the film falls short in the execution of the script. A story this silly should not take itself so seriously, if only they had more fun with the ludicrous plot and dialogue. I mean, you've got the mayhem guy from the Allstate insurance commercials playing a bad-guy executive secretary, surely that's good for a joke somewhere? An 80's action movie in 2014 needs a little more effort to make me laugh with it rather than at it. I'd only recommend it if you are willing to turn your brain off for a couple of hours and enjoy the ride.

title: stylish action lacks ambition
text: The film that has been branded as keanu reeves comeback and to be fair it is a good film. Its stylish and has a interesting plot with lots of action a 100% true bloke film but....and there is a but and its that there is no soul in this film yes you feel sorry for john wick but you don't become attached or bothered if he wins or loses in this film, this is not really keanu reeves fault as he does play the role well i think it may be the scripting of the film the realism that lacks heavily in it, william defoe does a great supporting role in the film which you would expect. I would advise you to watch john wick as its a good film but at 1hr 40mins you will walk away thinking they could of probably done that in less time. John wick does bring keanu reeves back to our big screens but there are bigger films due out this year which will make this one quickly disappear

title: Might as well be playing a video game
text: John Wick starts with promise and quickly devolves into stupidity, hijacking the current template for action films pioneered by 'The Raid' series in which a single, determined 'hero' takes up arms against hundreds of nameless, one dimensional bad guys in a rapid fire killing spree. It's not that I have anything against bloodshed in film, provided it serves a purpose. But there's really nothing of substance here to grab onto, leaving us with scene after scene of revenge-murder chic that plays more like a video game than a film. Never has cold blooded murder looked so cool.John Wick is nicely shot and opens on a dreary and mysterious note, one that I wish the film would have sustained with a better story and better character development. Without the fundamentals we might as well be pressing buttons. Jump, Wick. Dive, Wick. Shoot, Wick.If I try and step back and critique it purely as action entertainment - the film is lacking in interesting choreography or chase sequences. Basically Wick happens upon completely unbelievable scenarios over and over again, pulls a gun out and shoots. No matter how many times the filmmakers put him into uncompromising positions, I never feel like he's in any danger. The routine gets boring after the first half hour and eventually the autopilot sets in.

title: Boring, stale, pointless
text: Heard all the hype before I watched it. It is utter pointless film with absolutely nothing other than just gore. No story, no character development, and honestly... even the action is terrible. At the end, the only question remains is, "What did I just waste 2 hours on?"

title: Really didn't care for it.
text: The storyline, the script, and the acting - for everyone in the movie - were all bad. The fight scenes were okay.I had a really hard time buying into it and not feeling like I was watching a complete fabrication. A movie isn't supposed to be like that.This movie's kind of "out there".

title: Mastery on one hand, utter confusion on the other.
text: Has all the makings of a decent mediocre action flick, but is utterly and completely ruined by the crippled/fake Russian and some bad dialogue choices. The style of subtitles however, suggests it can still be enjoyed as a gritty-goofy comedy, since the dramatic element is hard to maintain in this state. With such level of detail offered to stunts and choreography (which is to be expected in a film made by two stunt coordinators) it's even more frustrating to see (or rather hear) that all the dialect department's work has been futile (or non existent at times). I guess 15 years into XXI century, it is still too much to ask Hollywood to consider showing their foreign lines to an expert and/or dubbing them at least if native speaking actors are not an option. (It doesn't even have to be an expert, really). Of course, all of this in John Wick poses no threat to those unaffected by understanding of Russian.

title: Not my kind.
text: Terrible waste of time for both me and Keanu Reeves. This is a cheap movie where violence is the only selling point and I couldn't even watch it entirely. If it wasn't for Keanu, I'd give it one star.

title: I was bored and disappointed and actually fell asleep
text: Well, everyone knows this is a revenge movie with lots of action. And, yeah. There's lots of action. But honestly - that's all there is. There isn't much in the way of character. I never figured out why the Willem Dafoe character acted the way he did. There's no humor to speak of. I didn't find the action sequences to be very creative, and I actually found them to be repetitive. For example there was one plot element where a lot of people are waiting for Wick to come and they are all checking in with each other by radio... and then exactly the same thing happens later on. There's lots and lots and lots of action but it's amazing how soporific it all got. And I mean it literally put me to sleep. I was pay-per-viewing it and I literally dozed off. More than once. It had been a long day at work, I admit. But if it had had any hook to hold my attention, I would have stayed awake. But it didn't. Well, there is this comic-book assassin subculture stuff with an economy based on special gold coins, but nobody past the fourth grade could believe in it.So I was honestly pretty disappointed. And I'm not someone who can't enjoy a good action film. Take "Salt", for example, which was also non-stop action, but which I found way more interesting and with more plot twists and stuff. There aren't really any plot twists in this movie. It was just entirely first-person-shooter for an hour and a half. Now, if someone says, "But that's exactly the kind of movie I like! You're just biased against first-person-shooter non-stop hitting and pulling the trigger movies!" I guess I don't have a good retort. But there it is.

title: John Wick
text: Apparently this is entertainment, when in reality it is a piece of 1962 propaganda wrapped in a package that got lost in 2014. Nothing much to see here: just the usual Hollywood anti-Russian propaganda. A man's dog gets killed...and who's the baddies? The Russians, of course. This just shows me that since 1962 up to now we haven't moved forward one bit - a lot of movies are still filled with anti-Russian propaganda, but the directors never contemplate about the dark side of imperialist states like the USA and Britain. They are probably going to make a movie sometime about how the USA and Britain have never lost a war and how they are always doing everything perfect and never lost a single soldier in a battle. Go and watch this if you want to be tormented by the usual egoistic protagonist who takes out a whole bunch of Russians. A lot of people argued that the fight scenes are brilliantly done, but that doesn't compensate for the egoism and downright propaganda of the story. Lighting visuals are quite good and here and there you will find some suspenseful moments, but don't get too excited: suspenseful moments that have the potential to be constructed into psychological masterpieces are merely watered down and consumed by the apparent "heroism" of the protagonist.

title: A retired hit-man takes vengeance when the psycho son of a mob boss kills the dog left to him by his dying wife
text: I'm all in favour of a revenge movie (especially when the bad guys kill an innocent animal). But two necessary features are that (1) the bad guys don't realize what they are up against and (2) said bad guys pose a credible threat. This film fails to meet either criterion.First, the vengeance-taker John Wick (Keanu Reeves) used to be a hit man for the mob, so they should be prepared for the worst.Second, they are not. The way that the goons conveniently break cover and shoot to miss would be risible if it did not go on and on and on. Who knew there were so many incompetent bad guys? And what is a good actor like Reeves doing in this film? A big disappointment.

title: Disappointing
text: IMDb is normally a good judge of standard but I can't understand why this rates so high. Very disappointed spending good money, time and effort watching it in the cinema for such a low grade film. I would have been happier if I spent 50p buying it in a boot sale and could have resold it again the following week. Limited plot and dialogue but action was good and kept me awake when occasionally I found myself nodding off. Some of the plot is implausible and not to be believed. It didn't keep my interest and I wouldn't recommend watching this film unless your looking for a break from thinking too much and want a rest. If your looking for excitement this film is not the answer.

title: Well made but is this film healthy for its audience?
text: This film is well made, no doubt about it. And my reasoning for a low score has everything to do with the subject matter of the anti-hero, the obvious mkultra programing that has been incorporated into the sound design and the message of the theme song which is played more than 3 times through depictions of murder. The lyrics whale, "we don't kill the ones we love." Then suggest's we kill strangers. The extremely violent well choreographed scenes of gun play look like a masterful ballet of bullets and blood. Which made me really wanted to like this movie and I commend the filmmakers for their skill set. However I guarantee future "shootings" and random acts of violence will source this as material of encouragement.The story subtly suggests that the anti-hero is not one to idolize but quickly is countered in its sound design.Truly questionable material. I would not recommend for children or teens or anyone easily influenced by manipulation.

title: Wow. Contemporary film is truly lifeless.
text:
As a whole, contemporary film is poor, lousy, empty, lifeless, and just a waste of resources.This film is another of 1,000s of lifeless contemporary films, and is why I cautiously consider anything made from 2000 on.Note: I love classic film but that's not to say some classics aren't poor, if not entirely offensive. But as a whole, classic
film depended on good story, acting, and directing. Most importantly, if the acting leg didn't stand the whole table would topple.This is not the case today where anyone with influence or money can produce film.Here's my breakdown:STORY:
This story is on par with swill like "The Punisher," and so many "stories" about men gone crazy. Here's what you need:1. Fast Cars (think the film "Fast and Furious"
2. Wealth (why is it every one of these goons has seemingly limitless resources?)
3. Lost love of some kind (this was barely fleshed out here)
4. Conflict (this too is both weak and convoluted)
5. Bad acting (yep, but they still get paid mucho)Equally important ... the film starts in the middle of "I DON'T KNOW!" and then jumps like a flea into a kill-fest.What??? Did the writers and director (s) ever actually study under gifted mentors? How can anyone call this
story anything other than pus out of a vending machine.FULL Disclosure: The seeming hypocrisy here on my part here is that I thought the film "Blade" was fantastic. But
that's largely because it's very much off center and skates the razor's edge. In addition, having a lead
BLACK MALE doing the justice was way, way outside the white picket fence.ACTING:
I loved the films "The Matrix" and "The Terminator," each for diverse reasons. One reason in is that both leads
(Reeves and Arnold) have either very few lines or they are brief. Neither of the mentioned actors can act. Let me
reword that, most contemporary actors cannot act (well).The acting here is passable, but is nonetheless useless in the context of a futile story.TEMPO:
Bounces around like a ball of flubberCINEMATOGRAPHY:
DarkDIRECTING / WRITING:
After looking over the resumes here I see one of the problems: this was co-directed by two guys (one a kick boxer)
where it happens to be their first rodeo. The writer (only one) has a shallow resume with little but emptiness.Is it a good film? No. It's horrible.Should you watch this once? Yes, if you're between the ages of 14 - 25, and your idea of knowledge is Google.Rating: 3 (for the cute puppy)

title: Below average
text: This film didn't work for me. It feels like I've already seen this film countless times before. Basically it involves the good guys (or guy) against the bad guys and that's it. There's really nothing else to it. Nothing new or interesting happens. There's just some action which isn't very new , its all been seen before. When it ended, I thought, thank God for that. I feel I've said all I need to but the minimum submission is 10 lines. So I'll waffle on a bit more. Couching Tiger Hidden Dragon was good because it had exceptional action and it was all new and refreshing. But just your standard action flick, we've all seen it all before. There's really no story line. I was thinking, anyone could basically make a film like this - just have a non existent story where the goodies fight the baddies, have a load of action scenes that have been done too often and hey presto you have this film.

title: Comedy/Parody in the vain of Scary Movie, Meet the Spartans, etc
text: TV labeled this as "suspense", so I thought this would be serious action movie like Die Hard, or an "over-the-top" Seagal movie from 90's where the good guy wipes the floor with everyone. Even Arnold's movies had good plots (Total Recall), made sense (Terminator), or were lighthearted swashbuckling action, like True Lies. Instead this was a comedy scene after scene, I couldn't believe it, I thought may be it's supposed to be a parody of the 80's and 90's movies:1. It starts out nice, but then, he drives around the airport like it's supposed to be a challenge driving fast in wide-open spaces.2. He got no alarm or any safety on his house, and gets ambushed like a complete amateur by guys wearing hard soled shoes. His excuse was that he was rusty, but only a day later, he is not rusty any more, but, without any practice he kills 12 people, which brings me to: 3. This rusty guy has an aim-bot in his brain and hand, and kills everyone with head-shot despite incredible speeds at which action must be moving when a dozen people attack you at the same time.4. Everyone in New York knows him, everyone is afraid of him, even cops, people at "hotel", garage owners, and Russian mafia, but only the son doesn't know him. In the end, I was expecting the mafia guy to contact corrupt army general, who sends drones to attack, but when the radar recognizes John Wick, the computer sets and locks the autopilot to fly back home.5. When he attacks the son, and the Vigo, his aim goes bad due to signal jamming.6. This war machine foolishly leaves curtains open so any two-bit sniper can take him out from 100 meters....7. He lets the woman sneak up to him (again while sleeping) without, again, setting some kind of personal alarm 8. Bad guys shoot him 3 times in the club, instead of unloading 20-30 bullets in the guy that just killed half the club. He shrugs 3 shots easily. Carries no armor.9. He is in wide open space, only 2 guys manage to hit him, when someone is about to shoot from behind, he "feels" the aim and turns and instantly shoots the bad guy.10. He does all this for a dog, but before the film is over, and the bones haven't even decomposed, he find another dog like he has already forgotten about the old one....that's how much he loved him.This is only what I can remember right now, I'm sure there is more. This movie, full of fantasy scenes, strange motivations, inconsistent characters, and old plots (vigo and his bad son ), strange assassin operation (I bet they tried to get Morgan Freeman to play the black guy at the reception desk), etc, doesn't deserve anything but criticism, or these idiots will continue to put out movies like this. I gave it 2/10, official 7 rating is hilarious, obviously fixed with fake accounts and what not. I don't know why Reeves accepted this job, the second movie that is coming out will tank badly.

title: Overrated
text: I don't understand all the praise that this movie is getting. This review is from old school action fan. First of all the story is plain dumb, way too unrealistic and without heart in it. We've seen a lot of one against army or gang movies, but this one is just too much. I don't get how some people can compare it to Taken. Keanu Reeves is the same like in any other movie: same face, same gestures, same talk. Although there is something attractive to Keanu when it comes to action movies, he is just mediocre actor. The movie is also dark and camera is shaky so it is hard to see who fights where and who shoots. I didn't see much blood or gore either. On the contrary it seems like many shots were toned down. The movie is very inconsistent. In some places there's a lot of blood when person is shot; in others there is no blood at all. The conversations between Russian gang is very stupid and childish. I can't ever imagine how gang can talk like that. I give it five stars but even that might be too much.

title: Superhero movie for kids maybe
text: Don't see why any grown would be impressed by "boogyman".

title: If I was the doggie I would have suicide...that is how bad this movie is
text: No spoiler here. You can already see in the trailer that the doggie dies and he goes all vengeful so here we have, for the nth time, a movie about killers and revenge. Problem? This movie does NOTHING to add to the genre.Plain, predictable, boring, and worst of all it seems that it even took ideas from other movies, such as "Collateral" or "Wanted". It even went all "direct to VHS" with scenes that left you thinking things like "the guy you want dead the most happens to be right in front of you, you spent half the movie trying to kill that guy, and then for no apparent reason you just don't do it, just to try to kill him again once he is safety away from you...just WHY?", or the classic "bad foreign guys talking English when they are alone"...all the things that make us laugh when watching B-movies. Problem? The lead role is friggin Mr. Keanu Reeves! I mean, Keanu, my man, what's wrong with you? Did you already spent all that Matrix money? And you did some good stuff before and after so tell us, why did you find the need of making this movie? How could this topical typical unwanted and definitely not needed movie help your career? Man, I even liked Devil's advocate but this? This is murder man.So Mr. Reeves, I sincerely hope whatever financial problems you might be in, whatever favor you needed to do, whatever contractual requirements you had to fulfill, are now over and you can go back to do proper movies.As for whoever wants to watch this...just don't waste your time.Finally, if you want to ask why I did not give it the lowest mark the answer is that I like the golden coins thing. That is all I could savage from that dumpster of a movie.

title: I don't think is Keanu's best performance. Liam's Taken (the first one ) is better.
text: I didn't buy it. I really like Keanu and some of his movies are really cool and interesting but this one is like an almost complete nonsense for me. title: It's good but it's nothing special
text: I liked the film but I don't get what all the hype is about. I found the acting good and the plot was good but it was all just good nothing special. I kept waiting for something more to happen and it just didn't. Overall it's a good action film but it's nothing special.

title: Aesthetically beaufitul but an overall clumsy movie
text: I do not understand why this movie has that many good reviews. Sure, it has some good things going for it (choreography, some characters, nice action scenes, interesting places) but that's it. The whole plot (especially the first 20 minutes) happens too fast for the audience to even feel some sympathy for Wick. Dialogs are clumsy, some situations are ridiculous (and i do not mean the fight scenes, those i can cope with), the flow is just...weird. Oh and LOTS of clichÃ©s, really predictable characters with no real personality, everyone is kinda hollow and simple. I don't know, maybe it was not supposed to be taken seriously but it sure does not feel like a light hearted action film.

title: They Call him Baba Yaga.
text: The first instalment of the John Wick franchise doesn't have a such a good start. Even though the movie did have some holding pros that could make this entertaining, but I can't say it was very good. The story is about a retired assassin, his wife died, and when he is starting to get order in his life, everything breaks up. Throughout the film he isn't doing anything special, except kill people, and vengeance, and more vengeance. The action sequences was filmed good, I have to admit. Epic camera-angles and great light set-up that could make things even more epic. But then the action itself. It isn't anything special, except that he is killing in different ways. I wished that they could have more gun fights or more battles with martial arts, that would be much cooler. The script and the dialogues were weak, it was very little plot, and I wished they could put more story, to make things more interesting, not just action and explosions all the time! John Wick as a character was the only thing that made the plot more interesting. His lose of his wife was showed greatly, and how he travels through his emotional journey. Keanu Reeves himself was on the middle. Sometimes he did some great acting, and sometimes he just looked very fake and plastic. The villain just came randomly, and it could be better if the presentation of him took some time and made it more mysterious, the villain could also be more menacing or have some better character development. The big pro of the film was surprisingly good pictures and scenography, and I can safely say that New York did look very good in here. The music and the John Wick theme was decent, but very easily rememberable and catchy. But well, besides good pictures, some John Wick development and ok music, this wasn't such a good movie. Could have been done much better.

title: Not as good as i thought it would be
text: Ive known about John Wick for years now and i know many people who said to me too watch the franchise.Had very high expectations on it.So i decided to finally give it at start on the first movie.Keanu Reeves performence is average and pretty good, but nothing that stands out.Michael Nyqvist makes a very good performance.First 10 minutes were okey but then it gets a bit silly, lame and very exaggerated. Simply put into words: Too much. Like many other US thrillers.Manuscript is average, not good, not bad.Filming and music is better though!It lacks alot of realism and logic.However I've definitely considering if im going to continue watching the franchise.

title: No no no
text: I am a fan of Keanu Reeves, that's why I saw the whole movie. It is not worth it to spend time to watch this.

title: Poor script, over the top action, just ok movie
text: Although I enjoy action flicks as much as the next guy, this one piece of noir film with my favorite actor Keanu Reeves, it jsut barely makes it to my list of watchable movies. It is because the action is too much in many parts, while the cool dark vide of Reeves makes it worth while. Action is visceral at parts which is good for a younger audience, while a sort of maturity warning might be considered here. It has been a long while since I watched it and even watched the2, but skipped the 3.

title: A lot of action but really shallow plot
text: This is a good movie if you like mindless action. John Wick has perfect aim; he can magically locate his enemies and shoot them.However the plot is really shallow. John Wick just goes on a hunting spree.

title: Idiotic
text: This is the kind of movie that can make comic books look deep.If you want a good action, adventure, thriller, with no logic, but designed to manipulate your emotions without any regard for logic or realism, this is probably your movie.If you regard throwing, a person, John Wick, off a railing onto the ground 20 feet below, and having him get up off his back and run away makes sense, then again, this may be your movie. Otherwise, beware!!!Probably the only thing that I actually cared about after this movie ended was wanting to know exactly how John Wick "killed 3 men with a pencil." The movie doesn't answer that question. But it's probably the most interesting issue raised by the entire movie.

title: Well ... not That Good

From mr Reeves.Really slow pace editing, seem like the editors didn't have too much material to work on. Bourne-movies has a LOT cooler fighting scenes.The plot? You killes my dog. Now i Will Hunt u 2 the end of the world. Haha ...

title: Better than expected
text: Under normal circumstances I wouldn't have seen John Wick. I'm not a big fan of action thrillers and Keanu Reeves hasn't been my favourite actor either. The selection of movies was pretty limited at the theatres, so decided to give John Wick a chance.Have to confess that I was pleasantly surprised by the film and enjoyed it much more than expected. In particular Keanu Reeves as John Wick was very good. In the past the only roles that he ever looked comfortable and appropriate in were the characters who looked somewhat bewildered about what was going on. The first Matrix film in particular played to his strengths whereas the follow ups didn't convince as he was supposed to be a stronger character. There is no doubt that he pulls this off in John Wick, so will not be quite as snooty about Keanu in the future! The film itself is quite stylish and somewhat similar to Sin City in terms of style. Personally I found the on screen comments quite annoying, but the film is reasonably written in terms of screenplay. If you are a fan of action thrillers and/or Keanu Reeves I'm quite sure you'll really enjoy this movie.

title: love it
text: just wondering where the sudden rain and lightning came from when Viggo pushes John's car off the ledge on the docks. side question 0% of all millionaires go all the way across the city to a helicopter at the docks. love the movie just confused. if John is after me I would go somewhere other than my house to sit and wait.

title: Ugh.
text: This movie is full of cringe.People love Keanu Reeves, but I never understood why. He's wooden, doesn't really act and is probably being paid by words spoken, because he has no more than 30 lines throughout entire movie, each about 3 words long.And he delivers them as if he's heavily drunk or woken up from coma.Rest of the movie is full of extremely bad Russian language that sounds nothing like one, cringy scenes of gangsters singing lullaby songs casually (what the hell) and John Wick being called "Baba Yaga" which is - again - extreme session of cringe, because Baba Yaga stands for typical fairy tale witch, ALWAYS a very old woman with crooked teeth and big nose. In no stretch of imagination could it be middle-aged male assassin. How can't be in - LA that has 6 million ethnic Russians - even a single person found, who can actually correct the director and train actors a bit better, I'm not sure. It's the biggest mystery of 21th century.And then, there's action. Where each and every enemy, instead of shooting their guns, tries to get into John Wick's melee range, gets thrown around by one and same Judo (or whatever) throw, disarmed and shot into head. Repeat 100+ times. Rare moments where baddies actually don't go wrestling and try to shoot, John Wick gets shot, and producers understood that, so most of the time, enemies prefer the throw and shot.Rest is odd mysticism, like gold coins that seem to have universal value per token, and can pay for corpse removal, many nights and a hotel or a single drink all the same. In other words, stupid.All of this applies to whole trilogy, really, save for cringy Russian stuff that's somewhat toned down in sequels.So the main question about whole thing is "why?". It's mildly entertaining, but I really didn't see anything to justify fandom and cult following.

title: Most Excellent
text: John Wick is an action/adventure thriller set in New York City in 2014. Legendary assassin John Wick (Keanu Reeves) retired from his violent career after marrying the love of his life. Her sudden death leaves John in deep mourning. When sadistic mobster Iosef Tarasov (Alfie Allen) and his thugs steal John's prized car and kill the puppy that was a last gift from his wife, John unleashes the remorseless killing machine within and seeks vengeance. Meanwhile, Iosef's father (Michael Nyqvist), John's former colleague, puts a huge bounty on John's head.I loved this film. It has a simple premise that gives viewers what they want, including stylish stunts, kinetic chaos, and a relatable hero. Keanu Reeves is a skilled killer with fighting skills, assassination skills, and problem-solving abilities. The franchise is known for its action sequences, which are expertly choreographed, easy to follow, and fun. It combines humor with visually stunning cinematography. And the film's mythology of a criminal underworld with rituals and rules is a unique and interesting feature. But most of all, I loved how the action is synced to good music.I highly recommend this film to action fans and anyone looking for something different from the usual fare. It is purpose-built for genre-loving midnight-screening cine maniacs. I give this film 5 stars for being an amazing film.

title: SDONT FWTCH
text: Movie too short, lasted 10 seconds with his death. Dissapointed at the ending. 0/10.I recently had the misfortune of watching a film that can only be described as an utter disaster. From start to finish, "The Unwatchable" left me in disbelief, not because of its captivating storyline or stellar performances, but because of its complete and utter lack of merit. It's hard to believe that anyone thought this film was a good idea, let alone greenlit its production.The plot is a convoluted mess, seemingly cobbled together from every tired cliche in the book. It's a sad attempt at originality that comes off as a desperate grab bag of uninspired ideas. The characters are one-dimensional and utterly unrelatable, leaving me with zero emotional investment in their fates.The direction and editing are amateurish at best. The camera work is shaky and erratic, making it impossible to discern what's happening during action sequences. It's as if the director was trying to induce motion sickness in the audience. The film's pacing is glacial, with long, drawn-out scenes that serve no purpose other than to test the viewer's patience.The performances are equally lackluster. The actors deliver their lines with all the enthusiasm of cardboard cutouts, and it's painfully obvious that they're just going through the motions. Even A-list talent couldn't salvage this trainwreck.To make matters worse, the special effects are laughably bad. The CGI is so poorly executed that it feels like a relic from the early 2000s. It's as if the filmmakers had never seen a modern blockbuster and had no concept of what contemporary standards entail.In summary, "The Unwatchable" is a cringe-inducing exercise in cinematic incompetence. It's a film that defies explanation, as I can't fathom how anyone involved in its production thought it was a good idea. Save your time and money; you'd be better off watching paint dry or staring at a blank wall.

title: Bland story with outstanding visual aesthetics
text:
Looking through other reviews it's apparent that people either love or hate this movie.
I can see both sides and personally thought the movie was rather poor, but it did have some things to appreciate about it.
Let's break it down:
(On a scale of one-ten stars)Story/script/plot: one star. Really the story was just a conduit to carry all the action sequences. If you came to watch a film that has any plot or something to stimulate the mind or emotions...look elsewhere.Casting/ acting: Four stars. Nothing absolutely awful but no remarkable performances. Just overall a flat, lifeless story and script that left little room for acting to have any impact or power. Actors, again, function as huminod forms for the action sequences to operate in.Cinematography/ set/ lighting: Ten stars.
Here's were the film really avoids being a total flop in my opinion. The cinematography was excellent in every way. Much creative use of color motifs and dramatic lighting.
Very interesting use of specific color hues in key scenes that coincide with the tone of the story. Fantastic luxurious sets. Great chic wardrobe selections- almost like The Matrix meets Wall Street. The climactic fight sequence in the rain was a visual masterpiece.Soundtrack: One star. Here's one part of the movie that really cheapend any artistic value it had going for it. The music was just so hokey. It felt like it was obnoxiously loud and overbearing intentionally in attempt to leverage the excitement the movie was lacking.
Just banal and tasteless.Action/ coreography: Six stars. Okay. So this movie calls it's action "gun Fu." The coreography and action was just ok. Yes, it used longer sequences without changing shots and had some very intricate coreography.
But there was never any suspense built up or context to support all the action- which makes it feel less intense.
It all came off as an extended dance routine with lots of headshots.
The fancy gunwork and martial arts would carry greater weight if undergirded by some moticum of a story line or performed by a character that you actually cared about.
Without the subcontext the movie ends up subjecting the audience to watching an extended sparring match. Hollow visuals.Conclusions:Imagine the final fight sequence from the first Matrix where Trinity and Neo shoot up the security gate in the lobby while rescuing Morpheus...now take that scene and try to make that one scene stretch for a feature length movie.
What you get is John Wick.It did have the sense of a comic book in film format: the framing choices, the lighting selections and the (goofy) colored/stylized subtitles all we're direct stylistic transplant from comic book style.I'm sure 15 year old boys would love this movie. It almost feels like it was made by some 15 year old boys with their daddy's budget.In short, John Wick is a beatifully filmed extended fight coreography performed by humanoid forms with some obnoxious music pumping too loudly.
John Wick is all about the visual aesthetics. To that extent, it excells.You may love it. You may hate it.I don't regret watching it but wouldn't recommend it as a great film to watch.

title: OMG this so horrible!!!
text: Really hard to say what's the worst thing about this movie. Other than the writing, horrible plot and terrible acting it is was entertaining. My god.

title: No plot
text: There's no excuse for this. And there's FOUR in the franchise? BAH.There's a few interesting angles perhaps, but no interesting plot- it's merely a variations-on-a-theme, hit-on-hit(menANDwomen) that cannot resolve. I searched for a salient kernel, a second, maybe two that would lift this drivel to art. But the attempt was futile.Is Keanu Reeve *that endearing or have ANY kickass move that's not choreographed? Given, he does have the moves of an operator gained from training and practice. I can only imagine that the Director/editor must have meddled with his moves, because they're awkward. He's even unconvincing when, with 20 minutes left, he finally attempts to justify his one-man vengeance act. HOW does this rate a 7.4 from IMDB?

title: Feels like ultra length super stylish music video
text: My own scale of rating movies is simple. There are just three possibilities: 1 - Waste of Time, 5 - Entertaining, but leaves you unsatisfied 10; - Superb!John Wick is a perfect 5. Keanu Reeves is delivering a fine performance I am not really a fan of him, so fine means he is not annoying but entertaining. The reasons to watch this movies are:Much well paced shoot out action mixed with enjoyable martial arts. It almost feels like a music video when the actions scenes start to roll. You'll hear thick drum and bass club music. Fast cuts, painful stunts and muscle-car-show-off. The story is almost a no brainer, which is for some days perfectly okay. Usually I have my brains switched on generally. So following flaws spoiled this fast cooked action fast food soup:The story and development of characters is static and very predictable. What the movie also lacks is a real terrifying evil antagonist. Look, on one hand we have Keanu who really is bad ass. On the evil side we have Michael Nyqvist a mafia boss. But I don't believe him. I was wondering where is the real mafia boss not his writer.After all the movie is a box office success. If I would have paid a cinema ticket I would have regret the waste of money. Now on Amazon Prime its OK.

title: Dark poetry of shooting
text: At first I was content with the cinematography and the story. It got me sucked in feeling cosy and poetic about the choreography of killing people in large numbers. This film has a covert aura that wants to make you feel good about seeing hundred bad guys shot in an aesthetic manner. I realized I was enjoying how the lead character was shooting people skilfully and with style. There is no artistic aspiration or audacious in-depth exploration of the drama of life. In 'Kill Bill' maybe there was an attempt of that. In John Wick it is just a guy that uses his guns like a ninja his swords.From the cinematographic viewpoint, however, this is a film well done.

title: Russian and James Bond Tropes
text: The US never let go of the Russophobia after the Cold War ended. (2014 is an historically interesting year for this to come out. What with involvement in Ukraine and two years before the Russiagate hoax). Russian baddies is so overdone in movies, particularly Hollywood ones. Like in James Bond, multiple baddies can shoot at the protagonist and all miss, while he easily takes them out, one-by-one. Utterly absurd, no matter how good the guy is supposed to be. There are so many tired tropes and cliches in John Wick. Letting main characters get away because they need to keep the plot going (plot armour). Even the heavy rock music is cliched, with the distorted blues riffs, like cheesy metal. Not good. Not good at all. I won't watch the sequels. I don't blame Reeves. I like him as an actor. I blame the writers and director. Lest we forget: Russians bad. Americans good.

title: By the numbers action
text: Disappointing film that wants to be an arthouse thriller but is just boring and pointless. Keanu Reeves plays John Wick, a character seen so many times before - a retired hitman. There are plenty of films where a retired hitman/mercenary/special agent/detective/superhero comes out of retirement for one last job/revenge. John Wick does nothing to stand out from the crowd. The action scenes are well choreographed. But the plot is predictable and derivative. And John Wick is too brilliant, too superhuman, that there is no tension to the action scenes. Apart from some decent choreography and a fantastic albeit utterly wasted cast, there is nothing to really recommend this film. Better off watching the Bourne films which did this story much better.

title: I love the action and the actors but the story is nothing worthy of any of them
text: If you watched this movie and was intrigued by the story then I am confused. At best it felt like they were trying to make something that people would treat like a "cult film". Maybe they succeeded as the movie is talked about alot on the internet. I didn't get it though.

title: Shockingly Bad
text: I didn't think it was possible to make a movie this bad in this day an age. John Wick is tougher than James Bond, Batman, Ethan Hunt and Jack Bauer, and could probably take all of them at once. The body count is completely ridiculous. Or maybe just absurd, not sure. I won't give away John Wick's motivation, but let's just say he overreacts just a bit. You take a bite of his muffin, and he will kill your family type of overreaction. Stay away from this movie, complete waste of time, not a single redeeming thing here.

title: A Complete Ridicule Of Insensible Violence
text: Credible in itself yet rooted around one complete ridicule of violence over an individual theme of revenge which is universally baseless. A five outta ten is significantly worth the making. Besides some pretty cool dialogues and one-liners, the film does catch the moods of poignancy and darkness quite vividly and exceptionally though! Could've been a six from my side, but the theme and violence confined my mouse to five.

title: Violent, Fast-Paced, and Adrenaline Pumping
text: John Wick has some of the best action in recent memory. It is well shot, well choreographed, and engaging. The story is a simple one, revenge and it does work well with Keanu Reeves portrayal of a character that doesn't talk too much.There isn't much of a story or a deeper meaning to the film. It makes sense with the kind of film that is trying to be made here and it certainly isn't pretending to be deep or anything. I just can't rate it any higher if the the viewer is only gonna walk away from the film thinking about avenging their dog with a little dopamine high.

title: John Wick
text: 5/10 - needlessly violent action flick is not one of my favorites

title: Utmost Mediocrity
text: I finally started the John wick trilogy out of peer pressure and honestly , I'm not impressed by this one . The idea of a retired hitman who un-retires himself for vengeance sounded pretty good , but the director and writer butchered this idea . The dialogues were sooooo bad that it was hurting . And on top of that , they didn't even give us the chance to sympathise with the protagonist , to love him ( I love Keanu tho ) They should've gave us a glimpse of his life with his wife before her death not just some video or brief flash backs , I think that would've made us understand more his grief and anger . The whole thing is already a mess but they still felt comfortable enough to leave plot holes laying around in plain sight , this was just mockery . BUT , I GIVE CREDIT WHERE ITS DUE , the fighting scenes were sickkkk , original combat skills , whenever I'm gonna see a mixture of melee and guns , I'm gonna be like " that's John wicks technique"

title: Lacking anything of substance, boring, predictable.
text: The intention of the movie is clearly action and nothing else (don't expect a story line or any real character development), but I got bored after about 40mins. If you've seen a good action movie before, then there's nothing new here.

title: Really weak and unoriginal
text: Did i really need to see yet another movie with an indestructible hero?The whole plot is a chain of very used clichÃ©s. They laid out the plot in like the first 20 minutes and i already wanted to leave at that point. After that it was just shooting and even Ray Charles could envision the ending. Oh my god they killed someone very dear to him... where have i heard that the last 20 times? Yes Taken is a much better movie compared to this. Much more believable and with better characters.

title: Most bad-ass thing I've seen
text: This movie is a absolute banger! From the top notch acting all the way to the simplistic but greatly executed story - this movie is amazing and thrilling in every sense of the word. And not just as a thriller but as a film. It may be "just" a revenge angle but you totally get the main characters motives and get behind him quickly. Everybody who wants a great thriller that is entertaining and stylistic from beginning to end.. this is your movie. It's worth it for the fight scenes alone. To say more about the look and sound of this movie: It looks suspenseful and fascinating. Kinda like a comic movie. This film also has a great score and some perfectly fitting songs in it like "Killing Strangers" from Marilyn Manson which fits the story very much. So like I said, this is worth your time I think. Enjoy.

title: Opinion
text: I think they should which has john wick with zombies.

title: Awesome Action Movie!
text: John Wick is an awesome movie with action packed scenes which gives me an excitement. The story is so good, it tells about how john's life go through after his retirement as a hitman.Iosef and the gang stole his car and killed his dog. John got his weapons especially his sidearm to takedown those enemies.Viggo tells his son that John Wick is a hitman and he will come for him no matter where he go.What I like about the film is the revenge scene which he finally killed Iosef.Keanu Reeves' acting skills and action stunts makes the film more epic and amazing.Overall it was such a good film 10/10.

title: XKCD explains it best
text: Some people get this movie, others don't.XKCD explains it best:"Just once I want a real action movie. 30 seconds of exposition followed by a perfect 90-minute action scene with a huge budget, a good choreographer and a great director, and they should center it around some character we already know, someone we will never get tired of watching.Coming this Summer, Keanu Reeves beats up everyone!"https://xkcd.com/311/Still waiting for the River Tam version

title: Action, a lots!!
text: Action, alots of it! Too much of it.Director seems to be impressed be bollywood movies, where the attackers only comes in pairs of twos and obviously one others wait to attack until the other two have gone down.Also, somehow the attackers never know how to aim even with all the fancy guns and equipment whereas the Hero can aim from a distance!Never knew blind person can sense that someone is going to shoot from distance and duck.Some good locations shots and great camera angles. Great supporting roles. Film would be fun to watch if the action was reduced a bit and a bit more realistic..

title: Wick Equalized
text: I suppose for me the idea of John Wick was something like 'Falling Down' but without the social comments and instead of an ordinary guy pushed over the edge, here the protagonist is a retired hit-man. Needless to say, the entire plot is adequately summed up in the trailer and if you like movies that set out to entertain in a simple way, the comic book logic and emphasis on stunts and action here will be right up your alley. From my viewpoint, I hesitate to say Reeves carries this movie to a certain extent, but I don't want to take too much away from the rest of the cast, though some like Palicki aren't given much of a chance to demonstrate their full range of talents or have a strong impact on the proceedings for lack of time on screen. Nyqvist gives an interesting performance but is fighting against a particularly weak script even by action movie standards, and his Russian Mob Boss character often comes off as somewhat of an imbecile, even if there are deliberate attempts at humor peppered in.Overall, Reeves is appealing and inherently sympathetic with a sombre low-key performance sort of reminiscent of what he did in 'The Watcher'. Notably his physical work with regards to the action is commendable, but in my opinion it is a shame it was not applied to a movie with a slightly stronger script and direction, when compared with a movie that strives for similar goals like 'The Equalizer' which lacked those deficiencies and made for a more well- rounded and engaging viewing experience. Worth watching, could of been better, so ** out of ****

title: A neon heart that eventually loses rhythm...
text: After an extended absence away from the spotlight, Keanu Reeves reenters the silver screen watching memories of the ones he loves whilst nursing what appears to be a fatal injury. What follows is some of the most vivaciously pulsating action entertainment Hollywood has, perhaps, ever produced allowing Reeves to announce to the world "Yeah, I'm thinking I'm back" in one of the most downright fun blockbusters for an age (until it isn't...which we'll get to).I think the major key to it's success that often goes unappreciated is that it's downright funny. To offer a strange comparison: it feels very much like the humour of David Lynch. There is a beautifully strange straight-faced ethereality to the world it builds and the interactions of those within it that almost lend it the air of being dreamlike fantasy. The character of John Wick is talked about as if a Grimm tale monster whom sparks fear into the heart of the toughest souls of the underworld, causing enemies and society (police officers etc.) to, in a comical show of participating obedience, placidly comply with Wick instead of incurring violent action from him. The 'world within the world' of the underground society of assassins is so fantastically surreal that you can't help but laugh along when Wick enters the Hilton for Hitmen. Much like with a David Lynch piece it's the way it is delivered that becomes incessantly hilarious; the characters are treating the surreal world seriously, nothing they say is outwardly funny in itself, but because of the deadpan delivery the dreamlike foreign incertitude it induces can't help but make you laugh. And everyone plays along. Every single performance understands their task in this surrealist embodiment of American action.Michael Nyqvist is absurdly entertaining as Vigo whom at first is introduced as an all intimidating villain but is immediately reduced to a babbling buffoon once the threat of John Wick is made apparent to him. Alfie Allen really dominated this era at playing that smarmy wrong-un that you just couldn't wait to see the heroes slap about a bit and again he plays it perfectly here. Lance Reddick, Ian McShane, Willem Defoe; all involved just seriously understand the tone and delivery required for this piece to work. Because in it's foundations it is of course an action revenge film, with a suitably nasty inciting incident involving the murder of a puppy (a perfect way to get the audience to back John's mission to slaughter all involved), and to avoid being bogged down in violent revenge misery it needed to retain a tone of sportive enjoyment which is exceeds at for the first hour of it's runtime.During this hour we see incredibly well choreographed balletic violence vibrantly soaked under the neon lights of the Red Circle nightclub and Wick's home. It blends the awkward realistic grappling and sparring of street fights with the incredibly gymnastic efficiency of the Hong Kong martial art movies that no doubt inspired it, mixing fists and bullets in equal measure. All of this plays out in wide shots for which the camera remains a non-participant (no Taken-esque shaky cam here) with Reeves himself performing the majority of his stunts allowing the weight of realism to form an ionic bond with the weightless athleticism and create an experience that throws you out of your chair, let alone putting you at the edge of said seat. It also expertly weaves the musical sounds of artists such as Le Castle Vania and Kaleida to almost scientifically pair your heart-rate with the unfolding ramped up action.Unfortunately it is unable to keep this electrifying atmosphere and pace. There reaches a point in the narrative where not only does both John and antagonist, Vigo's, motives seem to have strayed from their paths but so too has the colour and vivacity been drained from it's world. The neon soaked nightscapes of New York City are replaced with the biting cold winter daylight. The once bouncing electronic musical cues have turned into overbearing rock guitar pieces. And the action feels less like a balletic dance and more like an example of militaristic efficiency. The world and it's narrative become more cold. The once superficial revenge drama now rears its head and makes the experience more uncomfortable than what was once lively fun.Ultimately it's a flawed but promising first step into creating that all too rare thing in modern cinema: an original and exciting new franchise wholly of it's own making with no backlogs of material to research. A complete 21st century invention and a hope that originality is not dead.

title: A sleak, fun ride at the expense of a detailed plot
text: 2.5/4This is a very Good Friday night flick. You're home from work, and it's time to watch a movie. You don't want it to make you think, you just want good acting, lighting, direction, and cinematics, and no expenses on the plot. For that kind of night, this is a spectacular choice.First off, it's not at all that the plot is half-baked. There was no waste of paper writing this script. In John Wick, the plot comes in a half-portion. It is very simple and straightforward in an intriguing way. An oppressed ex-assassin is coping with the shame of his past-actions and the recent death of his wife. The last thing his wife gives him is a puppy. When the foolish son of his old crime-boss breaks into his house, kills the puppy, and takes off in Wick's Mustang..."Well I think I'm back!!"On another note, the actors really fit into their roles. Keanu Reeves, who is a veteran in stylized action sub-genre, really rocks Wick in much the same fashion he did Neo in The Matrix (1999). This time though, he takes on a much more cold, The-Man-In-Black type persona... a man of few words. The action sequences are quick, flashy, and all produce the same end result. It can get a tad monotonous after a while, but in the end it conveys John Wick as a character more. It shows that a broken man who has everything taken from him will have the most incentive to get to what he wants. Alfie Allen, although his character is never able to be presented in a likable, preforms his immature young adult criminal. Another very sublime detail that you might not pick up on is that the mob is very talky, profane, and excersises little patience, yet Wick is a thinker. John Wick is a character you can truly root for in his conquest to avenge his anguish.Cinematography proves another segway to the movie's stunning fluidity. Toward the beginning, Sela exaggerates very dark shades of black, and airy shades of white, giving the movie a very docile and harmless feel. As the plot unravels, you see the development of heavy greys kick in, and as the action sequences commence, neon and black become the dominant themes. It makes for a very tidy feature with slick fight sequences.Another item not usually found in this particular genre... a good balance of everything, from an editing standpoint right down to the acting. I was pleasantly suprised that John Wick had the delivery that it's predecessors seldom did.

title: It's so mean the villains are as usual portrayed as Russians?
text: This is coming from a non-Russian person who thinks it's so mean they almost always portray villains as Russian in American films.This is very racist against Russian people and is indeed a form of propaganda to plant hatred towards those people.Make the villains to be also American, why do they have to be from another country in an American made film?!Imagine filmmakers in majority of films made all villains to be Norwegian instead. That would make Norwegians feel targeted and their reputation stained. Or imagine all villains were portrayed as South Africans. That would be absolutely awful. Why is it ok for the public to accept when Hollywood villainizes Russians? This is not good at all and people of all nations should stand up against that!

title: the avenger
text: Or me, no superhero crew without Kick-Ass's Hit-Girl could ever be truly awesome, but this one is registering strongly on the awesome-o-meter nonetheless. It's an enjoyably absurd and absurdly enjoyable extravaganza, both delirious and surrealist.Six gifted protagonists - Iron Man (Robert Downey Jr), Dr Bruce Banner aka Hulk (Mark Ruffalo), Thor (Chris Hemsworth), Captain America (Chris Evans), Hawkeye (Jeremy Renner), and Black Widow (Scarlett Johansson) - have to conquer that wounded solitariness normally so essential to the superhero identity, and team up, forming a magnificent seven because Banner/Hulk counts twice. Painfully, therapeutically, they work out their intra-heroic tensions to battle a supervillain who has stolen a throbbing translucent blue object called the Tesseract. It's an energy source that could
